comments.text: Best spot if you want to hitchhike to Berlin. Traffic and visibility was great. We were hitchhiking in group of 3 people.

(Towards Poland) On a Friday morning in august, many cars going relatively slow, great visibility and space to stop. Most cars have German plates and are going to Berlin or Leipzig, but Poland is definitely possible.
Many cars on the way to highway, nice spot for going to Berlin. Autobus stop - place to park. Perfect.
The Bus Station is currently under construction; got picket up within three minutes to Berlin nonetheless
Very good place, right before stoplight, cars have low speed so it's izi to stop
huge areal, loads of cars. we started approaching people to ask them to take us and found 2 cars within 10minutes.
Difficult to get towards Czechia. Wait for a car towards Regensburg. Don't go to NÃ¼rnberg Feucht, there won't be much people there going to Czechia!!!
nice drivers stopping at the join after the station, going both directions
Good amount of cars stopping, good spot for getting north
Under construction at the time (January 2017). See http://maps.rast.de/?location=cTVnehLvJ1bt9lkjTlpQ5vqboE8 for details.
We stood in front of the petrol station and held up our sign pointing towards Lindau. Within two minutes, we were given a lift to the Lechwiesen service station, which is also a very good spot.
Short wait for a long ride to Vaduz. We were two people m and f and we had sign.
took us 20min to catch a car to Switzerland (boy and girl)
Not even 15 min and a straight ride to Zurich
Great spot to Lindau. Recommend taking lifts to Rasthof Landsberg.
Due to construction side (10.2017) there are very few cars on this side, definitive not recommended until the construction is over

Perfect to go to Hannover. Almost 6 hitchhikers were already waiting when I came.
I took a lift for the next gas station in order to have less competition.
Despite there were 4 hitchhikers and despite they found a lift before me!!i found a ride in 20 minutes with a truck driver who brought me toward Leipzig!!
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9

Wildcamped at: 50.055, 8.9237 Just a 15 min walk.
Got a ride to the Netherlands.
Got a ride to Koblenz pretty quick!

Direction NÃ¼rnberg, Passau, Wien/Vienna best spot in Rhein-Main. The BurgerKing help a lot, because a lot of people stop here. Sometimes I wait for max a hour, sometimes just seconds. But I look everytime for plates minimum to NÃ¼rnberg because there is a next perfect gas-station

I'm not fully sure this is the place I got a car towards Koln at, but it it's Rest-stop Weiskirchen, then it is :) I waited for two hours here with a sign that said "Koln-Nijmegen" and then a bunch of punks stopped for me. The place is good (2 hours is just my luck), lots of traffic to Belgium and the Netherlands, as well.
Had to wait a bit longer on sunday, but still a ride to Koln in 1,5hrs.
Very good spot. Feels like this is an exclusive way to get to Koln and beyond. Highly recommended!
Stood almost at the end, lots of trucks and cars coming through. The cars usually go to KÃ¶ln and not further.
lots of people at the parking on a thursday around noon, first person i spoke to took me to dÃ¼sseldorf
Got a ride in less than 5 min. I was asking people for a ride to Duisburg and we got it exactly to our destination.
Lots of cars going to Cologne and the Ruhr Area. Some Dutch cars and few Belgians.

Two guys hitchhiking south via the A7. We were picked up in less than 30 minutes. We got a lift to Kassel where we tried heading south. However, there is a lack of good spots for southbond travel in Kassel, so if you want to farther south we recommend hitching with someone whoâ€™s heading farther south than Kassel.
Female, alone. Got a ride to Kassel in less than 1 minute.
1 min
Good spot - took me 5 minutes for a car to Kassel.
big ramp, even trucks can stop here. worth to go there
used this spot 3 times hitching both north and south! great spot!
Great for rides south or north on the A7 (Hamburg!), but a bit harder to get onto the A2.
great spot and sescription.exactly 30 min walking. thank you
A lot of people going only to Hildesheim or GÃ¶ttingen, but in the end got a ride more south.
Really an excellent spot !
Got a ride to Vaduz. Itâ€™s probably best to stand with a sign at the exit. Worked well even in dark.
Got a ride to Memmingen after 15-20min waiting in the end of the afternoon. We were two (m/w) with a Memmingen sign.
a really good spot, after some minutes a couple came to us and offered us a ride till Basel! really good place
I was sitting on the bolder at the exit of the Autohof lazily putting up my sign and thumb, worked great :)
All of the cars we asked for a ride north, were more than pleasant and nice. We got a ride pretty fast to Munchen!

We got a ride to Singen with a big CH and ZÃœRI sign within 35 minutes. There are a lot of cars driving by and pretty fast so not everyone is paying attention but it's a pretty good spot. We were 2 men.
I was hitchhiking on the corner with a big LINDAU sign and after 10 minutes a girl took me to the road 96, Landsberg rast station!
We were waiting next to the gas station, because of it was closed. And we caught ride to some gas station on the highway, where we caught ride to Lindau.
Definitely a good place! The first car took us past Landsberg, from there we found someone getting us directly into Lindau. Equally easy for getting into Switzerland.
first guy i asked gave me a lift to zurich. lucky me:)

Was dropped off here in the middle of the night, had a ride on its way to take us to Hamburg but while waiting a guy came up and asked us where we were going and gave us a lift all the way to LÃ¼beck.
After I found a lift to Allertal service station, 2 more people asked me if they could take me along

its a great spot for north and south. but for east its hard. i waited there for hours, then i went back and tried it directly on the a38. i don't have a good solution, its not easy to go in the east from here.
you can go there from gÃ¶ttingen hauptbahnhof by taking bus 130. it costs 3,20â‚¬ and takes you to "raseanger", which is the closest bus station near the roadhouse/gas station.
Perfect spot for going either north or south.
It took me about an hour to get a ride but that's probably because I had "Enschede" on my sign. When I changed it to "Steinfurt" I got a ride within 10 minutes. I would still say this is a good spot.
Gtreat spot! I just got there and had no time to even raise my sign and the man offered a lift to Dusseldorf himself. I was heading north, so I turned the offer down.Next  lift in less than 15 min!
I think it place is actually better for going north and south than the official at the webpage (I mean these in Roxel)
Got a ride in less than 15 minutes towards NL. Great spot.
it really helps standing at the bus stop (just in front of the entrance to the gas st.), as then drivers can turn in the gas station and stop comfortably to pic you up!
great sport point!

At sunday after a long weekend very crowdy. I could have got a lift to Berlin in about 5min (One third of all cars were from Berlin and I was even asked by people before I could ask). To Nossen it was a bit more difficult, but still 15-20 min.
best spot to go to a9 (north/south), because most people going a9 stop here instead of hermsdorf (directly at the autobahnkreuz).
Going towards Leipzig didn't take long.
Good for going East. A bit tricky cause after the gas station there is another restaurant with more people! Got a ride standing at the end.
Waited for about an hour around 3pm and got a ride to Munich
For my opinion it's the better place to leave HH towards south following A7. Better than Stillhorn, where most cars move to Bremen. You can get there by bus 143
depends on daytime. harder to get away from there in the evening or an night. when being there in the morning before noon, there's more cars than parking lots.
small petrolstation but enough cars passing through. Early morning is good to catch rides going far!
First Car!!!

I prefer the spot right beside the traffic light (the one before you enter the highway). So you can get into the car when they are waiting for green or some times they stop at the beginning of the autobahn. I recommend to use a sign. Usually I have a sign with a close destination to get to the next truckstop on highway and look there for another ride.

Waited for 1 minutes or less, i didn't even had time to put up my sign!
Got a ride halfway to Berlin to a truck-stop where it what easy to g
et a ride for the final part.
Awesome spot. I got a drive till the center of Berlin. Using sign recommended!
Awesome messages from other hitchhikers on a pillar... I wrote mine and a car stops. Life is great...

This is the best place If you wanna go north (LÃ¼beck, Kiel) or east towards Berlin. Alone I never waited longer than 20 min. Best spot is directly before the circle starts. There is a bus station which allows rides to pull over without interrupting the traffic. I recommend using a sign.
Super easy to get a ride to Munich, just hold our sign up with MÃ¼nchen and someone took us after 10 min

perfect spot to go to munich ... look for  the numberplate M like munich

But almost impossible to go Onto the A7 north. than hitch to the exit BURGAU (69) and walk to the petrol station torwards ULM. form there It took me about 15 minutes to get a lift up north.

Perfect place for going to Slovenia (if you are Slovenian :D), because there is a lot of slovenian trucks there!
Me and my girlfriend found a ride to SLO in the first minute there.
We asked drivers to go to Munich and after few minutes we found a guy straight to the city.
Perfect place direction to Ulm, Munchen even north. Many cars and truck drivers stops in this big petrol station.

Sunday afternoon:
Nearly everybody was going south here, but only a few people had 2 free seats for us. After 20 minutes we found a couple that gave us a lift to GÃ¶ttingen.
Stood right at the entry (where trucks and cars split) with a sign and quickly found a car to go with - even more offers when my girlfriend was standing there alone. Mostly nice people.
Never waited more than 20 min here in any direction when asking people directly.
I waited 1 1/2 hours for a lift to A2, east (Berlin).

Allertal is the last station before crossing A2. so if you want to go directing Berlin or Magdeburg/Leipzig you should get out here. most people are travelling to the south so it's not thaaat easy. but if you ask for Braunschweig you can get off at the next petrol station on the A2 in front of Braunschweig (Zweidorfer Holz). I've waited 10 minutes ;)
We got a ride close to Ulm, thumbing with sign, maybe 20 to 30 minutes (=
I gave up after 3 hours. My direction was Munich :(
We (two guys) got picked quite fast to direction Munich

I walked from the central station heading for the highway and it took me 1 hour walking out of the city trying to get a ride. Then somebody picked me up more or less at the marked spot and brought me to the gas station direction to Ulm.
to the a8 direction ulm, write a sign
We were still discussing where to stand without putting our thumbs out when sb already opened their window and asked us where we wanted to go, perfect! Really crowded on a friday afternoon.
Easy to get a ride up north. Early afternoon on a Friday.
Asked drivers at the gas-station. Found a driver who brought me almost directly to my home near Bielefeld (A2)
I was waiting under the bridge on the ramp towards Hannover, and got a ride from a nice driver in 15 minutes to Lepzig.

Allertal West; Extremely well used raststÃƒÂ¤tte on the A7, due to its location on the stretch of autobahn where all the traffic to Hamburg/Bremen and Hannover/Rhein-Ruhr converge. To the north the A27 and A7 merge, to the south the A352/A2 and A7. Probably the best spot north of Hannover, stood here for 90 seconds trying to get out...
Only had to wait for 5 minutes until we got a ride to Oldenburg
Rainy day, great place to Netherlands alot of young people. Got 2 cars at once hah, could have chosed which one I want to go with. youg german couple took me to Groningen, lovely
good place to stop cars to Netherlands
Direction to Netherlands.Perfect place stop cars in this bus stop.
Sign saying PL, got a ride all the way to Warsaw
Got a ride going all the way to Warsaw within 15 minutes.

i was kind of lucky to get something, 'cause the polish guys didn't dare to ask neither to look. i got a ride, after this, but just for a couple of kms, till the next petrol station. anyway, heaps loads of cars and trucks going over. If you get a ride, and need to goo further than Magdeburg, this station is better than the next one, that is a little bit out of the way. this is just straight on the highway.
Really huge service area. Lots of polish cars.
Great spot

Good spot to get out of Freiburg towards Neustadt-Titisee, Donaueschingen and perhaps even Konstanz. I had to go to TÃ¼bingen and people stopped offering a ride for part of the way, which was great!
Didn't wait 5 min to get a ride!
stood there with a sign to A9, took me 20min to get a ride. decent spot and safe to stand
Took this spot sometimes to hitchhike to Berlin and one time to the South, worked always great. There's a bus stop where people can stop
Great spot to hitch towards the city. If you get dropped at Ikea, walk cross the Autobahn bridge and hitch here. Loads of space even for trucks to stop.
It's a very crowded place. I stood there with sign to Zurich and a nice german guy gave me a ride to Konstanz
Very good spot, we have waited for 20 minutes to get a ride to Munich.
very good place with very nice drivers, they were very helpful. Took me 5 min asking the riders to take me south. Don't wait on the exit with the thumb up
very big service area with a lot of traffic.

Highway service stations are always good, didn't take me long to get to the service station after OsnabrÃ¼ck, and from there to KÃ¶ln. 

Possible to walk through from the nearby village, but it's a little far.
found a nice driver with a nice Lexus in 2 min:)

I found an elderly couple driving to Velbert which is south of Bochum so they could drop me off at A40 -Bochum Zentrum from where you can walk /take the Subway to Bochum HBF.
Works in the region from Dortmund to DÃ¼sseldorf (VRR).
Students can take you on their ticket  on weekends or after 7PM

Petrol Station Wildeshausen.

Easy to reach from Grundbergsee/Bremen

A lot of cars going to the Ruhr-Area. Bring a Map/Smartphone with you so you can check if they'll pass your destination.

as usual just ask the people  while fueling up.
were waiting with sign Dresden. After 30 minutes changed to Berlin and got lift in 5 minutes

good place, used it quite often, of course there're cases where you have to wait longer, for example i waited once nearly 2hourse, is was 7 in the morning, tuesday directly after easter weekend hitch hiking as 2guys... well but yes useally u wont wait longer than 30minutes..., well and u can get there by bus, if you go to Eichelborn, Abweig nach Utzbach or BechderstedtstraÃŸ. from there u can walk, just a few meters east there's a way to cross. the petrol station is fenced, but at the end directi
great for getting to the east, even in the night
the best place to start! you will not stay longer then 10 minutes. many people take a breake here who will drive to berlin or dresden.

Great spot to find a ride to south or Annaberg Buchholz.
Take the tram C11 to "Chemnitz-Harthau" (2.20 â‚¬ from "Chemnitz Zentralhaltestelle") than walk 100m to the street "Annaberger StraÃŸe", turn left and walk 200/250m you see the Bus Stop on the left side call "Alte Harth"
Super Spot in the direction to Annaberg or further.

The were some kids driving around on their bikes looking at my like they had never seen a Hitchhiker before. (Erzgebirge -.-) but just before I left they came by and gave me some rolls "for the journey" that was really sweet. :)
Nice spot towards Annaberg. There is a bus stop and the traffic is fairly slow. Only problem is that a lot of the cars are not going very far. Who the fuck want's to go to Annaberg anyway? :D
Great spot!
Best place to ride south
Got a ride to Uelzen in 20min, after first turning down a ride going to Hannover!
Bus stop Scharnhorststrasse, direction Uelzen. According to our driver this is the spot all the locals use, right next to the university :)
It's better to take bus 741 till 'SÃ¼dfriedhof' and then walk 3 minutes. I tried unsuccessfully one hour to reach A46 and then A1. But most cars were going direction Nederland.
On my map this petrol station seemed smaller, but it's actually quite big :)
Also a good place to go westwards, changing on the next highway cross to A46. Waited 30 Minutes on Sunday around  midday.
Going to the Netherlands, I waited 15 minutes, the third dutch number plate took me nearly to utrecht.

Once again, got offered a ride without even asking while walking around looking for a place to hitch. Sign Frankfurt. Solo female. Got ride to GieÃŸen (Reinhardshain Nord). Should be easy to get rides though, quite a lot of people.
this pertrol station and restaurant is like all the bigger stations on the a7 really good to get away

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Saturday at noon. We had a lot of luck here : two nice truckers gave us food and coffee, but couldn't take us with them as all trucks were stopped for the weekend. A car that originally went to Hannover then took us all the way to Puttsgarden !
There is place for cars to stop at the end of the restplace, and place to sleep in the wood west of the station.

'tank und rastanlage hildesheimer bÃƒÂ¶rde' ; an excellent spot to reach 'hannover' as well as 'hamburg' on autobahn "A 7". it took me 10 (in words: 'ten') minutes comming from 'kassel' to change to a driver that took me until 'hamburg' from here. you can also north/south change the sides of "A 7", there is a tunnel 300 meters east of the rest-area. the rastanlage has a lot of traffic comming through even later in the evening.

Has worked out great. The self check-in machine asked for how many passengers are in the car. Type in one more. That's it :) I kinda tried to like I would work there so people stopped for me raising my hand for greeting them standing in the middle of the 3 lanes going to the check ins. People will stop.

Cars queue before the terminal for the ferry, you can ask people that are waiting around. Unfortunately I can't pinpoint the exact location but the area is pretty small, just explore it a little bit, start from the building where tickets are being sold (Scandlines) and figure out the route cars have to take to get on the ferry. In April 2013 it was still possible to use the ferry for free because payment is the same regardless of number of passengers in the car. Explain this to the drivers and y
Got a ride to Leipzig fast. Theres some place for cars to stop but not alot and not legal. Worked much better for us than the truck stop. Our ride invited us to join him at a post punk club!
Spot is in the forest, correction?
Nice spot because there's a traffic light and cars get a good look at you before pulling directly onto the highway going west. I had to wait almost 15 seconds for a ride.
Got a ride to Jena in a couple of minutes. Spot not the best but it gets the job done, there is some space for cars to stop
Very good spot heading west or south.
Seems like a great spot. It's a gas station with a lot of traffic towards the nearby A8. We (two guys) were picked up within about 5 minutes, to our final destination in Heidelberg.

For us it didn't look like a good spot but eventually turned out to be a great one. We went in direction West and got a ride to Ulm. We waited behind the roundabout exit to the motorway, there's a little space to stop for the cars. By standing here you have cars within reach both from the gas station and from the road AIC10, which is a good amount. Several local people, they are very kind. Don't need a sign, accept rides even for just 50 km. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 10 mins.
Lot's of cars stop at this gas station which are heading to Munich or Stuttgart. One time I also got a lift from here directly to Berlin.

good spot if you are trying to go south, we were with 3 and got a ride in 10 minutes
gassstation where you can ask people personally
Good place for the south Germany, good place to Oberstdorf.
Plenty of cars pulling in at the petrol station and services. Lots of traffic heading onto the A6 towards Nuremberg
Tipical highway service area. Gas station, fast food and a restaurant. Good amount of traffic.
Easy to get to, easy to get a ride.
Bus stop after traffic light at the crossing of streets Heilige-Grab and Nieskyer, perfect for direction of Dresden and highway A4 in general
Got a ride north from the second car, happen to be driving to the exact city I was going to

take the suburban train (s-bahn) from the city-center of freiburg to "schallstadt"-station (three or four stops). walk on "lindenstraÃŸe" westward out of town and change later on L187. it takes 30 minutes to reach the petrol station. there are plenty of cars stopping. you can find drivers that take you to karlsruhe, heidelberg, frankfurt, kassel or even hannover (A5/A7). do not forget to build a sign. "a 9 to 10" on my personal rating. a perfect spot. there is a restaurant as well.
Very good for Konstanz/Singen! We talked to people who were charging their cars behind the station and they brought us to Konstanz.

Neckarburg-West

Good to get to Singen, harder to find someone going to Constance or Lindau.
Good place. After lights so cars don't speed + space for car to stop.

Direction Hamburg.

Exit of a Petrolstation and Burger King at the main road which passes into the motorway to hamburg. There is a trafficlight too, so drivers on the road see you as well. 
With a "HH-sign" i waited 3 minutes and got a very nice lift. 

Good luck!

It is a nice spot. I went in the direction of the the field where is a lot of horses and in one moment (maybe 10 minutes of walk) you will see a dirt road going in the direction of the highway and the resting area. Take that road and you will easily access the spot without jumping over some walls or fences. :)

I hitched towards west from here. There is a big wall around the whole place, so you better go the mc donalds and just behind it the wall ends so you can walk around  it easily. We spoke to the first woman that came for a pee  and she said yes.

I always send my guests to this place (Parkplatz Varrelheide) and they all said it was great. 

To reach it take a tram to NoltemeyerbrÃ¼cke and from there Bus 631 until "An den Deichwiesen" if you travel eastwards or a stop further until "Franz-Steineke-Weg" if you want to travel towards west.

Easily found a ride to Berlin Mitte with a really kind German couple! Around 13 on a Thursday. 

A lot of traffic going through, generally looks like a good station. Multiple cars going to Hamburg, Leipzig and further west from Hamburg offered me a ride before I found the one to Berlin. 

The toilet guard also let me use the loo for free, which I really appreciate ðŸ˜Š
Stood with a "B" sign for Berlin, a young couple took me in 1-2 minutes.
A lot of traffic going through here. You can stay at the petrol station asking people. Good for Berlin, in my case it took about 20 min to get the ride to Berlin.
good spot. we went to leipzig from there. we were standnig on the end of the petrol station

Rasthof Osterfeld 

Very good spot for hitchhiking to Berlin. Needed about 20 minutes to get a ride at 6.30 in the morning. 
The station has an Axxe restaurant which is open non-stop and has a nice covered playground slide in which one can spend the night relatively comfortable.
Good place to get a ride to Dresden
Waited about a minute here, lots of Poles going east
The gas station is called "Auerswalder Blick"
Found a ride to Kufstein after less than 5 minutes of searching.
I was here again in late July 2016. EXTREMELY busy all day and night long, but everyone is going on vacation, so most cars are simply fully packed. I had to wait 7 hours to get a ride to Italy!

This place is REALLY good. First off, I was dropped off there pretty late at night and I could find plenty of room to sleep. If it's raining, you can explore the motel area, where you can find a nice pedestrian bridge linking two buildings one to another, and I slept just beneath it. The next day, it took me 10 mins to find a direct ride to Verona, in Italy.
Senseless if you are going towards Dortmund. We had to eventually book a blablacar. I don't add our Experience since it was our bad choice - wrong direction
I came on Thursday at 7 am and waited less than 10 min for a lift to service station Ville.
Very good to get started, because every car here goes to the service area ville west. There's a pedestrian light with which you can stop the cars going on the autobahn, and then ask!
Very easy to go to Stuttgart there, even during the weekend

By far the best spot to go towards stuttgart. When hitchhiking to Munich I used a sign A8 even though a ride to the airport would have been enough. A lot of people go north on the A8 towards Karlsruhe.
For going onto B27 this is quite good. I usually use this to go to NÃ¼rtingen, but most cars go direction Stuttgart. With a sign it works.
I waited 45 mins for a lift up to Bremen.
I waited 10 mins for a lift up to Hanover.
Parking with WC, direction Bremen. As all the other parkings in this area are without WC, many people stop there.
Very good place. And there is a nice forest to sleep quiet if you have the chance to be there at night ;)
5 minutes waiting for direction Innsbruck, very good place.

When I got out of the car, suddenly a young soldier stopped right to me, but was going to Innsbruck, so I did not go with him. After that, one crazy guy took me near MÃ¼nchen in 5 minutes. So, quiet a good spot! Direction: Siegsdorf, Rosenheim, MÃ¼nchen.
Direct ride to Freiburg.
from france to basel people use the german high way because u dont have to pay

A lot of traffic, a lot of space, restaurant and shops.... People  who live in France and work in Freiburg do cross the boarder here. People from France come to get tabacco because its cheaper in Germany.
Quite a steep ascent from the station though... (albeit the beautiful view over the dill valley)
Good spot, got a lift to MÃ¼nster within a short time of asking people at the parking slots.
going to dortmund or kÃƒÂ¶ln you can take the gaz station on the highway in herborn
Love this spot...very good to get to the south...
after standing at the two gasstations southwest from here for to long, i went here and instantly got a lift
Very good for direction NÃƒÂ¼rnberg. There is enough room to stop and traffic is very slow.

It is easier to find rides early in the day. I got there almost at three pm and had to wait a long time til a truckdriver gave me a ride to a gas station near Hamburg. Think is one of the best place to get a hitchike in Padborg, though.

We got stucked here for three and half hours on Thursday morning while trying to get to HH. Very little traffic and almost no truck drivers. Would choose to be dropped of at some bigger gas station next time, seems like nobody was stopping before the borders, only people going to Flensburg.
Truckers headed for all parts of Europe(Germany, Italy, Spain, ect.) stop here. First guy I asked took me all the way to HH.
I was coming from north and wanted to go to Munich, what this is a bad spot for. Cars don't really go to munich from here, because they go via NÃ¼rnberg (Nuremburg) on A6 or A3
â€žLonetalâ€œ gas station. Hamburg works perfectly standing with a sign at the exit; Berlin, too.
A big gas station. It easy to find car which goes direction to Hamburg. I was waiting here just 2min.
HAVE A SIGN WITH YOU

if you want to go in direction kiel, its even better to go here than to the petrol-station "holmmoor". stood here approx. 70 times and always got a ride. even in a foggy night!

also good to go in direction hamburg!
Bushaltestelle hinter einer Kreuzung, sehr guter Spot
Good place to Freiburg im Breisgau. Less than one minute waiting with "FR" sign.
Good place to Freiburg im Breisgau. 10 minutes waiting with "FR" sign.

Stood after the roundabout. Not the most traffic but enough that you can get a ride quickly. There is space to stop. The cars are goig slowly. Had a sign A6-east and got a ride all the way to NÃ¼renburg.

100% doable to hitchhike somebody taking the ferry to denmark, just stand a bit further than the roundabout in the direction of terminals. at the gate the driver just says one more person, they pay the same amount. on the ferry get out of the car and ask around for a ride or just enjoy and walk off via pedestrian gate, nobody checks once you're on. safe travels!
By waiting near the exit with a sign, I was picked up by a German woman going to Frankfurt, heading back from her vacation in Sweden. Perfect timing.
Good spot in my opinion, on the highway and lots of traffic heading south
We stood near a Suzuki dealership and waited under a light but consistent rain for a few minutes and then someone called Henry picked us up and dropped us a little bit closer to Praga.

Best spot when hitch hiking to Prag! Only waited 30min here, tried it at the Aral up the street where I waited for 2h30â€¦
Go here! Right und der the Sign to the A17, good luck!
Nice little spot for small car to stop. We barely started and after 1 minute got ride to eastern part of Berlin.
I used that spot two times, everytime waiting about 5-25 minutes, direction Berlin. There is a small place to park a car
A lot of Traffic to nurnberg but u can also Catch Rides to Leipzig or Berlin even to Westgermany is possible. Just stand with a sign or ask people directly
Just stood on the corner thumb up and got a ride within 5 minutes heading north,
Literally the first person we asked to take us to Frankfurt took us there. Might have been a bit lucky but I think this is a good spot for getting there anyway.
Good spot to take the A3 south. The third person we asked took us to Frankfurt.
A lot of people goong south :)
great spot to continue south
They took me to the highway and I didnâ€˜t even wait 1min. They knew me btw which has to be mentioned
spot for going to South, took the metro line out of Frankfurt city and walk to here
Great spot! Only a parking spot and a free toilet but a steady flow of cars. Would not go there in the evening/night as it might be quiet
Great spot. It only has a toilet and a parking spot but there is a steady flow of cars. Would probably not go there in the evening/night.
Great place. I agree it is much better than it looks

sept. 2019. 15 minutes waiting. Ride to the border with Poland.

to the north or to the northwest, this seems to be a good position. find someone to change to the A3 if you want to go to Frankfurt or GieÃƒÅ¸en. Or find someone to follow the A7 in direction Fulda, Kassel.

Hitchhiking spot just behind the bridge (for cars to stop), if you want to get to HÃ¶rstel, get out at this ramp and hitch the last 3km. Pretty easy to get cars, though they drive a bit fast sometimes.

3min waiting on dark Wednesday morning in winter for ride to Haaksbergen.
Good in direction Haaksbergen, 20m behind the traffic lights you'll find a small bay to stop cars easily.
direction lubmin, eldena - excellent bus stop
Great stop towards Pforzheim, even hitched rides at 4 in the morning.
Very much traffic here, great for both directions.
there is a bus stop. very good spot to start hitchhiking from weimar, usally 15 to 30 minutes, theres also an gas station on the other side of the road to ask people directly.
Direction: Aalen/Esslingen
few traffic, many cars which go in direction southwest (GÃƒÂ¶ttingen, Kassel)
A crossing with a bay, maybe good for hitching towards Oldenzaal (NL). It's just 300m south of the train station.
deutsch: nach richtung penzberg trampen --- enlish:hitchhiking direction to penzberg
nach mÃƒÂ¼nchen rein geht super, auf der auffahrt aber vor dem autobahnschild stehen! --- good place to munich, stand on driveway but in front of highway-sign!

At the end of the village of Birgte this is the best spot for hitching towards Saerbeck, Emsdetten, Greven and MÃƒÂ¼nster. The road is only leading towards Saerbeck, and you'll have enough space here for stopping cars.

Great spot for hitchhiking towards Dreierwalde. Traffic lights in front of you, enough space to stop. Hard to get here from Rheine city, quite far out and dangerous to walk along the street. But if somebody only goes to the highway or Altenrheine, get out here, spot is directly at "Hotel Borchert". Ask people for this hotel if you want to go here.
Hitched from here 2 times up North. Key is to walk a bit onto the entry. Car or truck will pick you up within 15 min. =)!
Great spot for hitching towards SchÃƒÂ¼ttdorf or the A31: Enough space to stop cars (if grass it not too high), traffic lights in front of you.
there is a massive petrol station here, with a mcdonalds also, where it was very easy to get a lift south, to innsbruk, austria (& prob. also easy to go east to austria (wien, linz) also.
Just hitchhike along the street here, enough space to stop cars. Traffic goes north towards Detmold.

Perfect ramp for hitchhiking from Bielefeld down to Dortmund,  Ruhr Area, Cologne. Just behind the ramp there's an exit of some factory, so enough space for you to stop cars. These are driving slowly and can see you early enough. Perfect!

Great spot for hitching towards Halle (Westfalen) and OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck / A33. Much traffic is driving slowly here, going out of town. Enough space for cars to stop along the hard shoulder. Easy to reach from Brackwede Station, some meters down the road.
Use this place to leave this little village in direction Paderborn. Should be a perfect place.

Excellent spot for hitching towards Neuenkirchen, Ochtrup, Gronau. Just walk along the Neuenkirchener Strasse until you reach the JET gas station, then some meters further you'll see the traffic lights. Just behind, there's a bus bay with enough space.
Along the Eilersweg there's enough space to stop cars, thanks to the bicycle lane. Good for rides  towards Ochtrup, Gronau or Salzbergen
Great spot just behind the traffic lights, near the McDonalds restaurant. Big hard shoulder with enough space to stop cars. Good for hitching towards Muenster en Telgte.
itÃ‚Â´s quit a good area to get away! the people are not as ,,narrow-mindedÃ‚Â´Ã‚Â´ as you probably appraise....good luck!
Very good. Direction East

Rastplatz Ohligser Heide

Seit Jahren mein Startrastplatz Richtung Frankfurt

Nie lÃƒÂ¤nger als 20Min gewartet(m)
Ferryhitching is a great way to reach the nearest petrol station. Walk around and ask everyone during the journey to/from Denmark. See scandlines.de for info about departures.
Bus stop on opposite side of supermarket to go south
Nice Bus stop to go south/east
execellent position if you need a short lift to remagen (bonn) or andernach (koblenz) on the other side of the road
great chance in all directions! On a fuelstation at Highway A3 from south- to noth- germany (munich to cologne). I used it twice (workdays at 6.oo AM and 9.oo PM) and wait under 5 min.
Bus stop in direction Steinfurt- Perfect to hitch, directly behind traffic lights

Perfekt to Freiburg or Munik. West-East.
Nort-South is not perfekt but good.
double tramp Bus stations.

Perfekt to Freiburg or Munik. West-East.
Nort-South is not perfekt but good.
double tramp Bus stations.
Great Place to Hitch towards Kronach or Hof. Just wait at the traffic lights.

'hamburg - horner kreisel'; an excellent spot to reach 'berlin', 'lÃƒÂ¼beck', 'rostock' or to find someone driving in the direction of denmark ('copenhagen' or 'roskilde'). there is a busstop where you can stand, the round-about is a safe (for drivers) and legal (for you) spot to stand at. it should not take more than 20 minutes to find a driver. there is a marker place right on the on-ramp of the autobahn, people tend not to stop at this exact spot anymore as they are already speeding up. don't s
No problems to get a car towards Munich.
nach LÃƒÂ¶bau, Zittau
Perfect spot to go to A4 or stay on A45. Nice spot for cars to stop and good visibilty
To get into the city from the autobahn its perfect
As in many remote areas like this, you will look like an innocent long-distance walker. Very easy to stop a car, especially in winter.
good place, to Kleve (opposite to the gasstation) I waited there 30 seconds
Best place to hitchhike in direction to Radeberg. Never stood more than 5 min.
Great spot to go north. It takes time to get there from the center.
Great spot to get onto the A8 towards Munich or the A7 heading north
Many cars going. Not the best space to stop but ok.
We were preparing to wait for a long time. But it only took 15 minutes until a nice Ukraine guy picked us up.
Crazy good

nice gas station! At the dressing there are tables where you can eat and relax and if you stop in the summer can even sleep! We were thrown here at about 6 pm and by night we could not find the car, although we went to ask almost everyone, although in the morning (from 6 to 7) we were found to Dyorthmund. Most cars went to Amsterdam, some to Belgium. This is a good spot because everyone goes somewhere far away from Hanover's license plates. In general, the drivers of cars and trucks rest in the

Stand right beside the traffic light so people can see you from the car when the light is red(Make yourself bigger). As cars go fast here. 
Drivers can easily pullover at the bus stop, which is right ahead of traffic stop.

This is a great spot to hitchhike from! The third car I asked to took me in Iâ€™m not sure if I put it correctly on the app, but look for the Â«Â kiss and driveÂ Â» parking/Kurzzeit Parkplatz. It is great, as people wonâ€™t stay more than 10 minutes, making the flow of cars stopping there very quick. And because this is a big airport thereâ€™s gonna be a lot of cars coming to drop off or pick up someone and potentially from a lot of neighbouring cities (my case, needed to go to Bremen). I was there on a S
It's a pretty good spot. Got a ride after a couple of minutes with a Praha sign. The traffic is not extremly heavy, and there is a place for cars to stop.

Very good spot to get out of Oberhausen onto A3 in the direction of Arnhem. There's a traffic light you can stand next to with a sign. Mine was super improvised and it still worked in like 5 minutes. Not super far but to HÃ¼nxe which I knew to be a good spot to continue. Was pretty late, so I might have been lucky with Feierabend traffic
Lot of traffic, many people going far. Been there twice one time got a ride towards Chemnitz very fast, one time longer wait but ride all the way to Berlin. Sign recommended.
Lots of traffic, good spot to ask around. We got a ride straight to NÃ¼rnberg
Super good spot to go south. Everyone can see you and stop.

Nice spot, dirt/gravel place where cars can stop and lot of traffic. Close to onramp to various directions (west, north, south) it was raining and we were cold so we agreed to get driven to Pirmasens (direction France)  where we found shelter in a church

Really good for Frankfurt or shorter rides, unfortunatelly for us we needed south and desperatly needed to get on A5, when super sweet young lady stopped and drove us to a bigger gas station right on A5
Nice spot for Nurnberg, we just hang around the gas station where cars could safely park and got taken to restplatz under Wurzburg (bad if you want to go more south)
Pretty nice restaurant, and lot of cars going to Poland.

A great spot if you are heading north along A3. For half an hour I was standing with a sign A6 Heilbronn, but nobody stopped. I changed my sign to Nuremberg and immediately car stoped and took me to Wurzburg Nord gas station. From there it will be more chances to go south.
Good traffic at 2pm. Had a sign for wroclaw and at that location the cars aren't going as fast as the other location near this one. Polish people are very likely to take you

I arrived here when it was already dark, but there are street lights here and a bus stop so cars can safely pull over. It's also right after some traffic lights so if its red people have a little more time to think about it. Got a ride into the center pretty quickly.
Big station, many cars. Good spot to Singen or Konstanz
Came here by bus and hitchhiked across the river. I recommend stopping here instead of Nordenheim, since it's the biggest road leading up to a tunnel.
Great place to hitchhike towards Bremen. Traffick is not so fast and cars can stop easily. And just in case there is a bus stop nearby.
Perfect spot for asking around. Got a lift to Ulm

Spent an hour here with a sign saying "Ulm/Stuttgart", first possible ride after 30 mins but didn't take up on the offer because there wasn't a good spot where they will eventually drop me off. 2nd ride wanted to drive me to Ulm directly but decided to join him to Sigmaringen due to it being closer to my end destination.

Enough traffic to get a decent chance for a ride, a chance came every 30 mins.

High Traffic Area, T intersection. Was able to get two rides in the same location within 30 mins. Holding a sign "Ulm/Stuttgart." 1st ride had to return me to the spot because they got a work call forcing them back to Munich. 2nd ride drove me to a high way gas station closer to Ulm.
I was holding a sign saying "Augusburg/Karlsruhe" and got a ride within 20mins. Two gas stations and lots of niche where rides can pull over. High traffic too.
Best place imho to go to Stuttgart.
We got lucky here. Immediately when we hitchhiked from Berlin Airport a super cool guy saw us getting out of the car and took us right away. From here to Rheine is crazy.
we got a ride with a sign to the next bigger petrol station. fairly quick!!

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Saturday afternoon. We were left on the highway, in the middle of a traffic jam by our previous driver. We decided to walk to the next road after the traffic jam and managed to get a car really fast. There is place for cars to stop by the bus stop and we got on the ferry without paying as the fare only applies for the car and not the number of passengers !

enough place for cars to stop, we used a sign with "AUTOBAHN" and a sign with an arrow, which my friend pointed towards the place where the cars could stop, because its weirdly placed, it also served as a sign pointing to the direction of the highway we wanted to useðŸ˜…
We stood close to the exit probably even less than 10 minutes. Easy to get there from Berlin. S7 to Potsdam Hauptbahnhof and then x43 to Michendorf (summer 2025)
In my opinion this is actually a shit spot, but cant complain since we managed to get a car in less than a minute. There is not much place to stop, but it is possible.
enough place to stop, used a sign for NÃ¼rnberg, got a ride half way there in just a few minutes (2 guys)
Got quickly a lift to the Autobahn
Great spot
near the e-car charging station was good. Be nice to the woman who collects pawns ;).
lots of international cars, easy peasy
litteraly first car stopped, police were smiling and waving at me
Nice spot, lot of cars
Maybe I was REALLY lucky, but it worked perfectly fine :)
If you wait at the bus station cars can stop there/at the gas station next to it...easily visible spot and next to the highway.
Got picked up here towards Berlin in 10min
Good spot behind the border, cars go slow, plenty of space to stop. It was the longest ride that day.
Sign "MÃ¼nchen," very nice spot plenty of fast food.

We were 3 people with a lot of baggage, but here just going up to the people made us get a ride quickly. We got with some German students who also let us spend the night.

The ride was 2 hours
Got a ride after 5 mins. They went to Italy so took me al the way to Liechtenstein.

Waited with a sign in rush hour traffic (6:45am) a few meters in front of the bus stop. Really good spot because it is just a few meters from the highway onramp to SaarbrÃ¼cken. A sign could really help because most of the people are going to Saarlouis.

Never hitchhiked before but picked this spot at the autobahn on ramp trying to head to Berlin,
 took us (two 20 year old guys, one who is German one not) 10-20 minutes to get a ride to Brandenburg very close to Berlin. The shoulder of the road has a decent place for cars to stop once you climb the stairs to the top of the loop. Only complaint is no shade and maybe you don't want to stand on the shoulder like this.
Bus Station near by, good for east ward travel
Great spot good flow of traffic I hitchhiked just before the off slip
Realy practical for Cars to stop on the little asphalted area next to the road.

Good! you have show your signs en smile and youâ€™ll get a ride. The cars can stop easily on the side of the road or in the parking lot of the company next to the road. We were with 3 girls and we got a ride to Ulm in less than 10 minutes
Working well

Got a ride to Berlin fast (with a person going there to bring back a piece of big furniture). Lady at the shop spoke no English but was very helpful with getting the paper for the hitch sign (after we managed to communicate somehow)and even run after me to give me a better one after a minute. Easy spot to get to by walking half an hour from the train station, a bit uphill though

Got a ride with a young guy from Memmingen who went to visit his friend somewhere and luckily he didnâ€™t mind going through a different highway so I could be left at a better gas station on my way to Amberg. He blasted some great techno tracks in the car!!!
Very good spot to go in direction of Leipzig. Cars can stop very easily. And as they have to drive around the corner before they are going slowly and have enough time to see you :)

Perfect spot to go south to the A9 (from there it's easy to go to A4 west), West to A38 or for A72 to Chemnitz.

I'm using a sign with "A9", "C" (for Chemnitz) or "A38".

Cars can stop very comfortably and are going slow enough because they drive around the corner rigth before. Right behind you is a space to stop.
real nice raststatte, got a ride all the way to poland!

Last good spot in Germany in my opinion, try to catch a car for the border (more easier during workday evenings as a lot of Poles work around here but live in Poland), I was here during weekend tho, wait times of 5-10 minutes for shorter rides, locals will be offering nearby rides, but seriously reconsider them.
Towards highway, not that much traffic but convenient for cars to stop, some sort of parking and wide shoulders, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
very good place, plenty of time to be seen by an oncoming car, and an ideal place to stop, 0.5km away mcdonald, it can come in handy if someone doesn't stop. but getting to the border is a sure thing
Barely any traffic, but nice enough spot.
Didn't mean to hitch. A lovely lady gave us a lift to the service station would have been an hour walk
Extremely lucky lady came up to us as we were making our sign. I can see it not being bad. Not too much traffic though
Excellent spot. Got a ride to Denmark within minutes
If coming from direction Buir, take the train to Duren :) Here it is good to go west in direction of the Netherlands

Lovin the spot to go east or west on the a38. People are reacting and are willing to help. Try to get at least to the eichsfeld gas station.
Do not take lifts to Leinefelde/worbis since its rly bad!
A miracle that in such small town somebody directly brought us to Hamburg. And that in even less then 5 minutes!
Even at night people are always open.
Very good spot if you want to go to LÃ¼beck. Already after 10 or 15 minutes somebody stopped (2023)
Traffic lights and a great point for a car to stop, good visibility
The first person I asked gave me a ride to Berlin and there would have been plenty more people to ask. Sunday 3pm.
I had a sign with 17 on it and I was hoping to find someone who can take me to the 17 highway. After 10 minutes a guy stopped and drove me to Frankfurt.
Good spot. You can wait before the petrol station and people can easily pull over to stop. Also there are a lot of cars going exactly in the direction of Erfurt.

Amazing spot if you're going anywhere in the Netherlands. There was a lot of traffic and I quickly found a driver who took me to the service station in the south of Nijmegen.
In retrospect, I should have waited here longer and looked for a longer ride.

Long lane towards highway, not sure if this falls for legal or not, I was behind the guardrail and got a car within couple minutes towards north as well as a police car passed me before when I was walking there and didnt stop, so yeah, would probably still recommend some other spots to be safe
Very wide shoulder where cars frequently stop just after the roundabout where the cars are anyways really slow, lots of cars, direction Freiburg, wait time of couple minutes
Not a lot of space for cars to stop, but literally as I walked a car stopped and asked if I want a ride to Bad Krozingen, lots of traffic, mostly seemed locals but that was really great
Towards north, roundabout slows traffic down before, lots of locals, but might get a ride to Freiburg, got a car within couple minutes
Fourth longest ride ever, via the old YU & BG.  Three days. Five stars only because of the length.

Good spot for heading west towards Konradsreuth, lots of local cars but willing to give a lift, cars coming from Hof have to stop here, as well as good visibility for the ones already on the road, wait time of 15 minutes

I was really lucky. I got dropped off at the gas station but I wasn't in the mood to ask people after a long day of hitchhiking. I wanted to try the ramp to Nuremberg but a guy picked me up on the way there.
Really quick hitchhike directly to dusseldorf from this spot! Very kind looks from people that couldnâ€™t take me, and a very friendly person that did!
it's my new favourite spot to go from leipzig to berlin. you can go there by bus and walk a little. not super busy but more rewarding than thumbing at dÃ¶lzig a little more north

A small local gas station, but a good spot if youâ€™re heading to Kaiserslauternâ€”thereâ€™s plenty of local traffic. Hopefully, this spot works well for trips toward Trier, SaarbrÃ¼cken, or even France too.
Really good spot to go to Schaffhausen or ZÃ¼rich because there are a lot of cars going in this direction and the cars can pull over very easy. We were 2 men.

A lot of cars to the west. A car stopped for me right after I started to wait (?) with a sign saying Karlsruhe. I did not wait for a minute. I was lucky. 
They drove me to Karlsruhe. 
There is a good space for a car to stop for you.
Great place to hitch toward Denmark. It is where tons of Danes go to shop groceries at cheaper German prices! Tons of Danes from all over.
Cars going to either Dresden or Poland. Pays to make a sign for which direction you want. Steady traffic. May have to be patient but you will get a ride :)
A lot of cars driving slowly all going the same direction
German couple who are going to Norway picked me up around the gas station entry. good place to go Denmark
Good place to get a car to the motorway. Place to stop the car near church
jumped from one car into the other :D
Realy good Spot in all directions since there are Cars going every from Chemnitz. Cars can See u very good and can Stop in Bayern for the Bus.
Great place

Giant service station and parking lot, unfortunately only paid bathrooms. Asked the people who took me there to refill my water bottle (super nice!) and literally got in the car parking right next to them. Lots of people to ask and ideal for going down the A3. I was there around 18:00 on a Friday in summer.
Great spot to go towards EckernfÃ¶rde. There is space to stop and many nice drivers coming by.
Great spot to go onto the Autobahn to reach other service stations. Hitch with a sign at the bus stop, cars can easily stop there. How to reach this spot: bus number 16.
Rastplatz, got a ride to Cologne.

Much traffic going north (Sweden, Denmark, Norway). I was going back to Norway, asked a Norwegian driver, but his car was full. Then after 10 minutes a girl with a small dog came to me and asked me "Hi, What is your story?". Hehe then she asked me if I had a driving licence and if I drank alcohol that day. So she was going to GÃ¸teborg and then to Stockholm. She asked me if I would like to join her and help her driving to Copenhagen. So I became her driver that day and did it to Copenhagen. 

A

Easily got a ride to Kaiserslautern. I used "Kaiserslautern" sign. But a woman who stopped was going to Nancy/France. She didn't have GPS working that day, so she asked me to help her and she was going the same way.
Many cars stop at this rastplatz.

I don't know WHY I spent 4 hrs there!? Then I came to the gas station itself and got an extremely fast ride almost to Frankfur am Main. 
That day I learned the same thing again - always stay at the entrance of the gas station (in Germany!) and talk to people, sile and ask where they go :)
Technically a good spot, before autobahn, enough space to pull over, much traffic to Dresden

But stop, much space to pull over, the cars go 30 km/h. Got a ride to Drebkau. 
A perfect spot to hitch from Cottbus to Dresden.
20 mins and a small truck to Warsaw, but I got off in Berlin.

0 minutes wait! A car was going somewhere on my way to Berlin. They saw my sign and asked me if I would join them :)
Anyway, the gas station on the autobahn is always perfect.
Waited here several times for less than 10 minutes to go to Hermeskeil.
Had been to the other spots for a good 30 min trying to find a ride to Hamburg with no luck. This spot is better because the traffic mostly goes in that direction. There is space for cars to stop.

me and my friend (female and male) waited 8 min (close to the exit) with a sign saying SOUTH.
We were taken directly to Baden-Baden
Good spot can see cars from both directions. The driver kindly sent me to the front door in Szczecin.
Good spot, cars can easealy stop

Showed the sign Rosenheim. From here, many drivers head south from Haag to nearby villages. We skipped the first opportunity - a lift to Wasserburg. We found a friendly driver who was able to drive us both near GriessstÃ¤tt.

Heading south to Austria: We two held the signs for Rosenheim and Kufstein. That way we could convey that we wanted to go further than Rosenheim. From here we quickly got a lift to Brannenburg. As cars drive very fast at this point, the signs may not be read until very late.
From here we two catched easily a lift to Kufstein via the A93. In thr evening there is a lot of traffic going south and there is enough space to stop by.

On her way home a teacher gave us both a lift to Taufkirchen. The spot is easy to see and easy to park. However, as the cars drive uphill, you can also be overlooked as a hitchhiker. The sunlight can dazzle the drivers. The spot where she dropped us was quite bad, because it was in the center of Taufkirchen and we had to walk far to get the next lift.

From this place it took us (my wife and I) 15 minutes to get a local to take us south. It is a clearly laid out parking bay where the cars can park easily. The spot is also well visible from a small bakery and a supermarket and drivers have enough time to consider giving the lift.

Directly behind the McDonald's is a "natural" parking bay free of grass, which was obviously often used dir Card to stop beide heading to the highway. For the drive via the A93 - direction south we got a lift directly to Regensburg in only 15min. In the afternoon it is easy to go with the rush hour Traffic.

A small car park where workers park their private cars - a good place to start on the A93. It's commuter shift change at 2pm and certainly a good time to get a lift. We (my wife and I) could also find a driver in the morning weithin 5 mins directly to Landshut.
Wait a bit, but it was good
Good Spot. Cars can stop at the gasstation and there is a lot of traffic going to the A14.

Finished visiting Vitra Museum and wanted to head to Mulhouse. Got a ride immediately with sign "Saint-Louis". Couldn't have dreamed of a better spot- a shoulder just on the exit of the turn, heavy traffic going EuroAirport direction.
To Steffeln
good spot, all cars heading to freiburg
Ramp might be a bit unsafe place for cars to stop, but it worked out for me (at around 4pm)
Good spot for Weimar. We were 3 persons and it worked well.
We got dropped off at this gas station and just asked a few drivers and found a couple that were going to Stuttgart in less than 15min
30 seconds got picked up, good way to continue south, but there is only toilet in this rest station, only way out is to hitchhike.

Traffic to Berlin, A4 (Dresden, Poland) and GÃ¶rlitz. Hitchhiked without a sign and a man brought me to the other side of Niesky. If you are ok with town hopping in the direction Berlin its a good spot.

Saturday afernoon

I spent an hour and a half asking around at the gas station nearby trying to get onto A65 in the northern direction, but everyone was either on the way to the city or going south. Then decided to try this spot, which is right after the bakery with a sign that said "Neustadt" and got a lift within 15 minutes.
Sunday - late morning
A couple picked me up after 5 min. Got a ride to europapark
I got a ride to Kalrsruhe after 20 min
Got a quick ride to Hamburg in 15 minutes! Just ask people who stop at the gas station to catch a ride.
Travel to kaufbeuren
Sunday, 11 a.m. We had a sign Nurnberg, but got lift to Bamberg
got a ride with a driving teacher to wendland
Very quick ride with sign for Innsbrook, might have been lucky
even though it's not a petrol station/restaurant, there were quite a lot of cars. we catch people going to hamburg
Very good spot.
Good spot, bus stop + traffic light. High traffic flow and people slowing down. Easy to at least get to the motorway or towards Bad Reichenhall for further hitchhiking.

Very good spot, cars see you from a distance, go slow and have plenty of space to stop.Same applies for the opposite side.

Especially good on Sunday afternoon to go long distance because people who visited the skiing areas pass by here.

Plus, it's a bus stop and there's also a train station nearby, so you have a backup for the worst case.

Swung a sign with Nord A5 written on it. Waited quite some time, had a chat with friendly staff offering me food and drinks and was taken by a couple to Karlsruhe. Overall an okay experience. The spot is good tho, a lot of cars refilling at the gas station
Just started walking and turned around when I heard a car. Just used my thumb, worked brilliantly, got dropped off at my front porch.
Cars are going fast but can see you from far and stop at a little street. Swung a sign to Wurmannsquick, the guy who picked me up even took me across the B20 to make it safer for me.
Swung a sign to Reischach, very good spot as cars are going slow towards the traffic light. Was even taken to Mitterskirchen.

Waited in front of the entrance to the Autobahn, then when a truck nearly swooped me off the barrier I went to relocate to a better spot just before the bridge and while relocating a driver waiting at the red light waved me to his car and took me to NeuÃ¶tting.

Got a ride by a couple from BIH to the Allianz Arena.
Swung a sign with A94. Good amount of traffic at the gas station. People heading to both directions arrive here.

Waited 15 minutes, as it's a village there aren't many cars. Three cars came, the third one stopped. They were heading to Erding, I hopped out at Dorfen.
I swung a sign with Wurmannsquick.
Pretty good spot, but as it's on private property I'd advise to ask the owners first. As I know them it was no problem at all for me.
bus stop - perfekt spot in direction to Jena, enough place for cars to stop, lot of traffic, cars can see you, the only disadvantage is that the cars are driving relatively fast
Onto A7 coming from Lunenburg
Got one (very good) offer in 25 minutes in the dark.
Left the car and got 2 lifts to Erfurt within minutes
Got to Chemnitz very quickly
The second car stopped and took me to Bayreuth
Saturday, 12:00, 2 People + Dog
ok
what a nonsense

Many people going to Aachen, 
some belgian cars too.
Many people use this road in the morning. Better than BrennerstraÃŸe. Waiting time: 5-10 minutes with "PF" sign.

Great Sport Point! I got a ride to Piding (A8).
Try it!
To get out of the Ruhr Area, you can use your thumb and ask a ride to the gas station at the A2 in Gelsenkirchen.
Tramprennen 2015 <3 <3

Ask people at McDonnalds. ItÂ´s a common meeting point for sharing rides (e.g. Blablacar etc). I was waiting 5 min to get a ride to the first service station on the motorway to Chemnitz and 10 min for a ride to Leipzig/Kassel

Perfect spot to get to Uelzen!
Hamburg and Soltau (A7) also possible but I never tried it.
Sign is useful so people know which of the direction after the roundabout.

We were going to Eisenach to catch the main highway to Frankfurt. It was very easy, cause it was snowing and people fell pitty of us. hahaha. five minutes and got a ride. be careful of where they drop u off at Eisenach if you continue your trip, cause we got a shitty spot to keep on. Good luck.
It's a good spot to get a quick ride to Hannover. Just keep pressing the traffic light. Shouldn't take to long. :-)
Great spot, just stand on the space between the two lanes. They are big enough for cars to stop and you can try the cars coming from Kulmbach and Bayreuth!

Good spot if you want to go to Leipzig.
After 5 minutes of waiting somebody stopped.

direct on the highway is a junction and a small parking lot. nice to stand here.

very good spot to hitchhike towards Ulm.

to hitch from Bad Hersfeld to the direction of Erfurt. Waited 5 minutes. Not so much place for the cars to stop, but the traffic frequence isnÂ´t so high

Great spot, but traffic can be low late in the day.
Good spot. Easy to get cars to MÃ¼nchen. Even for three people with a tree ðŸŒ²
Very good spot, was super busy at about 9am. We were headed east holding a sign that said Munchen. Didn't have to wait long for a lift that took a decent bit of the way.
Perfect spot for going further south, almost too easy, just wave a sign and ask everyone you see
nice french couple took us to Strasbourg
solo male, early 30s, waiting with a sign and asking round

Perfect, the first car i asked took me away ;)

Really good spot. I had sign "PRAG".

It doesn't seem like a good place. Cars have no way to stop here but just on the road itself. But I was very lucky and sweeet Turkish couple stopped for me right on the road to pick me up and drive me whole way to Prague. I guess you can give it a try if you're desperate

After the next 3 cars driving by I got a ride through Prague and met some really cool dudes from Dresden I had lunch with.
Usually a pretty good spot since people go all kinds of places. I asked around four 30mins until I found a ride to near Arnhem (the person was going to Zevenaar)

However, it's not that small haha

great spot for visibility, interested cars can just pull into shell. thumnbed with salzburg sign and got a ride quickly

asked for a lift to Hamburg, the third car took me directly there

Got a ride to border Liechtenstein/Switzerland
Good spot towards Switzerland, I was taken by a Czech couple to Bergenz!

Do not let drivers get you of the A96 into the AllgÃ¤u region (like Kempten). It's somewhat close, but you will have to take a lot of short rides from village to village to reach Bodensee eventually.

Very good towards Lindau/ Switzerland.
Not helpful to get on the B17 towards Augsburg. For Augsburg, wait at the parking space near the big roundabout (St 2054).

here is a good spot but on a saturday in summer there were many families and cars with no space. there was also a vaction driving ban for truckers so i couldnt ask them for rides either. i tried thumbing from the end of the station but i eventually got a lift talking to some hippie looking people going to graz. a lot of the drivers who had no space were going to vienna or elsewhere in austria.

Had a ride to PriÅ¡tina via Graz, Maribor, Zagreb, Belgrade, NiÅ¡, Skopje within five minutes.

Great spot to vienna in firther. Been here a few times and never waited longer than a few minutes. A lot of romanians go through here too, so if you are lucky, you will find someone who goes quite far (if that is, what you need) like directly to vienna or budapest

seems ideal, but I waited here cca 30 minutes. I was standing at the end of the gas station. if you want to get there from passau, you can go by bus number 10 to the stop "hochlandweg" and than go up on small road under the highway bridge. it takes like ten minutes of walk to get to the gas station

Perfect spot

In my case I will be dropped at the gas station Reinhardshain Nord to go to KÃ¶ln and Belgium. Thanks Heike!

Big gas and rest/food station,
Took an hour of asking people on friday morning

kinda tricky to get a ride into Erfurt from here but not impossible
First I tried to get a ride directly to Kassel. I had no luck and decided to go to the last raststation before Bad Hersfeld.
Got a ride with the second car I asked. Not a lot of cars at around 10:00 in the morning on a friday. Lots of polish car signs and trucks, the people I asked were heading towards Karlsruhe and Ulm.
I was really lucky and got a ride directly to the vineyard where i was heading, but it is a good spot. A lot of french cars going towards the south of france.

To Dresdner Tor

1 min to Dresden!
Very easy to find a ride to dresden. The more difficult part is to get to this petrolstation in the first place, my grandpa dropped me off here bc  nobody took me from paunsdorf center / leipzig.

I only waited like a vew seconds and got a ride to Dresden, even though it was really foggy and getting dark. I've been very lucky. and very nice and calm people especially those coming origanally from this region of Germany. they have nice stories to tell :)

horrible place if you want to go to hannover/berlin!

Not the best spot but rather the only spot to get towards NE, E or SE directions. Sign is a must have.

direction leipzig, chemnitz

A lot of cars on saturday noon. Most cars go to Dresden, some cars directly to Prague, was trying to Wroclaw and had to wait over 2 hours. Toilets 1 euroÃ—Ã—Ã—

second guy i asked took me close to rostock... but there is not a lot going on at night lucky me then!^^

Great spot
Probably very good for Czechia and Poland but nobody willing to take me to Dresden. Got offered a can of coke by a Turkish truck driver tho, so canâ€™t really complain.

Very busy spot. We actually got dropped on our way from Berlin on the otherside of the highway. Luckily, it is quite easy to walk here from the other side. We got ride to our final destination of the day - Prague.
Was offered 2 rides to Czech Republic, then 2 into Dresden. Then a ride to Gorlitz.
Spacious. The petrol station and restaurant are a little further away. I saw more people at the petrol station to ask.

Stood at the gas station exit, tried with a thumb until a driver came on foot to ask me where I'm going to. Got a ride to outskirts of MÃ¼nchen. It was holiday season, plenty of fully packed Dutch, Danish and German cars heading southwards. Watching passing trains is nice also.
Had sign "MÃ¼nchen." Nice place plenty of fast food. Can watch passing trains

I was there for 1 Min :)

Unfortunately I had not that much luck with catching a ride. It took me approx. 1,5h to catch a ride in the direction of Munich. There are a lot of people going towards the south, but didn't take me with them as they were mostly in business suits and told me they were not allowed. So I was pretty lucky to catch a ride in a truck.
It's very easy to get to Nuremberg with this spot
Got dropped off and instantly picked up at the petrol station. Seemed to be a fair about of traffic heading to Nuremberg from here.
Shell petrol station with a lot of traffic to the east, at least to NÃ¼rnberg
Great spot. It took us about 1o minutes to get a ride at 9 pm

Good spot to go to the north. Not much place to stop but a good visibility and people are slow on the roundabout. Got a ride to Aichstetten with a Memmingen sign.

Good spot to move towards Prague. A lot of traffic is mostly relevant.
Really good hitchhiking spot. The three of us(only guys) manage to get a ride within 2 hours. If you are alone you have perfect chances to get a ride immediately (direction Brno, Romania or Hungary)

I stood directly on the street with my thumb and in about 10 minutes somebody took me to the highway entry.
Trucker took me to rostock.can recomend on weekdays
Perfect for direction west. For Hamburg get a car past Rostock because the first fuel station is Fuchsberg behind Rostock!
direction Rostock, Hamburg, good space for cars to stop, A20 in reach

It might me still a good spot but during the week there is not much traffic which is going far away. I gave up after 2h finding a lift towards Dresden (maybe better from Zwickau at the A4?), just saw a few heading to Hof/Bavaria or Leipzig
With the sign "Dresden" I waited 5 minutes for a ride to the parking area Neukirchener Wald. From Zwickau to Berlin I traveled 4 hours.
I started twice from this place. Took me both times 10 minutes for a direct ride to Dresden.

first car hit to hannover (a27 south)
very nice spot, for going to Hamburg(or to parts in NRW), but you really need a sign their.
For A1 East (Hamburg). Just outside the McDonalds. The road is quite fast but there is a huge space on the side to stop and people see you from some distance.
Great spot, lots of people going far. Got a ride to Stuttgart after asking 3 people.
After a night in the corn field, i found a truck driver early morning to lyon in 10 minutes. Ask around !

I got here around 12:30am and asked the staff if I could sleep on the bench in the McDonald's part and they nodded their heads. I covered my eyes with the cardboard and it was good enough, I started looking for a ride around 5am which may have been a little too late as many trucks already left around 4-4:30am but I was hitchhiking on Tuesday which menas a lot of truck drivers are in the area to unload or load their trucks and are returning West. After 2 hours of standing with a sign for Chemnitz
Good spot for waiting, at least in between boats (not sure if there is too much traffic when a boat is unloading for people to stop). Few cars, mostly local traffic but it got us moving at least.

Lots of trucks, easily accessible from town, on ur way there u can get water at the graveyard near. Think is a good option since west ramp of the town did not go well and east ramp seems to be under construction. nice forest to camp around 2 km to the north of the highway

Small place for people to stop and visible from the roundabout

There is a space behind the light to stop, so i think it is not dangerous or risky for drivers to stop. really few cars

traffic mostly going to switzerland via basel, however i can't think of another option for france. can be a bit of a wait to get someone who goes at least to belfort and can drop you on the porte d'alsace. it's worth the wait. male, early 30s, alone

the lady in the petrol station was really nice and gave me a free mini pizza :-) tried signing from the end of the stop for about twenty minutes and then the first people i asked for a lift took me to nurenburg. lots of trucks stopped here leaving frankfurt and the car park was nearly full.

seems like a quite good spot. was hitching to Berlin a few Times, but everytime waiting for nearly 30 min.

big restplace

Waited 25 min with a sign to Denmark, and got a ride to the border.
We get a ride in less than 5 minutes to Denmark. I gave all informations you need in Option 4.
Solo, with sign. Stay a bit before the parking area, so drivers can stop there. Good spot overall, good traffic.

I waited around 10 minutes infront of the roudbout until somebody stopped and took me to the first gasstation on the way to Munich.

ThereÂ´s lots of space and many cars were entering the highway.

In case you get dropped off here in the evening: There are some meadows behind the Bayern Muenchen fanshop where you can pitch a tent quite easily.

petrol station
Great spot to go south, cars slow down before entering the highway and there is plenty of space for them to stop
To get south/onshore this spot is fine. There is a parking lane. I would prefer this spot to the busy ramp off the ferry in Puttgarden.
The third person we asked was extremely nice and got us all the way to Leipzig.
Maybe we were extremely lucky but the second person we asked was heading all the way to Hannover.
Gas station on A40 heading towards east.
Great spot after the ferry! The road isn't a highway, so you can stand on the shoulder and hitch a ride.

We arrived here at 10pm in November and there were not many cars stopping. We decided to camp (it's just a 1km walk to the sea) and tried it next morning again. We were standing with a sign around 50m in front of the petrol station (on the bicycle lane) and got a ride to Hamburg after 20mins.(2 persons (m/f), saturday morning)
pretty good place to get a ride southwards. a lot of people come from the ferry. you can ask them directly, when they fill up their gas.

We tried without a big success. One of us was standing with a sign and one asking at the petrol station. Most of the cars were from the villages around. In the end we convinced one guy to take us to the first gas station on the highway direction to Arnhem. I don't know how long we would wait if he didn't take us. We took a train to Emmerich because we had the whole day ticket for the whole German region. There was a bus from the train station going close to this place but we found it out late. I
probably a very good place to arnhem. I wanted to A3. I waited over an hour. the police have checked my backpack.
Approached someone and immediately got a ride to Belgium. This seems like the best way to get from Koln to the west. Highly recommended!

May favourite starting spot to get out of the area to the Netherlands/Belgium/France. So far has worked out for me fairly quickly every single time. 
This review is super late, but I was there in May in the afternoon and found folks going my direction in half an hour by asking around. It only took half an hour because they wanted to finish their meal (which, totally fair.) I think the finding itself only took about 10 minutes.
Not that much traffic, but it was a sunday. Still got a lift to Aachen very quick. Good spot, lots of trucks, and a few belgian cars.

It was pretty long for me to get a ride, lots of People went to netherlands or close by or just refused to take me... However in the end i got a ride to Brussels (my end goal was paris) :)

Good starting spot to get to Aachen and beyond to Belgium or NL, easy to reach with public transport too. I wasn't even there at a good time (Mid-November on a weekday, very foggy weather) and still found a ride to Aachen pretty quickly by asking around.

In my opinion really good spot. Trafic is slow and they can stop at the bus station. The truck driver picked me up and is driving me to CÃ¸penhavn!

Awesome spit, got a ride to Hamburg in 5 minutes, car can stop at bus station

we waited 1h30 and noone stopped. then we decided to go at the very entrance of the highway and it worked in 5 minutes. might be too many people only leaving the commercial area (mcdo...).
After camping for the night in the woods next door I got a huge ride towards Berlin.
a lot of cars. I changed to the end of the reat area to get all cars. For me it was a good starting point to Poland (Warsaw)

A lot of cars flowing through here so good chance to catch a ride, 24/7 sevice area and people there were even nice enough to let us pitch our tent inside since we got stuck there in the evening. Can also shower for â‚¬3

stepped out of the car, asked the first people we saw and got a ride to the A8

nice spot, been here a couple of times. never waited more than 30min
Lots of families around 16:00 on a summer Friday, but quickly found a nice couple traversing Germany who took me around Frankfurt about halfway to WÃ¼rzburg.

Sat here on a rock with a sign saying â€˜Bremen?â€™ Got picked up maybe after about 45 minutes canâ€™t remember.

it is easy to going to go to A9 Leipzig ...
