A lot of cars, waited with a sign "NL".. and a Romanian truck driver took me to Netherland:)
the second person I asked gave me a ride to Utrecht, great spot for going to the Netherlands

it's really empty at night. lot of truckers sleeping one car/20-25 mins. quite a small petrol station-shop-restaurant complex with seats outside from where you can see the whole place.
got a ride to Utrecht after 3 hours
After 45 minutes I found drive to NL (Tuesday afternoon, with sign). Two more hitchhikers on the same spot, they cought drive 5 min before me.
easy to find someone to cross the border with

Arrived late in the evening and asked some people to Salzburg but no one took me. Slept in the near by Forrest on the other side of the highway and tried the next day. Waited for 30min before a Serbian guy who was going to belgrad took me to Zagreb

Please note, if you need a break from hh you can walk out the gas station and go to lake Tinninger for a swim or shower. Easy to camp around as well at night.
Good to go to Salzburg, ended up in this gas station sometimes coming from Munich, normally fast to get the next ride to Salzburg

This gas station is ideal to get a ride towards Salzburg. My waiting time was around 15 mins. Lot of cars coming all times. And yes, since this gas station is small, it is easier to approach the drivers.
first comment is true. I waited around 10 minutes, asked a Driver to linz and she took me strait to Sattled,  but the station is really tiny. On the other hand its good for asking face to face. ..

Better try to make it directly to the border! The station is tiny. So at some times and days hardly any car drives by. Most people heading for Austria don't want to stop before that because the gas is much cheaper there!
Got a ride to another gas station to the south of Stuttgart. Donâ€™tbe shy to ask.
never try to hitchtike to direction Karlsruhe/Pforzheim from here!
Got a ride to the gas station on the Autobahn south of stuttgart. Took me 5 min asking. Don't wait on the exit with the thumb up
Found a ride to NÃ¼rnberg from here, most people went to WÃ¼rzberg or Heidelberg though
Awesome place to start or get dropped off. Just ask people at the gas station if they go north or south.
Got a ride with a Norwegian truckdriver to a tank station outside Cloppenburg just on the Eastern side of the autobahn.
Great place to enter Denmark by asking the Danes leaving the supermarket. Took no more then 30min even though it was sunday morning and the market had just opened.
A very good place to go to the north sea or into Flensburg as well. If you walk down the road for about 300m, there will be a perfect Bus Stop.
good place for going south with truckdrivers, they stop here to drink coffe and to eat or repair their trucks
Perfect for going north since many Danish people come here to shop for liquor.
Got a ride in 15 min just by standing at the end of the gasstation. Lot of people stop before, but small distance. Found a ride to the other big rest-area before Achen
Reasonably good towards Cologne on a Sunday, but probably great for that direction on weekdays. I waited for little over half an hour for someone to take me to Cologne Deutz.
A tiny Shell station, but quite a lot of cars. Got a ride in 5 min to Heidelberg ona  sunday afternoon!
I needed a lot of luck and a lot of patience for Aachen. Everybody is going into Cologne...
If you go towards Aachen, you need a bit of luck or patience!
Chances are that a truck will give you a lift.
It was Tuesday evening, after 7pm, when I was dropped out here a guy who was going to Schwerin, but then suddenly an awesome african guy took me to Hamburg! Nice spot, but not so much traffic!
Wednesday 5:30pm. Traffic relatively sparse, mostly company cars, but after 20 minutes I was taken to Hamburg.
Changed here to get to Wismar and was lucky. But there are not many cars direction Schwerin/Wismar.
this petrol station is located half the distance between Hamburg - Berlin. So, most of the travellers have their break there.

On my way to Freiburg A5 south. Didnâ€™t see a lot of this place as I was lucky and got a ride immediately by a empty Bus. Smallish station with not to many lanes currently Construction on the road and often loads of traffic. I had a nice experience

I was with my girlfriend in the evening and we wanted to go north. After 40 min a guy took us near Frankfurt. I don't have problems asking truck drivers. Most of the people said that they were going south. I think they just say they're going to the other direction just to give an excuse to not give a ride to you

Good place to go to Karlsruhe. Good also for north.
Was dropped of in the night, so I sept in my tent near the restaurant.
In the morning I slept in (I dont ask truck drivers to get a ride) so when I started asking people, I got a ride within 20 minutes in the morning at 8 am
Wanted to go southwest (A5 dir. Freiburg) on Friday afternoon. 2 people, waited for approx. 3h. Most of the cars were driving north (dir. Bruchsal).
Saturday in May going to Stuttgart was really great. Got out of the car, asked the people next to us and they took me all the way to Lorch - so even futher than they had to go.
Got a ride to Hamburg with "HH", took second car at ~1pm. It wasn't a direct ride so in retrospect should have given the spot more chance for a better ride.
not very good spot in direktion to Berlin, most of people drive home to villages
good spot, bus stop, a lot of cars to Berlin or Hamburg
Great place to hitch on the A20, accessable by tram 2 or 5 stop 'SÃ¼dblick'.  Bring a sign for A20 East or West.

Stood at the end with a sign, a lot of cars park near the end so you can ask around and use the sign or a thumb at the same time. After 30 minutes a turkish guy took me to a gas station after Frankfurt. Pretty good and lots of traffic.

We were a group of three and weâ€™re picked all together after about 30 minutes of asking around :)
Quite a lot of foreign cars and people travelling long distances
really good

This place was very good. I came here with the last people that pickes me up. To continue my journey to Frankfurt I asked the people directly, the first try was successful and two guys from Heidelberg took me with to Frankfurt Airport.

This place for whatever reason gave me no luck at all. I got there late and camped overnight, the next day it was raining. In the morning (from 8am til 12.30) mostly business men, or older couples were passing by, and even the truck drivers I asked informed me they were turning of to a depo before the next stn on A3. Frustrated I crossed the bridge and got a ride North in 20mins

Not really busy in the morning, after 90 minutes a guy approached us and offered us a ride to Nuremberg. We were just standing before the ramp to the highway, so maybe it's better to try to talk to people
I asked at the gas station if they have some cardboard for me while the cashier handed me some a customer asked where I need to go and got me near NÃ¼rnberg

I asked an Albanian guy who asked to see my ID and whether I was German. He was worried about me delivering drugs, and then being searched by highway police. There are a lot of searches by police this close to the czech border. 

Found a ride after 12min to Bayrischer Wald, the next big rest stop.
It took us two tries to hitch a ride, so we would say it was a good experience. A gas station is almost always a good place to hitchhike and so is this one.
the busstop is called Hoffeldweg by the way

Quiete a good spot towards Denmark and Sweden, unfortunately I arrived at 5 pm at Buddikate Ost and until I gave up at 8 pm I want able to get a lift towards the ferry in Puttgarden, quiet soon after arriving at the petrol station  though I met multiple truck driver who would head towards Sweden the next morning (I thought that I would be able to catch a ride that evening so I  didn't paided sufficient attention to this). After sleeping in my tent I got up the next morning and was able to catch
Fantastic spot towards Denmark.
We got a ride to Copenhagen in 15 minutes! There are lots of cars stopping at this gas station so lots of potential rides

Late afternoon. Lots of people that take the ferry early next morning and are going to spent the night in LÃ¼beck. Eventually got a ride to Fehmarn. Paid the ticket (20euro) and successfully hitch a ride to Kopenhagen on the ferry.

Not an awesome spots on early morning. Not a busy place around 8 or 8:30am. Don't wait with a sign, just go and ask people. A nice elder-surfer-rocker with long white hair and beard took me to LÃ¼beck after asking him !

I was there late in the evening, not much traffic and idea was to spend a night there if nobody stops. Surprisingly this was one of the best hitchhiking experience, two local girls approached me interested wtf I am doing and invited me to their place for dinner and sleepover. The next morning it was quite easy to find a ride.

asking around the mcdonalds in the early afternoon proved to be better than at the petrol station, got a ride past berlin and a place to sleep!
worth noting i only went there bcs the petrol station immediately before was closed; this probably increased traffic significantly.
Had a sign saying Stuttgart / ZÃ¼rich. Got a ride quite fast to Konstanz (border of Germany and Switzerland). Lots of traffic.
Or wait at the traffic light - you'll catch people turning from the road onto the A as well as cars leaving the gas station.
You can wait immediately at the drive-up, there's enough space for you to wait safely and for the driver to stop just behind you. The first person passing gave me a lift.
Not the best spot, cars go fast and not enough place to stop
On a race three teams left in a total of 5 minutes with 3 different cars. was really easy.
Good spot to head East.

I stayed in one of the parking places for cars near the sidewalk but it must have a place for a car to park for you. I stayed on this street SchwarzwaldstraÃŸe 20, right before the turn near the bridge. Got a ride in 5 min to Villinden Schwenningen
Stood there for almost 2 hours but very early sunday morning, maybe more the time than the spot...

Good spot! Huge gasstation with restaurant and kiosk. A lot of people that travel far stop there for a break and it is very busy. We stayed not at the gasstation but a bit behind where the road makes a curve. Easy to stop and cars go slow. Got a ride to Munich directly.
Safe Gas station, Ksenia took as to Stuttgart
good spot, took us a while though to get a ride to Munich as a couple
Very good to continue south on A9. I got a ride to Munich in 40 mins.
Also found a ride direct to Munich pretty quickly. And theres free wifi in the lofted cafe and burger king.
Some people from Dresden asked us if we wanted to join. We were 2 people. Alot of Chech cars too.

This spot had a surprising amount of people even at 8 pm. We had only asked a couple of drivers of we could hitch a ride to Dresden before we were approached and offered a ride. We saw a lot of families stopping here, so finding a ride as a pair could be more difficult.
10 minutes and to dresden, pretty sweet
1 and half to dresden
It is a little, normaally frequented place. The people here are nice and usually go direction Dresden, you don't have to ask often. Once I had a good experience here
Great spot. After a few minutes I got offered some rides. Didnt even take an hour to get to bremen.
Go BEYOND the traffic lights: there's a space where cars can stop on the ramp itself.

I stand one and a half houer. A lot of People drive to Bremen..
When it is rainy the people dont want too stopped.!
first try i stood for about 90 minutes before getting a ride. second time i stood for about 3 hours and noone stopped.
looked like a awsome spot but took over 1 hour to get a ride to the gas station on the highway, and thats with a sign BH (bremen)
Got a ride towards Munich really quickly here. It is easy to get here with public transport.

Not in direction West! For that I suggest the other motorway entrances in Western Stuttgart (e.g. Vaihingen) Local people told us the same, too. But all in all, a good spot with many local cars which go about 50 km from here to South or East (on the highway). We got a ride in 15 minutes even on Saturday evening 11:30pm! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 15 mins
Waited 40 min. with a "MÃœNCHEN / AUGSBURG" sign and got a ride directly to Augsburg where I wanted to go. Only good to get a ride south (B27) or east (A8).
Just before the double lane starts, there's a  cool  spot (bus stop) where cars are still going slow. Waited 1 hour to Ulm (with a Munich sign) a sunday morning
Its a good spot for going east or south, but not for going direction Karlsruhe. Senseless.
Some nice couple taked us in the moment when we was there
Good place if you want to go north or south on the A5.
I got a ride a little bit after Kaiserslautern. Not so high traffic, but can work!
When you are travelling west, it is best to ask drivers to take you to the next station in hockenheim.
When in need of food don't forget to go to the nearest Lidl just about the roundabout - much cheaper than on the gas station! Ask lorry drivers if you can't find it.
Mostly local license plates and full Dutch holiday-goers. Found a Belgian couple eventually
Found some french people that could drop me to baden baden. Good gastation to continue further south after.
After an hour in the evening i accept a ride north even though i wanted to go south. Because then I could stop at Bruchsal and try going south from there, without all the people for north.
A perfect spot or gas station if youâ€™re heading to southwest Germany. Donâ€™t hesitate to ask driversâ€”I managed to get a ride all the way to a place nearby Kaiserslautern.

This exact spot, in the curve when two exits meet, is only for North! South exit is at the other end of the station. Walk around and read the boards carefully first! Huge resting area, filling station plus restaurant, but few cars stopped for us. Nearly impossible to get to France with one ride from here, none of the French drivers gave us a lift. Accept offers to Karlsruhe!
2 persons (me & my girlfriend), Sunday, dir. France, 2 hours.
Lots of traffic, lots of trucks - good spot.
This place is not very busy... only few cars going by. It was worth the wait though and I got a direct ride to Amsterdam after 1 and a half hours.
No Problem to Cologne, hard to find someone to go on A48 to the West. Maybe you can find someone for A61 and change direction in Mendig for A48
After 1 minute a Belgian car stopped and the friendly couple took me all the way to Antwerp, right where my bike stood. Thank you very much!
Long rides everywhere! :D
Tried to go west, doesn't work, tool a lift to munich.
Thereâ€™s a roundabout where you can stand with a sign, easy pickup, since the cars are quite slow
I was there again a couple of days ago and got a ride to south of Munich after 40 mins. Very busy place

Southward works perfectly. I thumbed at the end of the gas station, when the road feeds back into the highway. Three people that were walking around the area even spontaneously offered me a ride. The third one was right for me, DIRECTLY to Rome, Italy.
easy to get a ride to munich

Didnâ€™t get a rideâ€¦
Cars go fairly fast and traffic is mostly local out of Lubeck.
I waited for about 20 minutes and then a road worker arrived and told me itâ€™s already part of the highway and I could get in trouble with the police. So I decided to take the bus instead.

Got a ride to Heiligenhafen after 20min standing with a sigh Copenhagen and Puttgarden. People are getting faster to enter the highway but there's some place to stop on the bifurcation right after the little bridge that cross the pedestrian way.

The spot is a bit overgrown but still decent visibility and reaction time for cars. Waited 3 hours for a ride to Puttgarden but no luck. (solo guy, Sunday early evening) Got some offers for places closer but I'm not too sure if it's smart to take them or not. Ended up taking the bus from the main station.
If you go north, don't take a car that does NOT go at least onto Fehmarn island! I t makes things a lot harder. Good spot
We tried to get to Poland using the A38 to Leipzig, but the cars that stopped all wanted to go Northern so we decided to take a lift to Braunschweig and then head Eastern
Great spot to get a ride to GÃ¶ttingen, I would recommend a sign (Norden/ GÃ–) since it worked well for us that way
Nice spot if you want to go both Leipzig or Frankfurt.
Hitchhiked with a sign "A38 Leipzig" at 3 PM and got a ride even to Dresden after 2 minutes.

Two times I hitchhiked from this place. To Frankfurt it took me ~40 minutes and to Leipzig ~
10 minutes waiting time.
Just had to ask 3 people.
Slow traffic, got a ride to Poznan after asking around for an hour.

Most people here go straight onto the A115 into Berlin, so I recommend trying to find a short ride to at least the next gas station, were more people are continuing towards Poznan, Dresden, or Wroclaw.
Shit loads of PL traffic. Easy.
Got lift in direction of Wroclaw easily. Then I guess could be useful to go to Dresden as well.
Empty bus took us all the way to Berlin
Got a ride to Lubeck in 10 min, just stood on the bus stop (two guys). Highly recommend to use this place!
Got a ride to Berlin after a little while, it has more space for people to pull over than at the bus stop just across the street, since its also a turning lane.

The two of us tried to hitch a ride in this spot, with no success. There are a lot of cars and their speed is not very high, but the cars on the outer lane (the one closer to you) are turning to the local neighborhoods on the roundabout and the ones you want to catch going to Berlin are on the inner one. We gave up after more than two hours and moved to the Caspar Voght Str. spot, where it was much easier. Already in the car, we saw another hitchhiker there going to Lubeck. We hope she also mana
Heaps of cars driving past but hard to stop or slow down. I waited over 2 hours and nobody stopped. Then, I decided to took Flixbus to Berlin for 8 â‚¬ in August 2015.
Lots of local traffic when I was there, but two guys who went to Bremen, took me to the next gas station on the highway.

Very nice spot. A lot of traffic goes by here. Got a ride within 5/10 minutes to Bremen. Better to ask with the people pumping gas but standing at the side of the road with a sign is also fine. Traffic does move fast there though.
Was immediately picked up by guy going to Hannover to pick up some materials. Seems like a good spot, or maybe I was just extremely lucky.

One of the best spots in Hamburg. But for south or west you want to get a short ride to next gas station on the Highway, Autobahn-RaststÃ¤tte Stillhorn, and then look for a good ride.  Next spot has more traffic going more directions.

Morning and evening with commuter traffic is best here.
Waited for just 5min and then got a ride outside the city to another fuel station.
Still a good spot, many open people going for a long ride. Just ask at the petrol station
I hitchhiked twice from this place. First time to Wroclaw (10 min) and second time to GÃ¶rlitz (20 minutes). Both times I asked at the fuel station.
got lift to wroclaw directly to the center for 3 people within 1h. just ask the drivers at the gas station or the parking lots
Got direct lift to Wroclaw. (2 people)
Except sundays, many Polish truck drivers stop here on their way east.
Great spot, got three offers in 25 minutes.
Dont even think of trying to go towards east on A38...imposible :( going towards south however is easy from here :)

within two hours 10 cars stopped and offered me rides to all over southern Germany. Unfortunately I had to go to the countryside but it shows that chances are good to get a lift further down south the A7 from here.
Nice station. Quite crowded, so I found a ride 100km south on the highway after 30 mins :D
same as Licor007. South works great. eastbound is a bit tricky, but it is possible (single traveler asking around on a tuesday afternoon)
Pretty good to get south, although most people were not going far (maybe KÃ¶ln or Dortmund). If you're trying to go further, stay on the A3 at all costs

For a ride to KÃ¶ln perfect.
We tride to go to MÃ¼nchen. Thatâ€™s why we waited so long.
Extremely good spot if you want to get to Cologne but it is difficult to get a lift to A45 and Frankfurt.
Nice place to Koln

We were here by accident, going to Netherlands, but this is definietely not a good spot to go to Netherlands. But apart from that it's a good spot, it has restaurant, big parking and petrol station and a lot of traffic.
back on track after successfull battle of trying to get out of Frankfurt airport. great guy took us south near france border (shoutout Alfred from NY)
Not bad. Got picked up by two charming German students going to Heidelberg. (1 M, 1 F)
Not busy but pretty lucky that a German business man gave us a lift.
Very good spot a lot of people willing to take you.

A bit quiet gas station. A guy who was going to Freidburg picked me up. He ended up driving me all the way into Strasbourg.
Sign said "Strasbourg".
waited for 30 minutes with a sign before i got a lift to hamburg. two times.
waited for two traficlights to get a ride to hamburg...best spot!
waited after the traffic light for about 45 min - got a ride to Walsleben  gasstation, but the guy was going to Rostock.

berlin-hamburg (waited 1 hour)
i walked between the cars when they waited for the green traffic lights

usually cars going to Hamburg are on the left side of the street so its kind of difficult to get the people going in this direction. we had a sign saying hamburg and found after 15min a really cool guy taking us. the traffic lights are really helpful, like this people can stop
Asked around to find someone going to Szczecin, Poland. A bit quiet but most people are going to the east of Germany
Quite a lot of full cars with holiday-goers, but enough traffic atleast! Got a lift that went close to Berlin after around half an hour. A few people were also going North.
Tried to hitch to Hamburg from here. Big mistake. Horrible spot to go north, everyone is going either east or south.
Wanting to go to Hamburg. Declined 3 rides going east. Eventualy changed my plan and accepted a ride to strait to Berlin.
To Wildeshausen raststÃ¤tte.
It was a calm morning but still found a ride close to Frankfurt
I was lucky I found a family who took me to Alicante, spain
It was a bit hard to get to Freiburg on a saturday afternoon. Many people going to Strasbourg, local traffic aswell. After one and a half hour got a lift from a german couple.

Direction South on the A5 towards Basel
Needed 10min to get a ride with two Australian guys who brought me to Freiburg.

Got offered lifts to Karlsruhe, Frankfurt and NÃ¼rnberg within 30 mins. Got a lift to Pforzheim direction Stuttgart after one hour. Friday morning in June. Agree with Mrm1985, if you are coming from south and wanna go to Stuttgart and your driver drives north: This is the place to get off.
nice spot
On a Saturday in July at 1830, okish. 40% eastern european cars. 1 offer to Hamburg. Surprisingly many offers north.
Got a ride to Berlin, the third drivers i asked i got in. Pretty good spot.
Very easy to get from here to Berlin. For Hamburg I waited about an hour in the morning. Towards south rather difficult, at least when it's not rush hour
Not easy to get the ride to the south (direction Hildesheim) but I stopped the car coming from the town by the road beside this petrol station
Stood here 3 hours, no one stopped / asked around 20 people at the Gasstation

Awesome for direction Leipzig. But shouldn't be hard to find someone heading further either. 

In my opinion eg. for going to Leipzig: don't bother with the petrol station and just thumb next to the road. ~Lukas

Gas station with an ok amount of cars. Some going further, although you need some patience for going on the A9 towards Berlin etc.

If you want to go to Leipzig don't bother asking around on the petrol station, but write a sign and stand next to the road. ~Lukas

I was waiting for only 20 min, direction: Berlin, August, Sunday afternoon. You can catche drives from petrol station, but also from the road, on the same spot. I was picked up by Porsche driver, 270 km/h in one moment. Best drive ever. :)
Best spot in town to go up north in direction or to Berlin. Also Magdeburg -> Hannover -> Hamburg e.g.
Not a lot of activity 23:30 on a wednesday. Got picked up by a man going to KÃ¶ln though!
Here I met a Swedish guy who was hitchhiking for the first time to Italy! Managed to hitch a ride together with guys from Kosovo going to Hannover.

Good spot in general, but you have to talk to a lot of people. Perhaps better to just stand with a sign with a road name. Eventually got a lift to MÃ¼nster, which was nice though. If you want to ask people, go by the public bathrooms and gas pumps. If using sign, stand by the exit so everyone will pass you!
Needed to get to Groningen but was asking around for Bremen, got lucky asking a dutch numberplate and gkt a lift all the way to Groningen
Most people going south go to Hanover, but if some going further south as well
Pretty low traffic I would recommand asking  people that stop for gas to increases chances. You can also ask people stopping at Mac Donald's
between 7 and 8 few cars in the direction of hamburg but I managed to take a Tesla

Lovely spot. Friendly people, some local hitchhikers and I quickly got a ride to a rasteplatz near Wittstock (I was going to Rostock, but met people going to Hamburg). According to my ride this used to be one of the two main places to hitchhike from West Berlin to West Germany so you're taking part in history as well as getting a quick ride.
Not much traffic at 7 in the morning. I asked for a ride to Stolpen Heide gas station and found one in 5 minutes.

I have cached a ride all the way to Denmark twice, holding a DK sign. Go a little further down the road from the petrol station to the light right before the highway. I found that it helped. I went between 9 and 10 in the morning on weekends. Got a ride after 30 min.

If you're trying to cross the border into the Czech republic then this is the place to be. Good traffic and it's possible for the drivers to stop just before entering the on ramp. Of you're patient then it should be possible to get a ride to Prague from here.

I can't choose option "bad" for this stop. So I will just describe by myself here. I had really bad expierence on this spot. I waited there more than 1 hour and nothing. was good traffic, but drivers don't stop. I yhink they can stop there. but it a little bit uncomfortable. In the end i diceded to change spot.
Is it legal to go there? id doesn't seem like a pedestrian place

I have to admit that I didn't read all this stuff beforehand. However, I had a extremely bad experience with just using a "Prague" sign. I waited for 3 hours on a monday afternoon with temperatures around -10Â°C and just one car stopped during the entire time (and was just driving a few kilometres, didn't know there will be a resting place in a few more meters)...so, next time I would also do it with the Pirna sign.
got a ride to the czech republic in 30 mins or so. the traffic is dense and there is a lot of space - an overall good spot. didn't get a direct ride to prague though
wonderful view, little windy here, we had a hope for A-81 south, didnt work, so we refused and continued direction Frankfurt, witch worked

I rate it 3/5 for south, for north 4-5/5
After a long time a guy going to Bonn, but we told him to drop us on a highway 3km from Wallau, cuz it was a traffick jam, then we walked to the city

A lot of car going to North A3, but some are traveling south. It took me 2h to wait for direct ride to Freiburg, but then it was very fast ride and directly to the place I need. 
The spot is good, with nice view and not so expensive (relative to other petrol stations). Many foreign car, mostly NL, but some B as well. People are friendly and it is worth to try to speak directly to them. During 2 hours of waiting 4 drivers offer me a ride to north, but I politely declined as there is no better sp
Great spot heading southwest. Lots of traffic even in the early morning.
Going to Frankfurt appeared to be way easier than finding somebody going south but we caught a ride to Stuttgart after about 90 minutes.

Some space to stop but only cars coming from the right will see you, and only those on one lane will be able to stop. Had a sign saying Leipzig, eventually changed for A4 tankstelle, after which I got a ride to Dresdner Tor very fast.
Not the best spot but i guess i got lucky with a quick ride to Chemnitz.
Very bad, nobody stops
Was here for just 5 minutes, getting a direct lift to Chemnitz
Very good place for cars to stop before the highway. There is a traffic lights, not fast speed

The entrance ramp back to the highway is currently closed due to construction. There were no cars at all i left to michendorf. Not sure if itâ€™s cause of that or just a bad day. But it seems like the construction will go on for a while

Best spot to leave Berlin south or west. 
Ask around for rides west or(!) south and respekt common etiquette if there are other hitchhikers. I hitchhiked 15 times from here (mostly alone) and it always worked.
Waiting time 5-90 min.
60% of the time you end up 50km further at a big rest stop in Michendorf where A3 and A9 splits. While there might be another 45 min waiting time awaiting you its still worth it to go there. After Michendorf it will get better!
(25m, white)

I waited here for 2 hours on a Wednesday morning and decided than to leave this place and try it in Michendorf. I think this spot could be good but the problem is that there is not a lot of traffic. Just saw a few cars going to the highway and no one wanted to take me to the south.

Was pessimistic at first because a lot of local license plates, but after half an hour talking to drivers we found a lift to Leipzig! At noonish on a weekday not a lot of traffic on the on-slip though, talking to drivers is the way :-)
First we thought it wouldnâ€™t be a great spot, because we saw many Berlin numberplates. But the first dutch car we saw took us all the way to the Netherlands, maybe we were lucky
Waited for around 30 minutes thumbing at the exit with a Bern sign, until eventually a family saw me from a distance and waved at me to come join them.
Literally the first couple I approached took me almost all the way to Como,Italy
We were hitchhiking from Freiburg South and had to wait around 75 min. ItÂ´s not a really good spot. So if you're going from Freiburg South. Try another option.
I think it is a good place to hitchhike but it was not easy for me to find someone who goes to France. So I ended up in a car to Basel

Often going to France from Freiburg. 
I use bus/tram to get to the spot, then trying to catch a car. Most cars to the south, so finding a French car can take a long time. Stil the best option I found so far to travel Freiburg->France.

Good if you're going to Munich or NÃ¼rnberg. We first tried to get to Regensburg but no luck so eventually we settled on Munich. If you're going to Austria like us, it might be easier to get through Munich and Salzburg than to try and cut across

Okay enough, highway service stations are always quite a good place. I was heading into NÃ¼rnberg, but I arrived in the middle of rush hour and the motorway was a standstill traffic jam. Had a break and then found a car going to MÃ¼nchen. I unfortunately don't speak much German and the driver asked if I had a boyfriend and wasn't too happy when I said yes, and let me off at the next Rasthof. Managed to get a lift south via A7 in about 20 Minutes for already two times. Also, Stillhorn ist very easy to reach. I like this spot a lot!
Bad for going south via A7, most of the cars were on the way to Bremen. waited for 1,5h and gave up, I went to the Harburger Rasthof Bege which I feel like is a better spot to get a ride south.

Great spot
not so much traffic on a saturday afternoon but still found a ride towards gieÃŸen in about 15mins.

Good spot just on the ramp leaving the station. Stood there to catch cars going Austria and somebody coming to the station noticed me and took me all the way to Slovenia.

gas station M.East - a lot of transit traffic, North, South, East! The way description:

a highly frequented highway restaurant with a lot of people going to the East. so it shouldn't take too long to get a lift.
Service station "Helmstedt SÃ¼d",next station in 5km!(old border East Germany), good to get lifts to Mageburg, Berlin or Poland!

In my experience, the best spot for hitchhiking south (Hamburg) and also better than at Aral in Husumer StraÃŸe. Here is the direct highway access via the B200. The nearest bus stop is called â€œFriedenshÃ¼gelâ€. Drivers coming from the direction of McDonalds and wanting to get onto the highway often stop here for 2-3 minutes at a traffic light. There are also three supermarkets (Aldi, Rewe, Lidl) in the immediate vicinity of McDonalds. Aral is also on a highway ramp, but in my experience you are har

Not really a good spot, but mutch better than Aral gas station or standard hitching. Worked better here than traditional hitch, people stop on the crossroads.

Good spot if youâ€™re looking to go on the highway. Bus stop so lots of space for cars to stop. Found a car that brought me further from the border, at night thereâ€™s a lot of streetlights so you are still quite visible (but maybe not ur sign)

Either way, the service station is accessible on foot through a whole in the

Most cars come from Helmstedt to go on the A2 westwards and you can see it by which line they choose. They are also slow enough and the beginning of the ramp is wide enough for a normal car to pick you up next to the "island", while others could still pass. Waited about 25 minutes.
Maybe I was lucky, but I got a lift after 5 minutes! :D
bus stop on B7 towards Kassel or Eschwege. Also works for going to Treffurt if you have a sign.

Great place to hitchhike toward Heide. Me and my friend were waiting maybe 30 minutes maybe not.

Not that good place for hitch direction Freiberg. There is no place at the road shoulder, we had to stand at the side street. Anyway, a car pulled over after approx. 25 min. and the driver took us at least to next village.
We were two girls on a Sunday around 3pm heading to Darmstadt. We got a ride pretty fast by someone actually driving to Langen but then he decided to drive us to Darmstadt first.
bus station, cars pass by in the direction of Langen and Darmstadt

good Place
Highway exit, was heading north. Not so easy, as there is another highway exit for Hof a bit further north.

when someone dropped you off the autobahn here, you can hitchhike here towards Ulm/City!

Just go with every car which brings you closer to the city. Maybe you need two short rides.
was picked up on the crossroad while walking to the gas station (holding a sign) got directly to gÃ¶ttingen

Good place to catch a car to schongau in the evening. in that time not possible to get a lift from aral gas station  (no cars)

End of the service area. Cars are slow enough. Average amount of trafic.

Perfect spot: There is a traffic light and a lay-by.

try to hitch a ride directly to Berlin or at least to the motorway, otherwise you might get lost...
On weekdays a great spot, on federal holidays not to recommend. A lot of old couples on the road then.
Good spot, lot of space to pull over and also a lot of traffic.
Good spot to get to Erwitte. Also longer rides are possible, but there is a lot of local traffic.
A good spot to get to MÃ¶hnesee and on the highway direction Dortmund. Nearly nobody will go in direction Kassel.
I was looking for a ride to Strasbourg, but there were few cars here on a Friday evening.
Waited one minute for a ride to Strasbourg after another friendly driver dropped us there on his way to Freiburg.

We were two people on a saturday. Not so many cars so its possible to ask everyone who comes. Lots of cars coming only for the hostel nearby or the restaurant. We got a ride straight to Stuttgart in an hour.
Petrol station Grossenmoor, A7 direction Wurzburg.
Got a ride towards Giessen in under 10 min, and got dropped of at the Wetterau gasstation (A5 northbound).

Spot for north, south, east. 
Some traffic and space to pick up.
Here is a bus stop a couple meters before the highway entrance towards south.
this is the road in direction of the B27 which you want to take if you want to go North towards GÃ¶ttingen and the A7 or East towards Halle/Leipzig on the A38. Have a sign that says AUTOBAHN =)

A great spot. You can show a sign to the cars that are coming from the highway. The cars that are coming from direction Dortmund have to stop at the traffic lights. They can let you in while it is red, or the can drive on the parking of the fire fighters house.

Despite being off the highway and the fact i arrived there around 8pm i was lucky to find a ride to NÃ¼rnberg after only 15min (the second person i asked). The plus is that there is a McD there so i guess it attracts a lot of people.

This is the Authof Aurach, the resting place further east is called FrankenhÃ¶he and seems like a much better place, as the big resting places usually are better than any "Authof" some way off the highway. Haven't tried it though!
Good shoulder to pull over, but small town Bavarian people like to give weird looks rather than lifts.
There is a little bay to pull over and enough traffic to get a ride in an acceptable time. A lot of local traffic as well though.
Stood here monday at 9.50 got away in 15 minutes to gasstation Hockenheim with sign Mannheim
Stood here with a sign A5 Frankfurt at 7.15, away in 5 minutes!
waited around 15 minutes by thumbeling and without any sign and got a lift directly to Munich. Pretty good spot, cars do not come so fast and can stop easily at subways restaurant.

I was left 1 km before this place and I was walking alongside the road until I found this place. It was starting to get cold and dark and I didn't have a camping tend. After 30 min a girl picked me up to a small city more ahead and I took a train to my final destination. Remember: always bring a camping tend and sleeping bag with you.
Parking lot direction Immenstadt. Not many cars on friday afternoon but they are not really fast and they can see you from a big distance
I was alone on a cloudy friday in march. 3 cars stopped in 30 min, but just the last one was going direction bodensee. He left me near Stockach

I recommend you to walk a bit in the opposit direction of the roundabout, just before the bus stop so cars can see you from afar (there is a turn right before the bus station and the cars can't see you very well)

bus station, good amount of cars, a lot of taxis

Good spot to go north towards NÃ¼rnberg, cars are really slow here and can stop easily. We waited 15 min, during this time 4 cars stopped going towards Regensburg. Number 5 took us to NÃ¼rnberg-Feucht.

Enough space to pull over. Sometimes not a lot of cars. In summertime you can pick pears there.
Sometimes not enough traffic, but a great spot though. Lot of space too pull over. Plus: In summertime you can pick pears.

great place to be dropped off, found immediately a ride to Munic :) 

(was on a Sunday)
how? on the motorway? a car going 130kmh should stop for you?

Direction:
West to Zurich

Sign:
ZURICH

Date:
11 OCT '09

Time:
About 11h

Weather:
Cloudy with some sun, mild/cool temperature

HOW TO GET THERE:
Take the S-Bahn (S8) to Neugilching.  Walk along Landsberger Strasse about 400 meters to the entrance of the Autobahn.  There really isn't a place to stop on then eingang (entrance), so I just hopped the Autobahn gate and hitched directly on the road.  No police, since I got a ride in less than 10 minutes.

This is NOT a good spot to hitchhike towards Dortmund via the A2.

Many people are driving towards Paderborn or take the 61 to GÃ¼tersloh.

I was lucky that after two hours a kind man going towards GÃ¼tersloh took a detour for me on the A2 to bring me to the first petrol station there.
Not bad to hitchhike towards OsnabrÃ¼ck and Paderborn (A33) or Direction Hannover or Dortmund (A2). A lot of Cars are not driving towards the highway but some do. Enough space to stop.
Rothenburg is a very beautiful village and accessible in hitch-hiking because it's touristic.

Great pleace direction to Bielefeld.
Traffic lght before the bridge. Waiting time to Detlmold was 40 min.

got there by lunch time there were a lot of people stopping for lunch i got a ride to A2 pretty quickly

Service station PlÃ¶tzetal Ost on the A14 direction Magdeburg.

Northbound direction is closed. Date of post: November 2015.

gas station at the motorway that you can easily reach by bus from lÃƒÂ¼denscheid center. Use the bus to Kalve where you can get on the stations on either way over the supply ramps. Usualy you'll find somebody, but the stations are not too crowded.
There is a traffic light before the on-ramp and also enough space for the cars to stop safely on the side of the road.

a good place on B185 between 
dessau and 'gartenreich wÃ¶rlitz' which also connects you with leipzig (on A9,  southern direction) and berlin (A9, northern direction). there is a traffic light at this spot, cars have to stop every two minutes. a petrol station is nearby in case you are hungry/thirsty. you can reach the city center of dessau in less than 5 minutes from here.
service area next to the motorway called "Shell Autohof Haiger" with affordable food and a lot of trucks plus other traffic from B54 and B277, good.
Got a ride to Stuttgart within 25 min from the busstop with a sign. Much traffic in the morning towards Stuttgart!
Busstop: Good place to hitchhike towards Ulm
Good place, a lot of space to stop for cars
Great on-ramp for direction OsnabrÃ¼ck. Sufficient hard shoulder, lots of traffic.
On friday afternoon there wasn`t much traffic but still more then enough to hitchhike west. I got a ride to Erfurt after ~15 minutes.
sometimes not much traffic...
The second driver took me to the Raststation Altenburger Land.
Perfect spot to get out of Zwickau towards the A4 highway as the traffic light is red for a long time. Stand at the space next to the turn-left-lane with a sign that says A4.
Fine amount of traffic heading towards the border. The cars can stop on the grass by the bike lane.
A lay-by for the cars to stop. Lots of local traffic, only managed to get a ride to nearby Bocholt while trying to go to NL.
Small road, make a sign since many drivers don't go far from here. A lady going to Reken took a pity on us, seeing the empty road, and took us to our destination, Borken.

Good place to hitchike in the direction Bischofswerda & Dresden via road B6. The tempo is limited to 50 km/h and cars have the opportunity to stop at a Bus stop behind you. I was standing there for about 20 minutes till a driver gave me a ride to Dresden.
There's an extra lane by the road so cars can easily stop even though it's a fast road. Good spot to leave Berlin in direction east.

There is a set of traffic lights right here if you sit just after them you can get all the traffic. My day here there was road works so I only got the merging traffic which is still sufficient enough.

I got there by the evening, shortly before the dark. The spot itself is good - cars go slow, there is a place to hide from the rain too. Traffic was not too good, very few cars. Got a lift within one hour.
A really cool place for hitching.
Good place to hitch! We used it for getting to Dresden. Didn't get a direct lift but it brought us further.
A place on the Debkauer Strasse in the direction of Senftenberg/Dresden. Plenty of space for drivers to pull over.
Good to get to the autobahn.
Very good going north, senseless going south.
Quite good spot, but be aware that there are probably not as many cars driving by.

This is a great spot if you need a ride to wards nuremberg. Been there for a couple of times and it has always been a good spot.  You can also walk toward the parking spot from the local super market and try your luck there.
Shell Gas station
Took us two minutes to get a ride from here. very good spot, it is directly on the slip road to the highway on the right side there is about a hundred meters sideway to stop.

just a few meters from the aral and jet station there is a traffic light where most cars wanting to go north on the A1 have to spot. The spot is a little creepy, bcos there is a gap in the bridge and you can see the cars passing underneath you :) but its the best spot going north, in my opinion!
I hitchhiked here towards France, then an guy from the Airbase took me for 15 kilometers to the next petrol station, which was a great choice! :)
Excellent spot for hitchhiking to France / northern Germany.Got ride early in the morning to Saarbrucken after 30 min waiting.

me + Nicol

i got there a car to Praha. Good Place

Ist direkt an der Kreuzung blÃ¶de zum Anhalten, aber meist ist da nicht zu viel Verkehr, der auf die Autobahn auffÃ¤hrt, genug jedoch, um wegzukommen. Am besten hier mit Schild (EA, HEF, WAK, ESW), nahe Ziele (Eisenach, Hersfeld) sind am wahrscheinlichsten, schnell wen zu finden - ansonsten ist es einfacher am sÃ¼dlicher gelegenen Autohof.
As it's written on Hitchwiki, this gas station is a good spot to stop. I had been taken at this place exactly, just at the entrance of the station. Every car could see me, I waited 15 minutes.
Many truck drivers. They stop here for the night.
Waited a while to get a ride to the A1. Locals really keen to take you only short distances though.

Big truckstop on the B213 direction A1/Bremen. There's a shoulder just behind the petrol station for cars turning off to the hotel, but perfect also to stop a car :) Should be possible to find somebody going onto the A1.

This might be the best spot for the direction Passau / Austria / Vienna, although there aren't that many cars leaving. I wasn't lucky at the actual truck stop, but had to walk down to the on-ramp in order to get a lift.

A big truckstop and gas station. Just ask the drivers to get every direction you like. Go there from train stop Burgweinting via Junkerstr. and Burgweintingerstr. (500m). To Burgweinting there is at least one train per hour from Hauptbahnhof.

Good Spot to hit the A60 going to Darmstadt. Most inner city people leave the city this way.
Walking time from the city center about 30 minutes.
Summer sunday around midday a lot of people go for a free pee. Hitch up north towards Erfurt

I discovered the same experience. It seems to be impossible to go south. Most cars will use the A71 I guess. We walk to Hermsdorf West and got a lift in 5 min. Walking time is about 60 to 75 Minutes. You can try to catch a ride on the main road.

A4 & A9
very good for direction east, but couldnt get a ride to direction south on A9 from here after 1.5 hours, maybe it was only bad luck but i could see only a very few cars going that way if any. had to walk through the forest to the other restplace east from here on A9, if you like challenge and have time maybe you can do the same though wouldnt really recommend.
Es war Sonntagmorgen um 9.00, dass ich einen Ride suchte, dafÃ¼r bin ich mit 20-30 min sehr zufrieden!

Kurz hinter der Kreuzung von Eisenach-Mitte steht es sich super Richtung MÃ¼hlhausen/Eichsfeld weil im Grunde jeder zweite hier wenigstens bis Mihla oder Nazza fÃ¤hrt, so bist du einmal auf der Piste und kommst auch gut weiter - Ã¼ber die Woche sind aber auch viele Pendler aus MHL/UH/EIC unterwegs, die bei BOSCH oder Opel arbeiten und dich gern mitnehmen, bevorzugt zum Feierabend.

Wirst du an der Ausfahrt Eisenach-Ost aus Richtung Erfurt rausgeschmissen, lauf gar nicht so weit, bleib an der Kreuzung stehen - sehr bald sollte ein Eisenacher kommen, der dich bis in die Innenstadt mitnehmen wird.
Ok, es war Sonntagmittag, nicht die beste Zeit zum Trampen, aber ich kam nach 20 min ganz gut weg Richtung Eisenach!

Im Grunde kommen viele Autos von Erfurt her und fahren auf die Autobahn Richtung Eisenach/Hessen, der Ort ist nen bisschen blÃ¶d zum Anhalten, aber es gibt ne lange EinfÃ¤delspur an dessen Anfang man stehen kann.

Auf der StraÃŸe vom Kaffeetrichter sÃ¼dwÃ¤rts Richtung A4/Arnstadt fahren jede Menge Leute zur Autobahn, zu FuÃŸ nur 10-15 Minuten vom Bahnhof oder mit der StraÃŸenbahn bis zum Steigerwaldstadion kommt diese Kurve, was schon nach AusfallstraÃŸe ausschaut - nicht perfekt zum Anhalten, aber viele Autos, die die Richtung fahren und sehr bald auch wer anhÃ¤lt!

There is a Shell-gastation, with cars going to A2 direction west and east.
500 meters forward is another aral-gasstation.
Autobahnauffahrt, sehr gut um nach KÃ¶ln zu kommen!
A1, beide Richtungen
Better than nothing: There are not too many cars, but there is a restplace close to this on-ramp, so you will be able to get a ride in 10-15 min!

It's not the worst spot to get a ride in all directions: South to Ilmenau (on the A71 always stand at the on-ramp, don't hope for gas stations or restplaces), East to Jena/Dresden and best West to Gotha/Eisenach/Hessen

I wouldn't agree that this spot is good !!! the flow is very weak and sensless !! the good thing is the people !! they stop for you and try to pick you to better places !!! I would suggest for you to keep going in this road till the first traffic light, that would be almost 1 KM a way, and then turn right and keep walking for almost 500 m. you will see the signs for the high way , ULM dirrction is when you need if you want to get to Zurich

I think this was the exact spot - right after the second long term car park, about ten minutes walk from the terminal. I was hhiking with a sign for Switzerland. Very few cars, but some stopped within 5 minutes and wanted to take me to Memmingen or Munich. In 20 minutes I got a ride to Zurich (the driver wanted â‚¬20 though). Another man was hhiking in front of me, trying to get to Ulm and had stayed there for more than an hour. Maybe I was just lucky. The sign with the Swiss flag definitely helpe

Karls Erlebnis Dorf is a huge strawberry farm and family vacation spot. There are bus stops on both lanes as well as a nearby petrol station. During the summer, Karl's is always crowded with people stopping by to get some strawberries on their way to the coast or, of course, on their ways home to Rostock, Hamburg, Berlin or even farther.
Bus station here, pretty decent for getting out of berlin. Got a ride in a few minutes to a gas station towards Stettin.
This looks like a good place to catch a lift towards Halle, Leipzig and maybe even further south. Tested only by friends of mine, waiting times 10-30 minutes.
on-ramp 3 Emmerich, direction Arnhem (NL). Lots of dutch cars here.
On-ramp 46 Niedernhausen, A3 towards Koln. Slow traffic and place for cars to stop at the side of the road.
Many cars towards Poland.

Spend here 10 minuted to get a ride to Duisburg (25km north of DÃ¼sseldorf). After a night in Duisburg, i contunied to Amsterdam. You can wait at a side of a road, and show your sign at red light. At a side of a road there is quite a lot of grass, but generally it's ok.
Easy spot to get away southeast along the Mosel river. Hitchhiking is easy in this region, as often in rural areas.

Definitely a great spot towards Koln over the B51! 

You can stand at the so called "late merge" or "zipper lane" / "ReiÃŸverschluss" on the right.
Had a sign "Hanover - A1" and managed to be picked up fairly quickly and dropped off in Melle.
Walking along this road with a sign saying 'NL' got results within 5 minutes. I may have just got lucky, though. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/MÃƒÂ¼nster
on-ramp Ahrensburg, direction LÃ¼beck. Just get a short ride to the petrol station 5km down the road.
Lots of cars, so statistically good. But traffic light is too short, you have no time to talk to people and ask, just hope that someone will see you and take you.
Don't get your thumbs out fellows! Ask at the traffic light. Easy :)

Good place to get a ride in the direction of A8, Street lights and space for cars stop. Cars are not going to fast.
From the town center (bus station) get a bus or go by foot to the train staition, from there follow Sachsenkamer StraÃŸe in direction of Burger King, pass the roundabout and start HH.

I've waited about 15 minutes and got a lift till the gas station in A8 direction: Austria
a great spot just i didn't go very well

I don't know if I point it well, but I mean the station which is after the exit number 3 on the A5 highway direction east. There is a great point to hitch hike.Too much traffic there. I took a ride almost to Hannover
A bit difficult to get there. I tryed twice t get the direction to Regensburg-Passau... and it worked twice pretty well.
Saturday in May, got a hike in 5 min to Schwabisch Gmund, without asking - was crossing the road wondering where to go. Was a local bringing me there specially, didn't have to go there.
Great to go south, got after 5 min a car to Pforzheim tankstation, thought they actually had to go straight on the A35.
Great to go south, but no cars turn onto the road for Kaiserslautern
On a monday in May not so much traffic but got a dutch car heading back from holiday who took me all the way to venlo.
Gas station with a lot of traffic going to the Koblenz, KÃ¶ln, Aachen and Netherlands. There is also possible to camp.

It is an excellent spot. You can stand there easily next to the road and cars can stop at several small entrances to pick you up. So, you can always switch between several spots in a distance of 200m behind the gas station. I was picked up after 25 minuts and got a lift to Berlin Alexanderplatz. So, not too much, but enough cars going ahead to Berlin, the rest is just local traffic or sourrounds the capital via A10. If you are not successful, just ask the people refueling their cars at the gas s
Good for direction of Kassel, but if you are from Marburg i guess there is almost no public transport...

good spot to go towards bremen and hamburg, i got a ride in 1 min to a gasstation on the highway from there i got to hamburg in 2 min.
Good spot for going towards Jena and from there onto the A4. Cars are going slow and plenty of space to pull over. Not that much traffic.
got frustrated with the service station nearby & walked up. nice layby, chased away by the cops, caught a lift at the entrance where there is 0 space to stop...
Me and my friend were hitchhiking from this spot to A2 towards Han and Cologne. We were taken to the north to a gasstation on the Autobahn. Took us 15min to catch a nice girl.
I`ve wait one half hour for go straight to berlin.a good place to wait with a lot of cars.

To the East (Cologne) onto the A4 or North-East onto the A44. Short local rides can usually drop you on the service station Aachener Land on the A4. 

Two lanes merging into one, but no real margin. Still, enough space to stop.

Great spot of you are arriving on the A3 and are looking at going South towards Munich. If you go further to the main interchange there is no where to pull over for your driver. Here is it wasy to turn around and get back on the highway. I was staying in the town just 15km north (Lauf) for the night, you can easly hitch the 15km from here and get to Lauf Bahnhof (Links der Pegnitz) and then walk the 1km to the A9 onramp, there is a station there where you can get a lift on the A9
Hier kannst du die Leute persÃ¶nlich fragen. Ansonsten ist die gesamte Str. sehr gut geeignet! Zu erreichen mit der Line 2 nach und bis Sieker oder der 3 nach und bis Stieghorst.
just after the cross road theres some space at the road side, good for getting onto the a42, travelling east or west
very good resting place for hitchhiking south to ruhrgebiet - take a sign or talk to people
there are some parking spots where you can easily stand and wait for a lift, good for getting south
theres some space next to a spring called schÃ¤ferquelle - perfect spot if wanna get a lift to a2

good to hitchhike towards south on A9. Many cars stop at IKEA to do a short break while there journey. Of course - many people with full cars or families.on the other handside - thousands of cars!!! I had luck - 10minutes walking over the parking place. Look at the label for the area at the cars.
Bus stop in front of Liebherr. Direction Muensingen
Junction B481/L578. Towards Elte quite some traffic, mostly going further to Rheine-Gellendorf.

They changed the way of traffic! There are no traffic lights anymore. But there is still the option to take a care which is coming from ehingen (the city) and is going on the streets.
There are traffic circles now!
A traffic light: The one and only place to hitchike towards south-west

This spot served us well when there was a problem with the trains between Herrenberg and TÃ¼bingen. We were immediately joined by another set of hitchhikers but all of us got a ride quickly (10 mins).
In the direction of TÃ¼bingen. Good visibility as cars are passing slow and there's a stretch where no cars are allowed to park (bus stop, etc). Plenty of room for cars to pull over quickly.
To Saarbrucken / Merzig
good to reach with the tram (SaarbrÃ¼ckner Str) and go to Berlin or Dresden
good Place for find someone to go into City

Directly at the Driveway. The Cars have to stop on the road. Traffic is quite high.
Good spot to hitch a lift to Mont Royal Summer Camp!
Good spot to hitch a lift to Mont Royal Summer Camp!
Finding a lift to Frankfurt and Aachen took my patience at these petrol stations!

some oil stations here, but I asked for maybe an hour because many cars stay in cologne or drive only to bonn and there is no oil station up to bonn. But it's possible to go on the A3 to Frankfurt from here.
OK to Swiecko!
Traffic light. Great for getting rides into the city, even at in the dark, because you can just ask people waiting at the red light.
I started hiking there to Berlin and a Truckdriver took me directly there. didnt had to wait very long.
There is a good parking place in porta Westfalica to go to the Highway A2.
Just one more cooment: it was not under the bridge but a bit to the left (on the map), after the cross.

We tried to hitchhike on B300 towards Augsburg in a place that looked very good to stop cars, but in 5 minutes came a police cars just to tell us to go away. they put us in a worse place, of course, were we had to wait for more then an hour.
We didnt have luck to get a ride to Rostock, we waited more than one hour and finally gave up. Lots of local traffic and not so much space for cars to stop

direction Rostock 
it's better with a sign: HRO

If you wanna go South the A9 to Nuremberg, Munich, it works well! There is a trafficlight, and you stand on the other side of the road, so if you have a sign "N" the people see you and have time to think about taking you. I never waited longer than 15 minutes.

Good place at tha BundesstraÃŸe to Ingolstadt and on the local McDonalds. So you could stand next to the street, but you should use a sign, or talk directly to people at the parking plac of the fast food restaurant.
Good spot to get on the A9 direction Leipzig/Berlin. Here are more cars than on the gas station. Many of them have to stop at the traffic lights anyway, some use the beginning of the slip road.
after a lot of construction work, this spot is pretty good in direction of the A81. there's a pretty long interweaving lane, where cars can stop without problems.
ppl told me that this is then spot to hh if you want to get out of konstanz. i never tried it but all of my hh-friends told that this is a goog spot.....you ve a gas station to ask ppl

For going to NÃ¼rtingen this sport works perfect.

Good Spot for going downhill to NÃ¼rtingen / Beuren / Owen. Cars can easily stop.
In the bus stop I get a ride to Bremen in 20 minutes.

To GÃ¶rlitz or Poland. Quite small parking, but you can get there by local bus (bus stop Bretnig, ticket: VVO zone Radeberg) and some nice walking. Once there, ask anybody to bring you to the next big gas station ().
bus stop, good visibility
Nice place at the entrance to the motorway.

Not much cars stopping around but generally a good spot.
Getting to Muenster just before the Bus stop, leaving space for the car to stop at the bus place.

Most cars going to HAnnover or Hildesheim. If you want to go south, you can also take a car to hannover and get out at Hildesheimer BÃ¶rde on the A7 where it is possible tzo change the side of the motorway.

this ramp is an agreeable position to leave braunschweig in direction west

have a sign with you! way much easier then there. we've been three guys in a costume and it took us 20 minutes till we got o ride to dresden. good spot!
Direction: Heilbronn/Karlsruhe/North

It's very hard to hitch this local road towards Czech Republic. I waited one hour here, one hour a little further and a little further and in the end gave up and took a train. The road towards Czech Republic has no gas station whatsoever.
there's a bus stop, people drive B15, B16, then A93, direction to hof and chemnitz, dresden
to Mendig, A48, A61 or North to the Villages. Much traffic on sunday's, during Holidays or on sunny days. Long lifts possible.

Good spot out of LÃ¼neburg to Hamburg. Traffic okay. 

Guter Punkt Richtung Norden. Verkehr ist okay, breiter Seitenstreifen zum Anhalten.

This place is perfect to go to Freiburg, Konstanz, Singen, maybe ZÃƒÂ¼rich.
not good for going northwards.

You can ask at the parking place, or stand on the broad on-ramp to or from the Autobahn (forbidden).

Traffic light for cars coming from the autobahn A2 towards the eastern part of Magdeburg.
Traffic light on the B1 towards Magdeburg. You can talk to drivers here. No place to stop if the traffic light is green.
I usually do not recommend Autohofs but this one had lots of car traffic on sunday noon in both directions. Don't hesitate to start here.

Rasthof (Autohof) "Magdeburg" off the autobahn A2.

You can get here by getting a lift out of Magdeburg on the B1 until Irxleben and walk the rest.
Got a ride to the A4 eastwards easily.
Cars coming from Ilmenau going to the A71 can see you from the traffic lights and have a small space to stop for you.
Highway service station "Berfa" on the A5 towards GieÃŸen. There is only a small parking lot on the opposite side of the highway.
Always easy to get a ride from here. Recommended.

Large motorway service station near Alsfeld, great for getting long-distance journeys in any direction. Average waiting time 30 minutes. Alsfeld is near the NE border of the RMV travelzone, so if you have a ticket giving you unlimited travel within this zone then here is a good place to start for journeys North or East out of Hessen. Medium traffic, mostly cars. Recommended.
Highway service station "Weilbach" on the A66 towards Frankfurt centre and GieÃŸen.
I had one guy stop right away to take me into Berlin but then I made a sign for CB and got a ride with an older couple going right there
A395 towards Vienenburg. You might be lucky holding a sign here, but in general not the best stop to get out of WolfenbÃ¼ttel. It's the closest from the train station however.

Theoretical good place, took a bit longer than expected to get a ride to Hamburg, but it's alright. 
Cars drive slowly. Make sure to stand on the biking path so cars see you.

almost each and everybody leaving 'lÃƒÂ¼beck' in the direction of 'hamburg' or denmark ('roskilde' or 'copenhagen') has to pass 'the lohmÃƒÂ¼hle' kreisel to reach the autobahn "A 1". rated (only) 'good' because it is difficult for drivers to stop, there is no slip road or shoulder to (safely) stop at. you do not need to take the bus to get there; a 10 minutes walk from the DB lÃƒÂ¼beck main station will bring you there. there is supermarkets and a mc. donald's restaurant further east (meaning righthan
Very sweet spot to get to Stuttgart on the B27. Traffic lights, so many cars are able to recognize you and plenty of space to stop.
gasstation!
Only a few cars per hour, but a resting place for trucks in the back of the petrol station.
Highway ramp close to the junction. easy to get seen, easy to stop for the cars. Its perfect to get a lift to the west and north (Mannheim, Frankfurt)

On the road after the jet. Fine place for north-sea rides and the BMW/Audi types of businessmen - Have sign, they will stop even if the place doesn't invite it.
Traffic worth it after 11:00.
North: HRO, HH, DÃ¤nemark etc.
i was just waiting here for about five seconds before i got a lift with a porsche 911 to wetterau;)

The Aral gas station directly at B3 direction South (GieÃŸen, A5). after 20 minutes of waiting, we decided to look at the Aral gas station nearby. There we were more successful.
go from here DIREKTLY to the A9 (North)

Weeze, A57 (both Cologne and Netherlands).

not legal, but you can stop direction munich
Wrong. Look for Eisenach-West instead.

Good spot for going direction Ingolstadt. There is a gas station, so you can talk to people. But it was the road that worked for us. Got a ride to Munich in no time.

The spot is easy tro reach by tram - however just few people seem to go far, so having a sign saying 'Gera' (east) or 'Erfurt' (west) does the job (there are gas stations on the way both direction)

to NL/Groningen with good chances to beat the slow train!

For getting into Magdeburg if your driver goes along the A14 past the city. It is a high speed national road (BundestraÃŸe), but there are traffic lights and with the right timing you can ask drivers to pick you up.

Ugly environment and car drivers who don't like to stop for hitchikers. I've been told that whole MÃ¼hlacker is inhabited with people like that.
Last exit before the Netherlands!A lot of Dutch people riding up here going west,also a number of people going to the next Dutch Citys Oldenzaal and Enschede

Parking Area \"Emstal\".I'm always getting here when I travel from HÃ¶rstel. Good to get lifts to the Netherlands!Sometimes a lot of British people stopping here.Last parking before the Kreuz SchÃ¼ttdorf A30/A31! So you have the chance to get north/west and south!
fine to get a lift to the motorway. but first you have to get there.. good luck! :)
works in direction of Dresden, Frankfurt, Praque, but a bit difficult because most drivers turn fast there
diretion berlin, chemnitz
direction berlin, not to easy for the drivers, but easy to see, not so good to reach by feet or bus
direction neubrandenburg, greifswald
I was lucky once, but the other times it took far too long until somebody stopped for the A5.
Use this place to transfer from A48 to A61 when heading north.
You definetly need a sign, sometimes people stop, but it's not too easy.
i spent half my life hitching here towards Dietlingen. I hitched rides at all daytimes. But it's rather for small distances or if you travel slow.
going to berlin it's a good place
for hamburg itz's ok here. there is a parking place where you can stand traying to catch a car

Direction: Leipzig, Halle, Magdeburg, Hanover, even GÃƒÂ¶ttingen

small gas station, but last resting place before leipzig. To be closed within a year from today. Not too much traffic but asking people helps you out

coming from the highway, heading inside magdeburg. Maybe you will be pickd up by an older man owning a plane at the nearby magdeburg airport. offers flight for free, happened once to me. bus stop, slow speed, excellent spot!

Going from Cottbus to Berlin / Dresden. Its close to one of the two accesses to the autobahn in Cottbus. cars come directly from the city.
Take tram nr 4 exit at \"SaarbrÃ¼cker-straÃŸe\" and walk west along the the main road. you might see some autobahn signs as well. Anyway you have to walk like ten minutes until you see this bus stop in the beginning of the wood. Well there are busses going as well but i dont know which nr. But its ok  as well. Good Luck!

Said to be a good spot, but from several hours of trying here I still haven't managed to get a lift. A much better spot is the bus stop on Theodor-Heuss-Allee. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Frankfurt_am_Main
Busy petrol station, rides to the Netherlands available. Got a ride within seconds. Useful as a drop-off point when travelling from MÃƒÂ¼nster. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Steinfurt
Take bus R51 or 16 to "Am Max-Klemens-Kanal". Get out and try standing before the railway crossing, there's lots of space. All cars going to Sprakel or Greven
The access lane to the south is great towards Trier and Wittlich.
stopping a car is no problem here to get to the direction polish border or berlin. most but probable you will only get short lifts on the b1.
It is easy to get a ride from people leaving Bremen airport.
good traffic, but difficult to find someone in the wanted direction

Ramp towards Rheine and the Netherlands. Quite good hard shoulder, cars from both directions, gas station and Burger King on the other side of the roundabout. So mostly a lot of traffic. You can get here with bus S50 and R63, just get out at "BrÃƒÂ¼gge/Disco".
From Bochum central station, take the U35 towards Rensingstrasse. Get out there and walk up to the ramp.

much traffic! slow cars. no problem to get away to france, luxembourg or germany. there is a turkish restaurant with a parking in direction north and a small snack stand with place for cars to stop on the other direction of the road. i wated about 5 min.

to Freyung, to Czeh republic (Praha). Just say before traficlight with writen destination place on your hhiker's plate. A lot of local cars, but people are friendly and will take you very fast from this point.
really very good to go into cologne city. enough traffic for more directions
Good if wanting to go to Marburg. It's not a practicle place for cars to pull over, but many just stop directly on the road since there is not too much traffic. waiting time: 15 - 30 min.
Big bus bay with lots of space to stop for cars. They can see you easily and have to slow down to 70 km/h some meters before. Good for direction Dreierwalde, Hoerstel or Hopsten.
If you have to change your driver because you want to hitchhike the A8 to Munich - (and your driver wants to Stuttgart-city or s.l.t.)this is a good place to change
The perfect place to go to Hamburg and Kiel. For Berlin itÃ‚Â´s the best way to go from here via Hamburg as well and change at the circle Horner Kreisel.
At this place infront of Mc Shit people drop of their friends for the trainstation. ask them to give you a ride onto the highway

When the boss of the gas station is trying to chase you away (happens sometimes), you can try to stand here with a sign. 

The drak street is probably not owned by the gas station and the boss should have no right to make you go away.

Emergency rest stop before the traffic light. Very good if you are going towards Metelen. If going north, just cross the street and try it along the hard shoulder. This spot was recommended to me by the German border police ;) It's also easy to get rides here towards Enschede.
Good spot for hitching out of Weingarten towards direction Ulm. Make sure you have a sign. Cars can stop along the road.
Great place, for east (A6), north or south (A5). Take the tram no. 1, 2, S4 or S5 to Weinweg. It's a double-ramp, on the south side there is more traffic and more place to pull over.
Gas station, good to get lifts in direction Ravensburg
Traffic lights and bus stop. Easy to get rides to the city center. Your spot if you got off at the service station for going towards Muenster

Gas station on the motorway "Wetterau". There is a tunnel so you can easyly cross the motorway.
Excellent stop if you're going north either to Dortmund or Kassel. 
Comming from Dortmund I stop here, switch sides and go up north and east to chemnitz very often. Faster than directly trying to get east.
Very very many cars go north from here!!!!
Towards MÃƒÂ¼nster, worked great ! Got to have a clear ad, considering the numerous possibilities !
deutsch: penzberg richtung iffeldorf/ seeshaupt/ autobahn --- english: penzberg direction iffeldorf/ seeshaupt/ highway
many cars are going the b9 in direction remagen, andernach, koblenz. place yourself somewhere, whre a car is able to stop and it will only take some minutes to get away.  dont await very long lifts

Good for direction Prenzlau, Szeczin.
Take a tram to Indira-Gandhi-Str. Then walk or take a bus along the Berliner Allee and find a decent place where cars can pull over.
End of town, enough space to stop cars. Many Dutch cars along this way.

Dir: Feldberg

Coming from Freiburg, you can either choose to take the official B317, or this "secret" road passing "Bruderhalde". There is not that much traffic, but it's much easier for cars to stop and somebody will eventually pick you up.
Good spot for hitchhiking north towards Berlin. Opinions differ about this ramp, but usually it's possible. Try to wait on the traffic islands.
Good spot, hitchhiking possible in both directions. Most traffic goes southwards! Easy to stop for cars along the hard shoulder.
I didnt wait longer than 15 minutes to get a very friendly ride there :) - Flov

Good spot to hitch towards Freiburg for people who don't want to wait for the bus or hitchhikers who have been dropped out at gas station "schauinsland". You can let them drop you out at moosweiher to take the tram no. 1 towards inner city.

DIRECTION: NORTH, Rostock

I was standing there for no more than 20 minutes, got a ride straight to Rostock. I had a label saying 'Rostock'. Maybe it was just luck, but the 104 road goes exactly this direction. You can stand behind the crossroads or ask people at the Oil! petrol station 150 m west. 150 m east there is truck park also.
We got a ride within 10 min. good place to stop too. friendly people
This gasstation is OK to fix a ride to Koln (still a gas station before Koln) or deeper into the Ruhr-area

Busstop of Line 1 (towards Eningen)

Good place to stop towards the "SchwÃƒÂ¤bische Alb", Riedlingen, Sigmaringen.

Busstop at the Hospital

Good place to get a lift towards Zwiefalten, Reutlingen, ...

Pretty good spot to go on the A8. Took me (1 male) about 45 minutes to get a ride from here towards Munich. You can get here by taking the Ubahn to stop Neckartor and then walking for about 2 minutes. There's a nice parking lot in the curve there.
If you want to go to Nienburg or Verden it`s good to start from this place. ItÃ‚Â´s easy to hitchhike from this place.

Good spot for traffic towards the A2 and Bielefeld. Don't wait up on the bridge, no place for cars to stop. Down there it is a bit easier for cars to stop, some might be quite fast but chances are higher.
Some space behind the traffic light for hitching a ride towards the A33 (OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck) or Borgholzhausen.Spot is okay and enough traffic passing by.
Bus bay directly next to the train station, good to hitch towards Bad Bentheim, enough space for cars to stop. Sign might be useful, traffic also could be also going only some meters.
ItÃ‚Â´s quit a good area to get away...sundern and all points of the sauerland. the people are not as ,,narrow-mindedÃ‚Â´Ã‚Â´ as you probably appraise...
Heres a parking lot where many cars stop and the street right after the traffic lights has a service lane where people can stop after they go to the highway!
Erreichbar von Esslingen
many tourists are leaving the harz mountains from here to the north. (Bad Harzburg, Braunschweig)

Theres not much Traffic but its the best place to hike to west (A3) and north (A93). Ask to get to Rasthof Jura (Neumarkt). You can reach the spot from the IKEA Bus stop.

Good spot when coming from MÃƒÂ¼nster and traffic only goes towards Greven. First crossing when entering the city, just behind the traffic lights, enough space on hard shoulder to stop cars. Sign might be useful. Much traffic here
Hard shoulder to stand on, a bit narrow but possible  to stop cars just behind the traffic lights. For direction Saerbeck, IbbenbÃƒÂ¼ren. Much traffic here. Be careful with trucks, though.
Possibility to hitch towards Riesenbeck. Spot is just behind a corner, maybe better stand directly at the crossing. Not much space to stop cars, but possible.
lots of traffic heading to wasserbillig, luxembourg from here to fill there cars, enough place to stop but you will most proably get a short lift only to wasserbillig (10km)

to go to Rostock it is good, cars can see you quite early and can stop very well. the paople here are not very open, but you have to be lucky.
good point to go to the north on the highway, not many cars, but friendly people, good possibility to stop and just after the traffic light, so people can see you very early
Good spot to go Stuttgart, Karlsruhe and so on. There's a bus stop, so one can pull over easily. I had several quick lifts there.

to go to A81 its good, many people are drivingthat way, but not too much people so they are able to stop there. Directly behind the sign for autobahn there is a small possibility to stop, (you can see on satellit), but this point is difficult to reach.
best place to change the driver, if you have to go to the A8 to west or east
towards Bad Reichenhall / Berchtesgaden

last time i waited 2 minutes *lucky*

Good for going to Rottenburg, Horb and A81 southwards.

you can reach 'lÃƒÂ¼beck travemÃƒÂ¼nde' (and it's 'skandinavienkai' with the helsinki, trelleborg or poland ferry) from here. cars are driving slow and there is a safe space (a road exiting the federal highway) for them to stop. you should not wait longer than 20 minutes. build a sign saying 'helsinki' and drivers will give you a smile...

a good spot to reach the island of 'rÃƒÂ¼gen'; there is a traffic light where all cars (comming from stralsund- city center) that want to reach the newly built 'rÃƒÂ¼genbrÃƒÂ¼cke' (the bridge) have to stop. stand in the middle of the road where there is a paved (elevated) slip. it should not take longer than 20 to 30 minutes to get to 'bergen' (the islands capital) from here.

the so called 'traffic light of bergen' on B 96 (ask drivers to let you out 'ger.: ... bei der ampel von bergen'). a good to very good spot to reach 'stralsund' (south) or 'sassnitz'/'stubbenkammer chalk cliffs'/'kap arkona' (north). the light is often -on red- creating (sometimes large) traffic jams, too bad for drivers, perfect for us hitchhikers.
Good place to hitchhike Innsbruck way.
nach LÃƒÂ¶bau und Zittau oder weiterlaufen

agip-tankstelle.
stand bisher immer direkt an der straÃƒÅ¸e direkt hinter der tankstelle - gute haltemÃƒÂ¶glichkeit. wenn man zu zweit ist, macht es auch sinn, wenn einer die paar autos, die an der tanke halten abklappert. auf der straÃƒÅ¸e fahren ca. 80% aller leute lang, die auf die autobahn mÃƒÂ¼ssen. die auffahrt selbst ist nicht empfehlenswert, kreisel dann schnellstraÃƒÅ¸en-zubringer. wartezeit von geschÃƒÂ¤tzten 30 mal variiert zwischen 5 und 90 Minuten.
to Wittlich, Trier, Luxembourg. On the other side of the road to KÃƒÂ¶ln, Frankfurt, Koblenz. Good spot.

Pretty easy to get a lift to Germersheim from here. When going to Karlsruhe, prepare for some village hopping.

Aachener Land:

Eisenach A4 direction east: Erfurt, Jena, Leipzig

to Netherlands. A good place in this city is this bus stop, where cars can stop and take you.
