Tried going in the direction of Aachen. But had no luck. Maybe it was because it was a sunday. Its probably better to take a bus and a train to the first gas station in the Aachen direction, its a short walk from the train station.
That was horrible, NOBODY toked usâ€¦in the Afternoon
perfect spot, catched to Aachen in 15 minutes
Perfect spot to Bonn. Stand right at the exit of the gas station and got a ride in 10 mins. On a Thursday afternoon around 1pm

A big petrol station, cars are stopping very often. Had a bad experience with getting to Bonn, I guess it depends from good timing. For Bonn you should look for cars with ''BN-...'' number plate, ''K-...'' usually stays in KÃ¶ln. People often going to Aachen.

I asked people if they are going direction Denmark. A lot of cars going that way. Had luck and found someone who took me all the way to Copenhagen. Recommend to switch here if you want to go further North.
Hitched here for an hour in the evening and got picked up by a polish truck driver, who drove me north of Hamburg, good spot
Gas Station. We had to cope with few traffic northways.
i guess i'll use this place when i go north to switch from A7 to A1.
this is a good spot for hitchhiking in both directions on the a7.
Horrible spot, had to ask even the truck drivers until finally someone agreed on taking us. Was midday even.
I waited 30 mins for a car across the border to Austria. There were many cars going to Austria, but most of them were full.
My friend arranged a ride from here to Budapest almost before I was back from the toilet!
Rest Stop "Jura".

Update July 2025
Roadwork is still going so this spot doesnâ€™t work, traffic is redirected. I would recommend going to Stople raststÃ¤tte

There is roadwork here in 2024-2025 which redirects traffic, I would not recomend this spot not. I waited a long time and almost no traffic. It's supposed to be done in May 2025. I would try another option, like Stolper Heide.
very good spot. However a lot of cars just turning to the gas station, there is a lot of place to stop. And mostly everyone who turns to the highway is going on the right line(there are 3 lines)
were extremely lucky to get a straightride to Rostock. Driver came to us straight. sign E 26 probably.. m/f morning
We  had a sign saying "A24 -> HH" and just waited for 10 min. 2 persons(m/f) friday noon
UPDATE OCT 2025: the entry to the highway is still under construction and it looks like its gonna take long until its done. bc of that its a terrible spot rn with almost no traffic
Right now the road to leipzig is in construction and it is a terrible spot. Just with 2 buses (30 minutes) you can go yo a yet gas station that is a little bit south. Very good that one.

Took me (woman alone) extremely long to find a ride. I walked around the gasstation and stood at different places on the (cross)road. Also had a scary experience with a guy that had purposely stopped on the onramp so I had to decide quickly. Luckily I said no and 30 min later I was taken by a really nice Israeli woman. Maybe part of it being so hard was due to the fact that gas prices were not good there and there weren't many people at the gas station.

got a lift there quickly multiple times
once in the winter I didn't find a lift for over 1.5 hours and gave up

Good and crowded place, there are many options: stay by the road, ask drivers... It convenient to hitch-hike from here towards west and south directions. Also you can meet here a lot of other hitch-hikers in summer. The best option is to come here in the morning.
male in early 30s, alone, waiting with sign and asking people
Really bad spot to go to the West.

friday morning, around 11AM, July, going towrds Berlin
spent the night in my tent behind the station in a little patch of trees, very quite. loads of trucks and cars, i took me a bit to get a ride until the next gas station on A9
i was hitchhiking at the entrance of the highway since there were not many cars stopping for petrol, mostly for food/toilets (at least at this time)
a police car drove pass me and said nothing (its always my biggest fear)
station is good. expensive, but there are to
i agree that there aren't that many cars passing by, but i only had to wait there for 20mins on a cold november thursday
There's plenty of space for cars to pull over, but not much traffic, waited about 1.5 hours to get a ride to the A9
Tiny gasstation little traffic and many going north to Hannover/Gottingen. I had to go to OsnabrÃ¼ck. I did get offered a ride to Berlin tho.
Got ride to A44 after 15 min. Very small place.
Gas station, direction north to Kassel, A7, A44

A guy and a girl on a Monday evening with an arrow sign to get in the direction of Kiel and Hamburg. This is not the best spot, but I think it's bad enough for people to help you if you get here. We got a ride to Schuby (west of Schlewig) quickly.
Didn't like this one, too narrow, to rushy, but wtf, I got a lift in like 15 Minutes. Wouldn't recommend it though.
I tried to get to Berlin from Aarhus and here I got lift directly to Berlin after some 45 mins.

We tried to get to the A2 (East) just to get to Helmstedt (or, if lucky, Magdeburg -> Berlin -> Poland), but we didn't get a lift. Many drivers told us that they were heading Western or Northern though
You need a sign showing the direction you want to go or you can talk directly to the drivers at the traffic light.
Very quiet in the weekend, might be better during commute hours. We managed to stop someone on the ramp to Berlin.

Tried to get to Berlin from here on a Sunday afternoon. The place was almost deserted and almost everybody there was either heading south or into Hannover. I gave up after an hour and went to Garbsen, which was way more frequented, and got a ride there within 20 minutes.
There is an Aral gasstation connecting directly with the A2 to go east. So maybe there are cars going to Berlin etc. Take the local train to Jadekamp stop and walk the rest of the way.

Almost no cars stop here, the gas station before (total energies) is better as it's cheaper and everyone stops there. We walked to the highway entrance, lot of local rides but at least something to get out.

A second gas station has been built serving the cars going to Freiburg. Cars going to direction Stuttgart, Konstanz or Tuttlingen can be found in a reasonable time. I am from LÃ¶ffingen so it's perfect for me to have such an amazing hitching spot right in front of my door.
B31.Direction Bodensee, Bavaria...

Itâ€™s a small rest stop, thereâ€™s not a lot of cars stopping there (some people wait before picking up relatives at the airport and wait here so as to not pay for the airport parking), rather clean toilets if you have to pee. Asked all the cars I could (not many) and eventually got a ride to the airport not too far

Kleiner Rastplatz: Am Entenfang 
Toiletten, Polizei, Telefonzelle

Autobahnpolizei stÃƒÂ¶rt sich nicht an Trampern

GegenÃƒÂ¼ber Rastplatz Stockweg, weniger benutzt

ca. 45min FuÃƒÅ¸weg von S-Bahn GroÃƒÅ¸enbaum, lohnt sich aber fast immer. (Oder Fahrrad am Waldrand anketten)

Technically good spot, because you stay in pedestrian zone, at bus stop. Drivers have a comfort place to stop. But drivers think it's not necessary to take you, bus will grab you, that's what they think. But drivers who really want to take you â€“ definitely will. I didn't catch nobody, so I took a BOSS.
At Busstop good spot for cars to stop. Direction Schluchsee, Freiburg. Likely to get only short distance lifts.
Not that many cars, but got a ride from a first guy i asked that was going to Bremen
got a ride from here almost till osnerbrueck but not the best place
not so many cars but not the worst place ever

Drivers coming from Stockelsdorf can be stopped here quite good as there is an entry to the gas station were people can park. People drive in both directions: Hamburg and TravemÃ¼nde. However, I'd rather suggest to go directly to the exits on the other side of the street...

needed to get to A5 south, people ignored us or looked disgusted, lot of rich people and taxis. after some hours i decided to hide and let my girlfriend take the job. after a while some bolt guy offered blowjob to her, than marriage, but took us to the first gas station on A5 for free. (without bj or marriage). we slept at nearby field, 5km from airport to not to get killed

Lots of cars going through, but you mostly get ignored. Be prepared to wait. I first tried unsuccessfully with a card saying "Stuttgart", which is a bit too ambitious. Then I switched to a sign saying "A5 sÃ¼d". Eventually I joined with two other hitchhikers, who were going to Paris. I was taken to Karlsruhe by a German man. It seems that waiting closer to the ramp is slightly more effective.
Very bad spot Imho, fancy cars and taxis do not take. Others care more about which turn to take.
Got a car at the departure zone, right before the barrier, easy cause people have to stop
SchÃ¶ner Platz, jedoch auch sehr viele Leute mit Firmenwagen die einen nicht mitnehmen sollen/wollen. Aber nach 15 Mnuten gings weiter. Eing guter Platz zum starten.

We thumbed here with a sign for Leipzig for ~2hrs and didn't a lift. Its
's a difficult place for cars to stop and also on a wednesday there was pretty much only local drivers. Maybe on a nicer day or in the summer its a better but we had no luck. Later we went to the rasthof near nikolassee and got a hitch in 30 minutes!

Quite a while back and I wasn't very experienced, but this spot was the worst, I waited very long behind the planks, cars can't park very safely there. 
I don't know about the petrol station, but don't go to the ramp. Just drive over to Michelsberg if you can
Senseless spot for going north. Not much traffic at this gasoline station.
Very good spot! Never waited more than 15 minutes. I hitchhiked from here to Dortmund several times and most times I got a direct lift to my destination. :-)
got a ride after 30 minutes to a petrol station on the A9 in the direction to Leipzig

Waited there for more than 3h with a sing (KÃ¶ln), later i gave up and walked further west to Katharinenkreisel. Don't know why no one was stopping because i think its a good stop and everyone is heading to the Highway. There i waited only 20 minutes (Lucky) because there was not much traffic.

Came here to go south, waited 30 min. A woman came bye walking and said thats nonsense, no one is going south. "Look in google where it leads you if you want to go south." Yeah she was right. Pointed me to a gas station south of the main train station, good spot.

Apart from that probably a good spot for other directions, plenty of space to stop. You have to stand on the bicycle lane though.
Waited almost 2 hours with a sign "A5 SÃ¼d" on Sunday afternoon. Many cars just drove by.

after 2 min a guy took us (me and a girl at 14:00 on a cloudy sunday summer day) to a gas station direction kÃ¶ln. very easy and very busy, good place for cars to stop, good traffic. Totally recommend. Maybe I was lucky, but that's what hitchhiking is about, right? you have to be lucky and make your luck happen
About one month ago (Nov. '11) I tried to hitchhike from here but there was a building site so the cars couldn't stop there.
went to Berlin in december and waited for 1.5 hours, asking people directly. Most were locals, many went to the west, only 1 to Berlin
most traffic is local...

Comment by n0id: I doubt that more cards go towards Berlin. Usually about the same amount of cars go each direction, but not necessarily far as most of the traffic is local. Also, as a golden rule, all drivers are going to whatever direction you are not hitching to ;-)
very popular spot, stood here with 4 other hikers one Friday afternoon. No bad experiences with the owner so far

This spot is good indeed for eastbound traffic towards berlin or into the northern periphery of Magdeburg. Please DO NOT TRY THIS SPOT FOR WESTBOUND TRAFFIC. That might seriously ruin your trip. I waited over 90 mins in peak outbound traffic but not a single car was going west on the A2. Try "Agip" petrol station on the Albert Vater Str. (B1). That worked much better for westbound traffic.

Pretty dead gas station, lucky rides exist. There is a pathetic little man working here who will take Pfand and then not give you money because if you found it on the station, technically it's their property.

Do not rcommend getting stuck here late, dead gas station, very few cars passing by and many going north, and truck drivers just coming to sleep. I got super lucky waiting at the exit of this Rastplatz as a Polish truck driving on the highway saw my sign for Koblenz and decided to stop at the exit lane of Rastplatz. He was able to drop me off as far as Werratal Rastplatz near Eisenach
Easy if u want to go north

Easy to find a lift to the north like cologne or bonn, much harder to find someone going to the east or frankfurt.
its an average at all.

seemed like a good spot to start towards Vienna, since you can adress people directly at the gas station and cars are slowed down due to road restrictions, but even though its connected to A94, most people passing by are staying in munich. But in the end we (2 guys) got lucky, so the spot itself is quite good.
My girlfriend didn't even manage to write a sign and guy stoped for us and took us to Linz
You can easily hitch at the entrance of the petrol station if you want to go to Passau. There are not many people stoping at the petrol station but if they do, you can go and ask them for a ride.

Waited for 2 hours with some cars being unable to take us because we were with 3 people. Originally the plan was ulm or Munich. The amazing guy that eventually picked us up went to Lindau via ulm.
Lindau is a village on lake Constance, the biggest lake in Germany and we decided to go along.

I tried it on a friday, 15:00. Destination: Muenchen. Lots of cars, most of the with number plates of Stuttgart, Esslingen, Waiblingen. I had to waite 1,5 h, but the person that finally picked me up said, that this is the point where she always passes driving to Muenchen.

I tried to hitchhike to Munchen on a weekday at 17:00 for 75 minutes. There was A LOT of traffic but very few cars had Munchen plates. 3 cars stopped, but niether went even in the direction of Munchen. Then, I just went and took a bus to Munchen for 8 euros.
depends on in which direction you want
lot of cars stopped, its a good spot but we decided to spend the night in the city
It is a good spot! Not all cars might go the desired direction but others will! ;)
probably the best spot to go north, going further up proved to be a complete waste of time.
At a road with a lot of traffic. Cars can see you quite late, but it is still okay. The good thing is that it is directly at a bus stop and a traffic light. So the cars can pick you up easily.
Good spot, especially right after flight

Right after the parkings, there are many cars going in all directions. In the 15' that i've been there, i had 4 cars stopping, 2 going west to luxembourg, 1 going south, and 1 going to east to Frankfurt (my direction). Thursday 14:00

he/she is right! be prepared that the airport might be dead at times and all cars are either fully packed or too snobbish to pick you up! same goes with (all?) other airports. I stood here 1 1/2 hrs with no success! (and the cool hotdog stand was gone, so no fun!;))

The airport itself is not a fantastic place to get a ride - walk 15 or 20 minutes out along the main road (heading south) and try at the B50 junction.
Alternately, when you are on your plane, ask other passengers for a ride...
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Hahn_Airport

I arrived around 20:30 on a Friday in summer, very glad for the free bathroom (not super clean but not too bad) and free drinking water. Had a bit of a hard time finding a ride into Nuremberg despite lots of traffic since most people were going to Munich. Found someone to take me to an U-Bahn station nearby (HerrnhÃ¼tte.)
I was just heading into NÃ¼rnberg (coming from KÃ¶ln) and immediately found someone who could drive off the next intersection and drop me off.
I had to wait a long time because all the people went for holiday to the Alps and I wanted to go to Passau.
A good place on the way to Munich/Vienna.

almost noone going to bremen from here, if you want to go to the netherlands, a sign with bielefeld helped me. try to get a ride to the westward highway from hannover as its quite annoying to do it after. dont take rides to hannover if you plan on going west!
Okay spot. Few traffic.

Not the best and not the worst place to get out of Hamburg. I went twice direction Hanover from here. Both times a truck drivers took me. Holding a sign or thumbing is not the way you will get a quick ride. Asking for a ride will do the job. This rest stop is easily reachable from metro-station "Harburg". Bus 443, 143 and 148 stop at "Sinstorfer Kirchweg". The rest stop is just half a click away.
Stood there for about 40 hours to direction Hannover. Not many cars, mainly trucks.

good visibility but sucks to stop. i think it looks quite different to how it was in the other reviews, had better success standing on the middle stripe even though its probably super illegal. eventually got taken to the big station down the road from where going towards the netherlands is much easier

I don't really agree with the spot made for hitchhikers. To much traffic and the pedeastian crossing is not really made for stopping cars. On the other hand I got of in 35 Minutes. A lot of cars from Winsen/Luhe drive past, so if you come up with a sign for the next gas station on the highway Harburger Berge it might increase your chances.

This spot is suposed to be made for hitch-hiking. Cars always have to stop because of the zebra crossing. Just first hlod your hand out and ask friendly where they go, if they open the window. 45mins waiting was on a sunday morning 7:45...
habe hier viele touren angefangen, bin zuverlaessig innerhalb von 20-40 minuten mitgenommen worden.
Waited here for 6 whole hours. The people barely speak any English and flee whenever they are approached. Additionally everyone is going to berlin, very few cars are going towards leipzig
Often difficult to find somebody to Halle, Leipzig or Dresden since most people go to Berlin. Probably the best place around, though.
we arrived here on a Friday morning and it took more than an our to get a lift to Berlin.

Rasthof BÃƒÂ¶rde SÃƒÂ¼d.

Good for Berlin, but for Berlin there's also a good spot in Magdeburg.

It might be worth to take the bus out here and walk to the service station if you want to go on the A14.
Great if you're going to Austria (either Innsbruck or Salzburg), many different gas station options to ask around

Wonderful spot, despite the customer service at the cafÃ©. Huge amounts of cars heading to south (mostly Balkan, maybe Italy too). Got a ride by asking people to Ljubljana, even though it was past midnight. Could've gotten to Bosnia as well by the same car.
A lot of people but nobody to take us. After 2h finally a road to Salzburg. But you could be lucky. A lot of trip to MÃ¼nchen or Innsbruck. A lot of families, no place in cars.

Got picked up towards Salzburg after 20 mins. I tried the gas station but I found that waiting here was the best option. Walk down towards the parking lot and back to give people more time to see you. There's also wifi from the burger king.
Not such a good spot as it seems at the first sight.
Police were nice, let me hitch from just after the border (where cars are slow). In the end somebody from the restaurant called me over after seeing me for a while. Easy to go direction Freiburg

I started two times from this place, first time it was very very difficult to find someone, we waited about 3 hours, second time was a little bit easier, but it took us also about 1 hour to get away from there. But it was both times on weekdays, so many people are on the way to work and donÂ´t drive longer distances. Maybe on weekend its better...
After 2 hours during a night in summer (full cars) I got a ride all the way to Wiesbaden, near Frankfurt. I'm still grateful for the couple that took me with them.
we wanted to go direction karlsruhe but there were so little cars that after some time we decided to try another spot.

don't know if I was just lucky, but I got a ride after 2 minutes directly to Berlin from here. I think it's the best spot for everybody who wants to hitchhike large distances from Switzerland to the north of Germany
Very easy to get to Rostock and Denmark. At least during summer holidays.
It was easy 15 min. [with Rostock signal] a truck driver picked me up quickly

We were trying to get to Rostock, but most of the cars were heading to Hamburg. After standing here for almost 3h we crossed the autobahn and the first driver we asked took us to the outskirts of Berlin.
Last gas station before motorway splits in the two direction Hamburg and Rostock, mostly people who aim Rostock or Schwerin stop there, but I also got a lift directly to Hamburg.
Motorway service area. Gas station with a diner behind.
Got a ride to my destination Buddikate. A sweet young couple brought me there after I asked the man for a ride towards LÃ¼beck.
I guess not the best spot as other say, but we asked around and got ride to the better stop heading toward Denmark.
Waited about an hour on a Sunday (11:30-12:30) and got a ride to LÃ¼beck. I was standing at the Exit with a LÃ¼beck sign. I have the feeling itâ€™s not the best spot for LÃ¼beck but good enough.
I waited 40 minutes and found a lift straight to Berlin. Good place to go ask the drivers.
Getting a car to Berlin from didn't work! Better to find a ride into Hamburg and hitch from the beginning of A24.

Took us 5min to get to Kopenhagen from here. Fairly small gas station, but decent traffic. 
Probably worth it to ask around as most are heading to Puttgarden from here

Was dropped there at 8 PM on a Friday and it was pretty empty. Had to ask around and seemed most people were going North to the ferry at Puttgarden. Scored a ride all the way to Copenhagen, and would probably be better during the day.The worker there even gave me a free coffee!
stranded on a Sunday, lunch time. Bad choice :D <took an hour to get onto Fehmarn

I got dropped there at 15.00 a weekday. Not many cars, maybe 35-45 during the hour I waited. Several locals going only to Neustadt and many fully packed tourist cars. Some trucks come through here and finally a truck picked me up to MalmÃ¶.

As said before not very busy especially not on a morning, but never the less the best stop after LÃ¼beck if your driver is not going all the way up north to the ferry. Asked a friendly trucker who got me to Puttgarden.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Friday at noon. We didn't have to wait for long before a girl took us to Manheim. It wasn't our destination, but we didn't feel like refusing as the spot is not ideal to stop.
Seems like a poor place, especially as the traffic light system is so damn efficient meaning the cars generally flow through. But you shouldn't be waiting more than an hour for a lift.

People do not see this little stopping space from their cars even when they stay on the red light, because it is a little bit higher than both streets are.I recommend to stay on  traffic lights, then if someone want to take you, he will just stop on the Mannheimer Strasse.
not much stopping space... but it's germany, bitches!

Depending on your direction it's a pretty good place to either get to Mannheim or North towards Frankfurt.
I tried making it to France (via K'lautern and SaarbrÃ¼cken) and failed miserably. I definitely wouldn't recommend hitching from here, but rather trying to get south on the A5 towards Strasbourg, that worked fine.
No longer a busstop here
To many HH
Did not see any bus stop there or any spot where cars could stop; luckily I was able to continue to another ramp
Excellent spot for going north towards Flensburg and Denmark! Almost no waiting time in early morning.
Excellent spot. Bustop offers plenty of room for people to pull over. Got a ride to kiel in 5 minutes.
Quite a common blablacar pickup spot in Dresden. we also managed to join a blabla group to Giessen
Asked people around McDonald's and Jet gas station - got a ride to Breslau/WrocÅ‚aw after 30 minutes.
Needed to get to Zittau and got a lift directly there after 5 mins, asking at McDonaldÂ´s.

Seen lot of cars with B sign, some also with L. And got lift to Berlin in 5 mins with thumb at the exit from McDonald and petrol station.
For CZ and PL I guess it's possible to get ride to Dresdner Tor at the A4 and hitch from there
bad place for berlin at least. somebody took me to hansa straÃŸe. there it was much easier. so go there and dont came here

During night time itâ€™s totaly empty. 
And even during day timeâ€¦ We have waited for 7 hours.
Ok spot. Find a car to Kiel in an hour, but definetly not a lot of traffic. Nice wall at the end to sit tumbs up.
Little traffic toward North, but has a shop and benches to sit
and it is possible to get there and get away with a bus if necessary, or you can easily get there by foot.
Many going to Hamburg early in the morning, but found car after 1 hour at 8 in the morning. Also a fine place to put up a tent in the night.
Mainly local traffic but luckily it was a sunny day so we were snacking, asking, hh with sign. We got taken by a couple in campervan.
not bad

Many people are going south and north, not just to Saarbrucken, but it's the last restaurant before Kaiserslautern. After some 45 minutes a girl brought us to the spot on the exit number 10 - Aral station from where a guy took us directly to Paris.
I got lifts to SaarbrÃ¼cken or at least to the Rasthof RAMSTEIN or RaststÃ¤tte WALDMOHR. Looks calm, but absolutely easy-going.
Got a lift into Saarbrucken after approx. 30 mins.

It's an OK spot if you are prepared to wait. Lots of cars passing through but a lot of local traffic. If you are hitchhiking southwards, I'd entirely avoid going into central Karlsruhe in the first place. Stay on the autobahn, e.g. Bruchsal West.

Unsuccessful. It might not be a good spot to get a ride to the South. I did not find any to Strasbourg
But there are many cars and good space for a car to stop for you, which is a bus station. Cars come from a side road as well.
waited for a long time in direction to frankfurt. went then to the south entry of the central train station and asked people for a ride
the cars are really fast but it works if you are reallaxed - i tried to go to freiburg from there
Doesn't work for going North or East (Frankfurt, Nuremberg..), don't waste your time standing there..

We were waiting here in frozing winter and the guy pick us from there to the border of Poland.
Good place because people must waited on the red lights.
Not a good place to go in Poland, I've waited for 3h without results
I was standing here for 4h hours, then the police came to say that i won't have any ride here. And the rain arrived, i left to take a bus to Praha.
I was standing not exactly on the ramp but 20-30 meters before. There was plenty of space for cars to hold, and got a ride all the way to Dresden within five min.
Not a bad place. I got a car from here to Dresden.
Same as RazorSK - westood there for 1,5 h and didnt catch any ride at all (2 persons, saturday in august at 18:00). went back home when the sun got down.

Used it on a weekday in summer, going in direction of Dresden. It's a fairly good spot, but not too many people turn towards Dresden form here. Watch out for the cars in your back, the ramp you stand on is very slim. Took me 45 mins to get a ride.
Good location to go east. Especially friday super easy to go to Poland. I used it on a Saturday early morning and got a lift all the way to wroclaw in 20 minutes .

2 guys, Saturday at 18 o'clock, to Dresden

we tried both sides and didn't managed to catch a ride, on the one side there's no sufficient place to stop cars and on the other one wasn't really much cars going event that direction, we then moved to spot in southwest direction

Average spot to get a ride to the circle autobahn (A10), if you're in a hurry. Not easy for cars to stop, you have to get in during the red phase of the traffic lights. Most of the cars will stay in town, but sometimes you get lucky and people will stay on the autobahn to get out of town, in which case you can ask them to take you to Michendorf (huge petrol station at the A10), from which you can go basically everywhere (south, west).

Waited 3 and a half hours to get a ride even two rest areas further (don't get dropped at Halledau West btw if you want to go north, it's just on one side of the A9 and less cars going north stop there), many people went just fairly locally or, and that depends on the season, were families returning from vacation and had no space
I got a ride to Zwickau it was so lucky... but this rest area is perfekt to get a ride to northward (direction Regensburg or Nuremberg)
Weekday, end of august, 3pm. Average traffic, lots of cars full, found a car to Augsburg after 30min (wanted to go to Stuttgart and then France).

Me and my girlfriend wanted to go to Stuttgart (A8) in a sunday afternoon, we had to wait for like 2 hours to get a lift to Augsburg. No shades, expensive water at the station... Not a good place to hike
Waited about two hours until I found someone going to the A9 north. (Weekday evening)

Huge station: filling station + resting area + restaurant, we tried at the exit on Saturday afternoon. A huge amount of cars passed by, mostly going to the North (we were heading to Stuttgart), mostly full-packed and Dutch. From here going North is OK, I think, but going West seemed impossible. After 3 hours we decided to hitch into Munich centre and get to the beginning of A8 highway by public transport, which is straight way th Stuttgart. It was a good idea! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), S

Got a lift to the Bodensee after 30min. The traffic is going to every direction because everyone from austria and the balkan and even italy is taking this route. 
Look for car signs with:  OA, OAL, LI, STA, KE, WM, FN or KN, Swiss signs or Austrian signs with "B", to go to the Bodensee.

It was horrible...
I waite 1h 30min until i got a ride to the rest area Vaterstetten (A99) it was friday (9AM)

Ive hitched twice at this spot, both times from Salzburg to Munich during summer and both times got stuck here for 3HRS+!!!  Getting to Munich from this gas station SUCKS!! (in my experience). Most cars were full, but there were plenty of rides going to Nurembrrg and Berlin. It probably would have been easier to get dropped off at the gas station on the ring road then ride the s-bahn from Vaterstetten.

Weekday, end of august, noon. Not a lot of cars, many cars quite full and going in different directions. After 2 hours looking for a lift to Ulm/Stuttgart/Karlsruhe, we took a lift to the next petrostation (Vaterstetten) which seemed bigger.
Good spot if you're asking people directly.
I am originally from Augsburg and this is my favourite spot to start hitchhiking westwards. Ask people and you get a ride to Pforzheim, Stuttgart or Ulm in 10-40 min.
OK if you ask drivers. Best results if you ask for a nearby destination, p.e. Ulm.
I asked people at the station, where they are already out of their cars and rejecting communication with me is more difficult ;) Just took me 10minutes

Insa and Jan found it ok to hitch from here in middle of May. Ask people at the service station and also have a sign to indicate youâ€™re a hitchhiker. Feasible is to get a ride to Ulm or a little further.
I waited for about 3 hours to finally get a ride direction Leipzig. Most traffic is going north to Hannover or local. This was at the Aral gas station
Great place for east (A38) as well as north (A7) :)
Many Polish cars and plying Polish buses stop here. All of them go through Leipzig in that direction.
Perfect place to get from the A7 to the A38 (Leipzig) since many cars that come from the A44 (west) stops here to tank before going to east (for instance Poland).
Going to GÃ¶ttingen/Hannover, better get off one place before, in Guxhagen.
Really small gas station and waited for a hour or more just to ride to Salzburg. We had to ask at the gas station. Despite the lot of traffic, not so many cars at the gas station...

Thought it was a good idea since it was the last station before the border to get vignette, but it's a really small station with less traffic than expected. Got a ride after 30 min to Ljubljana, but that was pure luck. You might want to consider the next petrol station.
Very compact gas station, we waiting 3 hours to get a ride to Salzburg 12 km away!

Arrived here when it was getting dark and cold, couldn't get a ride. Tried to find a place to sleep by just asking people in the village, but the onces I asked were not so friendly. Slept in a hotel. Got a ride the next morning on the on-ramp, just behind the petrol station

Very small station and not many people stop here because they prefer going into Austria (see the next big petrol station east) where fuel is cheaper. Nobody that stops here is going to Italy btw, so don't waste your time with that.
Generally ok if you want to catch a ride south but not ideal if you want to want to go west on the A44. Rather get out a station before..
Can confirm the above comment, our driver told us the same. If you come from the A44 it's better to get off at BÃ¼hleck.

The fuelstation has closed in southern direction(northern it's as it was). There is still a parking lot and I had luck with a truck driver, but, coming from GÃ¶ttingen, you better ignore this station imho. (next on A7 is Hasselberg).
"Dreieck Kassel-SÃ¼d". The highway splits up here. It seems that more people go to the west on A44. Nevertheless there is much traffic so you will find a lift to the south with some patience.
Nice spot, lots of truck-drivers, and easy to get there from the city. Got a truck-ride within 10 min.
The location is not that good, but we were lucky enough to get a ride by asking a couple of guys with a Luxembourg license plate. (1 M, 1 F)
good to talk to people at the shop/McDonalds.
Good spot for SaarbrÃ¼cken (A6) and Trier/Luxembourg (A62)
been there twice the first time I had to wait about 20 minutes and the second time I have been there for about an hour. Both times my destination was SaarbrÃ¼cken
april 2012 - bad ; it was freezing ! i was trying to get to trier, waited 2 hours, then i changed my sign to saarbrÃ¼cken, and had a lift quickly ; but it was freezing
Should be able to find cars going directly to Dresden.
i think its a good place with thumbing too, just stand on the ramp
This place can be really lonely. It looks so huge, but there wasn't a lot of traffic coming through. I recommend asking people directly, not thumbing.
well not much traffic, but in these  cases there was also not that much traffic on highway, don't know what i should think about

I have been here two times and both times this petrol station revealed not a good place where to switch drivers - fuel supplied by Total, it's a bit more expensive than other companies and this explains a bit why both times I have seen so few drivers in this spot. I recommend to avoid it if it's possible.
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught immediately :)

Huge station: filling station + resting area + restaurant, we tried at the exit on Saturday afternoon. A huge amount of cars passed by, mostly going to the North (we were heading to Stuttgart), mostly full-packed and Dutch. From here going North is OK, I think, but going West seemed impossible. After 3 hours we decided to hitch into Munich centre and get to the beginning of A8 highway by public transport, which is straight way th Stuttgart. It was a good idea! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), S

Oct 15; waited here for 2h to get a lift further than Munich. Many were going to Munich.
ask people on the restarea ;)
Got a lift to augsburg in 1 hour. Try to stay on the A8 instead of A96. Good spot!
Me and my girlfriend wanted to go in direction to Stuttgart, we got a lift after 10 minutes. Calm and shady place, ideal for hitchhiking.

Indeed perfect spot to continue on the A3 towards Frankfurt, but I needed to turn west on the A6 towards Mannheim... It took me 3 hours to finally find someone who was going in this direction and could take me. 
This gas station is quite busy so you can ask many people in a short time. I think the best is t stand at the main entrance of the shop/restaurant, almost everyone goes there.

same as RobertoCarlos;
found someone who brought us to NÃ¼rnberg Feucht

I was heading for Amsterdam but got dropped here in the evening, Couldn't find a ride. Behind the shop I popped my tent in the Forest, The next morning I walked around the parking lot for cars where I approached a Dutch guy with a van. he took me to DE/NL border.

AgreedÂ²! To go north on the A9 either convince someone to go out of their way to take you to Feucht or if you get really stuck, go onto the A6 and cross the motorway at the 1st petrol station after Nuremberg (Kammersteiner Land, to cross walk about 700m east) and continue from there, it's a detour of about one hour but has worked very well for me.

I totally agree! Perfect for Frankfurt and the A3, but a desaster for the A9 north. Waited for 3h, then persuaded a driver going to Frankfurt to drop us off at the petrol station NÃ¼rnberg Feucht on A9.
Never try to hitchhike here because cars can't stop for you
God lift in direction of Nurnberg quite fast ~15 minutes

AoÃ»t 2014. Seul, je n'ai jamais Ã©tÃ© pris aprÃ¨s plus de 4 heures d'attente, pluie et froid au rendez-vous. Je me suis tristement rÃ©solu Ã  prendre le train.

J'ai essayÃ© avec un carton indiquant CHEMNITZ. Puis j'ai essayÃ© sans carton. J'ai testÃ© les deux bretelles d'accÃ¨s (il y avait beaucoup de place pour s'arrÃªter sur cette autre bretelle mais presque pas de trafic)... Rien Ã  faire. A croire que les gens ne comprenaient pas ce que je faisais lÃ  (d'aprÃ¨s les signes qu'ils me faisaient en tout cas
use this location relatively often, you can get a lift in 15 mins or 1hr. can be frustrating
definively possible here, had lifts in 2 minutes, but also 90.

Please, could somebody write the description of the spot by specifying what you mean by 'direction south'? 

I am confused because to me 'south' means NÃ¼rnberg/ Munich but I got the impression that you mean Borna or Chemnitz. 

What is right?
Waited only 10 minutes to get a ride to Kassel. It was a monday morning around 7:30 o clock. Sign saying A38 -> KS.

Depends on day and time. I often had good luck (<10min), but one time it took 3 hours (Tuesday around 11 o clock). But many cars stop and ask, sometimes they go just too short destinations). Good if you want to go south. Friday afternoon/ evening and Sunday evening is quiet good.

Wanted to get to the A38 and it was not good. Waited there twice, first time 2h no luck (Sunday 10-noon) second time 2h before I go a good ride.
Location seems very good though, lots of space to pull over, bridge to shelter from rain.
good if want to go south (borna, chemnitz), terrible place to reach the a9 (waited several times more than 2h) lot's of people stop through.
This is not a nice spot, just walk a bit further east to find nicer ones...
20 seconds at the traffic light!
its possible to hitch from here - BUT i recommend to walk like 500 meters along on the 'FaulerstraÃŸe' till it crosses the 'SchnewlinstraÃŸe'. Way much easier here!!!
i waited for half an hour and it worked. it's right that the possibilities for cars to stop are not perfect, but ok enough i guess...
It's not true, I know that people are hitching from this place. The cars have to stop at an illegal spot though.
Was difficult place. But guy stopped after red light later and took me to first gasstation on the way.

I come from Berlin and regularly drive with my car by this place in order to go to the autobahn. I sometimes see hitchhikers but, although I would be willing to give a lift, it is almost impossible to stop there.

a very bad place. there is nowhere to stop the car, do not recommend this place. better find something else.a very bad place. there is nowhere to stop the car, do not recommend this place. better find something else.
no real possibility for cars to stop, you have to ask the driver at the stoplight. quite uncomfortable, but it worked somehow.
To Dresden, it's safer to stay on the "southern" part of the crossroad: There are less cars, but drivers have time to see you and can stop easily.
Solo woman with sign for Stuttgart picked up within minutes. 14:30 on a Friday, September 2025. Stood at exit of roundabout for Stuttgart.

From here its possible to hitch to Stuttgard or Munich (two different exits of the roundabout), but there is mostly local traffic (should be easy to hitch to Ulm).
We tried to get to Munich and had a sign, but it took us a while. Try to find somebody who takes you to the next gas sation on the A8 in direction of Munich or better donÂ´t get dropped here if you want to go to Munich :)

A lot of local traffic going north. Ask the people at the Burger King parking lot or the gas station, that's where most of the people from the A8 go to in my experience. If you need any infos about the busses etc. go to the reception of the hotel. The two receptionists were pretty friendly and helpful and seemed to be used to the sight of hitchhikers.

Rest area just behind the exit from the motorway (also indicated on the sign on the motorway).

There's a big parking area, a hotel, a restaurant and a petrol station.
On the other side of the road there is a bus stop (at the side where cars drive towards the motorway).

Much local traffic, many drivers stop for the night instead of going further.

Getting a lift into the direction of Stuttgart works.
But into direction of Munich there's almost nobody.

Hitching to the city of Ulm should work, j
Many short rides, waited for 40 mins to get on the highway
on my experience, only locals
Good spot but not really for heading towards "Ulm". Waited for 1 hour with my sign out.
Good place to leave Stuttgart towards Karlsruhe. Takes some time to get there but than it is fairly easy to get a ride.
Just behind the Aral gas-station(maybe Esso, not sure any more) is a bus stop. its right at the beginng of the two lanes part, so a good place to stop for cars.
We got a ride within 5 minutes, started on Monday early in the morning. We had a sign "A5 Nord". Super easy!
addition: i was there at a saturday around 2pm and there were lots of cars, i got a ride in 2min

it's a good spot. i wanted to get direction north and the second and third person (one came to me to ask where i need to go, while i was asking the other) offered to take me to karlsruhe/frankfurt (A5). you can take the tram or walk there easily.

We tried to get a ride to France from here but it turned out to be very difficult. There were a few people going this way but they didn't take us (a girl and me). The problem is that if you wanna go to France you need someone who's going directly since there is no gas station before people turn from the A5 to Switzerland towards Mulhouse. So what we did was taking a ride to the north until the second gas station near Appenweiher. There you can easily switch to the other side of the highway just

THIS is the aral gas station. I used this place several time to get out of Freiburg. You can easily reach it by taking tram #1 and hop off at Brauerei Ganther.
Both directions (south to Switzerland and north to Karlsruhe and Frankfurt) are possible there! Just talk to the people when they fill up their car. Good luck!
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place
5 minutes to dresden
I use this place every week. Average waiting time: 30 min. I have to admit that this place is quite dangerous because some drivers are using the right lane illegally for driving.
When I saw the place, I did not even try to start hitch-hiking there.
I can not recommend this place. Cars are passing with quite high speed and there's not much space for standing.

Tried to catch  a car here without any result.But you can still try it because cars stop here on traffic lights or a bit further on the turn to the parking. Instead of doing this we went to the bus stop down the road (it's on A25 just before roundabout) and found a lift here to Fehmarn.
took some time but got a ride with three peolple towards fehmarn
Don't stand at the lights, walk up a bit to where the road goes left to the highway and right to the parking. Cars don't go that fast yet, see you perfectly and have plenty of space.
The spot is not too bad as people can stop in the entrance to the street turning right. However, you need to climb up from the bike path to the street.
A trafficlight just before the ramp on the way to the ferry at Puttgarden. Good place to ask for rides.

Me and a buddy tried to hitch to Denmark border late afternoon for 2 hours but had no luck, tried agan the morning after, caught a ride after 1 hour and half to Hamburg 'cause we decided to try to go to the ferry.
best spot direction Hamburg. Hitched around 50x from that place and usually got a ride between 30 minutes.
Difficult to stop, but a lot of cars. Only place which worked for us towards Hamburg.
Couldn't get a ride there for about 2 hours, probably cause there isn't much space to stop a car, so i found my ride at IKEA parking lot, which is right next to that spot.

Its at a traffic-light. There are three lanes for cars going left directing the motorway (A215 leading to the A7) either northwards towards Danmark or southwards towards Hamburg, Hannover, Kassel etc.
no service station, restaurant closes at 9pm - you don't want to get here late.

Didn't expect this place to be very good, but it was better than we expected. Even though there's no gas station and just a small restaurant there are least about 4-5 cars every 10 minutes. Took us about 30-40 minutes to find a ride all the way to Berlin eventually.

waited here for 3 hours with no traffic whats so ever. Finally lucked out with a ride straight to berlin, don't know if i can recommend it because i don't know how often those miracle rides happen, even though we know pretty often... :)
Got straight rides to Aarhus (DK), Vilnius (LT) and literally everywhere in Poland from here.

Parking area Bentheimer Wald with restaurant, police, many trucks. May be good to get Polish trucks. Not many private cars stopping here. Perfect spot when police is closing the border for controls ;-)
Got dropped there in the evening, trying to go South. Ended up walking all the way back along the B181 to the other side of the highway, to the traffic lights in DÃ¶lzig.
just thumps up and got a ride to Ingolstadt = )

waited and also walked around to ask people coming from the shopping malls but couldn't find anybody took the bus after about one hour. I think it is definitely better to get dropped off on the other side of the Highway on the B181when going into Leipzig.
Easy to hitching in to Leipzig, best with a sign

Tried to ge a ride in front of the mall to Munich because i missed the busstop "DÃ¶lzig, B 181/SÃ¼dstr.". Bad attempt, people were really mocking about me. At least after 30min of waiting a guy felt pity about me and dropped me off at the next roadhouse.

Quite hard to get to the spot from Bremen. first you take the bus and then you hope for the best (you have to check if the doors to highway next to the bridge are open). Got a ride to Hamburg pretty quick tho
Not much traffic here but we got lucky by asking around and got ride to Hamburg.

Not super busy: it's just a parking lot with some toilets, benchs, and trucks. Got lucky and was offered two rides within 10 minutes. The first was going the wrong way for me and the other took me straight to Hamburg.
Actually a bad spot, but better than anyplace in Bremen for getting to Hamburg.
Not much space for cars to stop, also there's not much traffic. Nevertheless I managed to get a ride really fast.
Got picked up quite fast on Sunday morning. Not a lot of traffic on Sunday at least

-> A4 / EAST (Dresden)
I got dropped off in this exact location by a local guy who always uses this place for hitchhiking himself.
Not a perfect place - the side of the road didn't seem wide enough for car to pull over at first glance, but as I didn't see a more suitable spot I stayed in this place, and eventually got a ride to Dresden.
We tried it at the Goldene Bremm at first but the police was patrolling there. Solid spot but we waited around 2,5h for a lift to Strasbourg.
This gas station is actually several hundred meters before (towards French border) than it's marked here!
We asked 2h hours at the Gas Station..Quite impossible to go to Metz on a Monday Afternoon. In the End  the RaststÃ¤tte "Goldene Bremm" with a Sign worked out (after 5h in total)

Directly at the gas station next to a McDonalds.
Stand here with a sign to get to the peage direction Metz
Very few cars around 19:00. Mainly trucks, but shopworker offered to take us to Roermond after her shift ended.
Rainy Sunday Afternoon - people going to Roermond (but not beyond) or staying in DE. Picked up by Dutch people driving towards Eindhoven via Venlo.
A lot of fairly local traffic. Many people going to Roermond and no one at all going to Venlo. We were asking people for ages.
Rasthof Cloerbruch Nord A52 toward Viersen and Roermond (NL), petrol station plus restaurant, average sized carpark.

150m before this one thereâ€™s a junction where two traffic lights are, and traffic comes not so fast, with good visibility of you. Although, cars donâ€™t have a dedicated spot to stop. They would need to go mount the bike lane to stop for youâ€¦ 
I assumed if someone would like to stop he would do so, and someone did took me to wetterau gas station after 20 min of standing here with sign: A5 Nord
But they would have to be determined. You may get some offensive signs lol.
Some drovers are too fast here, but it is still the best place on this street to get an autostop to the A5. Don't listen to local grandma, who would tell you to go to the Shell Station ;p
Update: it is better to hitchhike about 150 m before Lidl since the cars can better see you and also have the possibility to stop.
Good spot to hitchhike to the A5 (north). You definitely need a sign! Hitchhike just before the entrance to the Lidl.
Hotspot !! Was trying to go to CZ and I arrived there on a saturday at 17h30. Got picked up by a friendly trucker who left me on the A6
Terrible. Many delivery drivers that leave their warehouse. I was going direction reseinburg
To east, but better go to Amberg and from there to Czech Republic

We hitchhiked to Prague from this spot. It tooked a 2 and half hour to stop a car went directly to Prague. Most cars are locals (who will not take you very far) or truckers (who canÂ´t take you anyway) I think a better way to go to Prague is to hitchhike to the petrol station "OberpfÃ¤lzer Alb South" (use sign "Amberg") from here and then from the petrol station to Prague.
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught in 20 min.
We got a lift to Stuttgart after 5 minutes on a sunday afternoon.
What do you mean by Â»the cars drive just too fastÂ«? Itâ€™s an autobahn service station. :)

Not very good to hitchhikt, the cars drive just too fast.
I waited each time more then 30 minutes
It was a holiday day, so not many cars were passing. I have a sign NORD and i took me an hour to get a ride out of Munchen, direction airport. Although that I think that is quite good spot.

There are 3 gas station one after the other, and this is quite expensive, so there aren't too many people stopping. I tried also at metro gas station, lots of people but mainly local traffic. Better you try at the traffic light very close on the right

i always hitch out from there and in my opinion it is the best place in munich to go north.i prefer to ask at the station but you can try the road too.average waiting time i put 15 minutes,it took me from 1 minute to 1 hour the at least 30 times iÂ´ve been there...
More or less good for hitching. Theres a busstop and a gasstation. At least you are save from raining.

no Problem to get a ride to Munich - ask drivers at the gas station!

Harder to find a ride to get you passed Munich! But my experience shows me its better to wait the time to find a ride to pass Munich than get stuck inside Munich, with someone who only drives to there!
No problem to get a ride if you ask drivers, especially on a workday.
should be no problem to get to Munich

A lot of people here were heading off to Augsburg not to Munich or Salzburg. When I asked an old man who was alone watching a map there I found a ride to Munich - unfortunately he just drove me to Allianz-Arena, which was not the perfect place to go on hitchhiking.
I wait there on a Monday from 10:00 to 13:00 a clock. There i find no lift to the east
Still the best option eastbound I guess.

Though there is a lot of traffic, and a lot of space for cars to stop (just behind the bridge or arond the corner, whatever one prefers), people seem not to be too friendly over here to stop. Dozens of times hitched here, a lot of times waited >30 min
Lots of space along the hard shoulder to stop cars. Traffic only coming from OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck-City
Catched a ride to the tank station at the Dutch border.
most people are going to Maastricht or just across the border. better don't wait for someone going to Eindhoven or further north
The catch a car to Belgium is possible.

There is some traffic going to the Netherlands via the A4 from here. Two petrol stations, traffic lights and a bus stop for cars to pick you up. Take buses 27, 37, 47, 77 or 147 to stop "Jupp-MÃ¼ller-StraÃŸe" from Aachen Bushof (main bus station).

Police everywhere, just few cars stopping. Wanted to go to Wroclaw/Breslau but took the first car after 1 hour to get away from this place to get just some kilometers behind the border. Much better place there!!
not good, police told me to go to the truck lane. 3h for a lift to Breslau / Wroclaw
you can catch here only police, worst place to hitchhiking
German-Polish border. Excellent place in both directions.

I have a very different experience than those above. Not a very busy station, but still about 30% of traffic goes towards Poland. Waited about 30 minutes on a Monday afternoon for a ride to Frankfurt (Oder) on my own, but I got a ride together with a Polish hitchhiker I met at this station.

Do not use this place when trying to get Poland, only truck drivers (and not all) go there. It took us (2 boys) 3 hours to find 2 truckers going to Swiecko. Almost all normal cars are going to Berlin.

Once saw two guys hitching, practically dieing here after weeks of waiting: They were trying to go East - (experienced East-German hitchers, coming from Spain)
I made it to Poland with family of deaf french zionists. Not a place to go South+East!
a very good place if you want to go to berlin. a bad place if you want to go to dresden. only the truckdrivers will take you. so if its not a problem for you start here. good luck!

When I start from Mainz, I always take the train to the airport and ask people when they pay for parking. I found lifts in every direction on the A3 and A5 from here, but usually there are more people going direction KÃ¶ln or Karlsruhe.
Seems to mostly be people with full cars. I tried it for about an hour with no luck. On the upside it is warm and people are friendly. Try instead the road by the departure gates.
did that 4 times until now. it's the perfect place. it's warm, nice music and you can ask the people personally
asking for a ride on the machines to pay for the parking

On-ramp Ochtrup, B54 towards Gronau/Enschede (NL). No shoulder, but traffic isn't that fast so they can still stop. Not much traffic and people don't seem to friendly around here, so you might wait a bit longer ;)

After having been here for the 3rd time trying to get a lift to the A2 towards Magdeburg I can confirm it is much harder than going north. While lots of people would have taken me towards Hannover, Hamburg or Bremen, there were few going towards Braunschweig in the first place. 
You can accept lifts to Braunschweig or Wolfsburg, there is a gas station at the A39 with almost no traffic, but better chances to get a lift further east.
Well I have tried Hamburg and after asking 5 people I was off. No experience for Berlin.

we arrived here at night so we were hanging out for like 4 h. First tried with a "Berlin Sign" but most of the people driving to Hamburg. Then we asked like 5 people stopping for petrol and within 10 min we got a lift to Magdeburg.
Although it seems perfect for the direction north to Hamburg, it's not recommendable to get to A2 in the direction of Berlin. If you're coming from A5 rather choose A4 and A9 to get to Berlin.
To get to Schwerin on a friday noon was not bad. A  sign will increase chances.

i came from Hamburg on the way to Lenzen (Elbe) - behind Ludwigslust.
At the exit 12 is a petrol station where you can get a lift but its good if you have a sign.

actually it's not entirely impossible to get a lift to schwerin from here.. ;) either try right at the exit or walk to the petrol station 100 m down the road. i did it a few times, but i suppose being local helped a lot. :)
Do not get out here. I had to be recued by two extreamly kind local girls that brought me to the train station.
The bad point about this spot is that the most of the people on this road are heading towards HÃ¼rth or BrÃ¼hl so only a few people are going on the highway
This was so bad, because the people were to fast to stop before they get to the autobahn. And the next gas-station around the corner hat very little traffic. So i decided to take the tram to Frechen
Great to get in westward direction (Aachen). For a lift onto the A3 you have to wait a while. Make clear if you want to hitch north- or southward!
this place is awsome! there is a trafficlight directly before the motorway. and its easy to reach with line 18
arrived here on a sunday, very bad to get to koblenz. but the petrol station was open overnight, so i had a good resting place.
asdacdasccsacsascas
Me and my brother needed about an hour to get away in direction bremen. most people were going to nearby cities in the area so it's quite difficult to get a ride for long distances

needed over 1.5 hours to get a ride in direction dortmund. most people are heading direct to the north to duisburg or something. must be better weekdays but dont know. to the south or the north this is doable but it is difficult to the northeast...
well, there's some room if you walk up the ramp a few meters. just be aware of the trucks. in general, horrible on-ramp with lots of traffic but annoying construction design.
Better to go to the mcdonalds or gas station 100m to the north and ask for a ride as not much room for cars to pull over.
Not too bad, but sometimes not too easy for vehicles to stiop on the ramp.

Good spot to hitch west towards the A31 or Netherlands. Cars have enough space to stop, there's a lot of traffic. And if you want, you can push the traffic light button so cars going towards the highway HAVE TO stop :-)
This spot is ok in the direction of Hannover, but not to Hamburg.
Used to be the best spot in former times, but cars became faster, so they don't stop as easily anymore ...
OK Spot, many drivers are already too fast though

Direction: Hannover and generally central Germany. Very nice place right next to the autobahn. Just make sure you stay before the blue sign (otherwise illegal) and don't stay behind the bridge pier. It's too dangerous and drivers see you too late.
How to get there:
Take the tram line no 1 to Dietrich BonhÃƒÂ¶ffer StraÃƒÅ¸e. The station is south south west of the hitch point. Southwards trough the gardens until the next parallel street, then left to the station.
by polarfox (HC)
This was spot was ok to get a ride to the next gas station between Bremen and Oldenburg, but not sure if it's suitable for long directions.
Yes, i always have a sign!
OS sign is definitly useful!
Good traffic going right, but still most of cars goes straight, so it would be better to have a written plate with destination (i.e. OS for Osnabruke)

Direction: West. 

This gas station is mostly frequented by people coming from Salzwedel going to... Salzwedel. But there are also some going the direction of Uelzen and maybe after one hour or longer there will be somebody taking you there. 

I recommend asking people while fueling and standing next to the road the rest of the time.

Direction: East

Many cars only come for fueling to this gas station and then go back to Salzwedel. It should be easy to find somebody to bring you there but I don't know how many of them can bring you to the other side of the city to go on hitchhiking.

'autobahn rasthof borde sued' (shown on the map but not on the satellite image as it is newly built) is an average place to hitch from. when i tried to reach 'leipzig' via autobahn "A 2" as well as autobahn "A 14" i failed. instead i went to berlin to 'tank und rastanlage michendorf' on 'berliner autobahnring', changed the sides (there is a tunnel) and went from there to back to 'leipzig' on autobahn "A 8". i only want to give 'boerde sued' an average rating. also, there is not too many drivers
one wrong information: it is not autobahn "A8" but autobahn "A9" that leads from 'berlin' to 'leipzig'. 'rastanlage michendorf' is on the ring south-west of berlin.
Melle-Ost on-ramp, roundabout with sufficient space on the exit towards the highway, great for getting rides to the service station 3km ahead or further (Bad Oeynhausen). Traffic drives slow.

A guy and a girl on a Tuesday morning with an arrow sign pointing to Hamburg/Kiel and a "HH" sign. This spot is good in theory, but there was only local traffic or people that ignored us. We also tried the other side of the road, further north, but it was also bad, even though there were more cars going to Hamburg.
Opposite to a busy parking and enough time and space for cars to pull over! A lot of trafic to Kiel I guess, also enough to Hamburg.

We got there in the middle of a Monday afternoon and there was only one car on this big parking lot... Maybe it's good if you ask the truckers, but we asked our driver to get us a bit south instead, at the Scandinavian Park, even though it was not that good either...
A group of 3 got a ride almost to Redensburg here. (09.2014)

Waited here to get a ride to Hannover but didn't work. Almost everyone goes to Hamburg so we took a ride to there instead.
Would recommend not to try to Hannover from here

i was here twice at night and once it took me just thirty minutes towards Hamburg and once it took me 7 hours towards rostock... but it was on a night where berlins soccer team was playing so everyone was at home watching the game
Exit no. 30 from Berliner Ring. Didn't take long to find a ride to Hamburg. Probably a good place to ask your driver to drop you, if they're going in a different direction.
It looked to busy but I was gone in 2 minutes.
Still not that bad, there's some long distance traffic here because of the nearby Autohof.

Not much space to stop cars, no hard shoulder. Cars coming from 3 directions, so it's hard to ask. Maybe try it on the space under the bridge or at the nearby gas station. Not recommended to stand directly at the ramp.

A super shitty spot, didn't get even 1 km lift over 3 hours in the afternoon.
Finally a thing were DB is more trustworthy then an average German.
Don't go here, save your time.
They will wave you crazy
Got a ride to the next gas station. Fast pick up, but for me not a ride to the next city.
This is a restplace, an extremely good hitching spot. If someone offers you a ride to the nearest gas station, think twice, because this is almost too good a spot to lose!

Perhaps it was bad timing given we were here on Monday afternoon, but there was close to no traffic and everyone was local. After waiting for an hour, we moved more south and got better luck from there.
Probably a lucky ride but it was a good spot for us. Two males. The previous review said all there is to say.

April 2023 - Group of three. Stickers of Trampennen and Bummit hitchhiking race, so a well used spot. This spot has cars parked all down the side of the road so can make it tricky to be seen. Moving away from the services down the road a little made the difference and we got a lift in around 40 minutes. However we did struggle with the Irschenberg services where we left. Check out what others have said for it as we did not leave until the next day.

A fairly bad spot for hitch hiking, but maybe the best spot in this tangled mess of highways around DÃ¼sseldorf. 

There is no place where you can stand and catch most of the traffic from the car garages, or the people going to the car garages, or people dropping off for departures. Car traffic for arrivals, departures, taxis, and valet service are all mixed together. Exhausting, but doable. Lots of local traffic but also lots of traffic for long distances in all directions. 

Hold out for a

I used this place few times, when i went to Netherlands and i had no idea how to get there. Take s-bahn 11, take right excit, then go left, there is traffic circle, under sign "alles richtung". You can stay on the striped area before split roads (one goes to hotel) or in the lawn in the last turn from traffic circle, there is no place to stop, but cars do it, because road is wide enough. I was waiting there first time about 20 minutes, the last one something about 1 hour.
kind of tricky getting here. you need to walk for quite a while past the highway. cars are already really fast when passing.
Can confirm that many people seem alienated by hitchhikers there, still better than Goldene Bremm

After waiting 1h30 to the gas station we decided to move to that place because everybody there goes on the highway leading east. Wait on the zebras, there is also a lot of place for the cars to stop and people see you for far away
Waited a little bit less that 1h. A lots of people but not really opened to take hitchhikers, they looked astonished to see hitchhikers there.
Waited for circa 127 minutes on sunday but no one picked me up. Held a sign that said west no dice
Got a lift towards the A2 thumbing on sunday noon within 15 minutes. Recommended!

AGIP petrol station. Good for westbound traffic on the A 2.
Friendly staff, very easy to reach with the tram (station "Albert Vater Str.) and they play nice music whilst you wait here. Good for asking people as well as for pulling people out with a sign on the kerbside.
Waited less than 30 mins even after 20.30h
2023 there is construction work on street before this spot, so there is no traffic going through here at this time. Street was empty.
Good place, becaus there is a smal street, where cars can stop easily. Of course, the spot is good for going north or south.
nobody going to nÃ¼rnberg, could be good for munich

Bad spot, the highway starts directly after the traffic lights, theres no place for the cars to park. Most cars are coming from the opposite lain, you have to wait for red lights. We ended up taking blablacar to cottbus and tramped from there
I have waited there in a saturday morning around one hour. There was not so much car. After that Police came and told me I cant wait on highway. For this reason I leave the spot.
to Dresden or Frankfurt
4 hours here and still nothing. Our journey through Europe was fast and easy and on our way back to Czechia we got stuck at this stupid place.
(Friday 16:30) very busy, got a hitchike to Karlsruhe after ten minutes
Petrol station HunsrÃ¼st. Quite big, but doesn't seems to be very bussy (Tuesday evening). Direction to Mannheim and further.
Not a good spot, somebody called the police on me because they thought it was dangerous, which I guess it is.
Kinda good place, got a car in 2 minutes, but driver said that previous hitchhiker he took were waiting there for 2 hours.
The spot is not perfect to stop but there were a immediatly 2 persons that stoped and one that whent on the direction of the highway.
I did start here few times.. it was nice! just wrote "A 65*
a lot of cars going north or south, but  very rare to park. maybe better to take "Landau SÃ¼d" and stand there. There is a gas station in "WeiÃŸenburger Str." that could be a better spot.
No one is going to Prague from this gas station I tried with my friend and we waited for more than 2hours
didnt worked for us (2 guys). Asked around  on the aralstation on a rainy afternoon but only locals were stopping.

I asked around at the Aral-gas station (Took a bus from central Dresden to here, See wiki-page for Dresden).
Got a ride to central Prague after 30minutes at about 6 pm.

Not many cars, most are locals. It is possible to get to the Netherlands but I was told the on northern motorway entry it's easier since many Dutch people go there for shopping (not on Sunday though).
Long time waiting for a 10 km  ride that screwed us up, direction Netherlands

Good for hitchhiking south to the Netherlands. 
Bad for hitchhiking direction Oldenburg.
we sleeped in McDonald and got ride to Freiburg at 8 am on Sunday after 10 minutes, but I think we were lucky
got a ride to Freiburg on a saturday evening. good place quite a lot of cars

There is a gas station and a mc donalds and some other stuff in here (-> "Autohof), but when i got dropped here i waited quite long. The Gas Station at the highway a bit north is definetely a better place !
Just a little percentage of the passing cars are heading onto the highway. Directly on the on-ramp it worked a lot better!
First car stopped and took me to the border crossing with France @ Neuenburg am Rhein.
Going north to Karlsruhe: There is a bus stop where people easily can stop for you. We were waiting for some 40 minutes before someone stopped - and took all 4 of us!
quite easy to get on A1 south or North or into Dortmund. But getting on A44 towards Oberhausen/Arnhem(NL) is more tricky
waited 20 minutes for a car to muenster.
this motorway service area isnÂ´t as good as the one called "soester bÃ¶rde" i guess.

Not so a good Place...
The Cars coming very fast. 
Try it on the gas Station
Not bad place, in 40 minutes a car direct to Berlin.
It was totally dark, and 5 minutes and we have luckliy lift to Dresden, try this place:)
To my luck, saw a polish cargo car there as soon as I arrived. Waved with my "Hamburg/Denmark" cardboard and he took me to HH. There is much more local traffic usually though.

place yourself with a sign at the exit of the gasstation, so you'll process the fueled cars and the ones passing by; especially for those not in this askingtaining mood - there's enough space for the third, the waiting row

Not a good gas station to find a lift to Hamburg. Many cars staying in the city.
Try the gas stations about 1 km to the north or pose yourself next to the street directly in front of the motorway.
its actually a really bad spot because cars canÂ´t stop. try to get a ride to the next gas station on the A5
We tried to make it to Straatsburg via this spot as it looks OK on the map, but there's barely any place for cars to stop. Eventually took the train to Straatsburg.

in to the south (A5)
Good Place in front of a traffic light. The cars have to wait long enough to get in. You can stand on a peace of grass.
Holiday day, almost no cars. Although that I was picked up by a taxi driver in 5 minutes for free, who took me to the exit Nurnberg
traffic lights hithchhiking with no sign - Porsche Carrera GT directly to the airport :)
Sieg - monument, Richtung Flughafen
two guys, saturday evening (people watching football) - the second car stopped, it was going only to the next exit, but it helped nonetheless
Hard to find a car, spend maybe 1 hour and move to some kilometers to way of Prag
got a hitch after five seconds with a truck driver to praha with two guys!

Not a good place to get a ride south. Also there were construction works going on, confusing the car drivers on the road. No one stopped. Did not ak at the gas station, not a lot of people filled up their cars there. Ended up walking 300 meters towards the highway.
Just waited 5 minutes with a friend to get a lift directly to Berlin.
Gasstation (Esso) near the highway A9 (North-South).
If you go a hunder mether further and turn right, there will be the junktion to the speedway, with a green ditch and some grass so people can stop. This is a better place to hitch.
I was trying to get onto the A7 going north, waited here for 30 mins had no luck. walk east and try from the 'B199'

many people who are going to the motorway are driving by this point. you got 2 petrol station but it's better to stand at the street in front of the bridge. there's a little space at the 'moin moin' where cars can stop easily. it's not perfect, but i waited only 30 minutes.
After 5 minutes I got a lift to Zwickau.
waited for a while. around three hours. was heading to Kassel- Leipzig, but most of the cars leave autobahn after the station..

Am Haarstrang.

Good place to go east.
please dont go there
I guess its an outdated spot, i have no idea why somebody would take this road instead of just taking the A11 directly.

I hichhiked here to go to Szczecin (Stettin); quite remote place, but if you find a lift to this place it's not so bad: there is a traffic light, so cars slow down a bit more. As you see from the arrows, you catch all the cars coming from the city and from both directions of the Berliner ring.
The remoteness of the place, then, stimulates car drivers to stop, because they'll think there's something wrong if a person walks on that road.
cars cannot park easely and they go fast here. plus most of them go straight and not to Leipzig on the right: Waited 45min then chnage spot!
I hadded a bad vote, but I was wrong, it was not this place, it's the gas station close by, so don't count on my judgment. I don't know how to delete the vote
We walked drom S-bahnhof to this place. Within 2 minutes we had a ride to Magdeburg.

I waited at the crossroads and the gasstation in pouring rain, I am guessing that must've been the reason that people didn't want to take me. In good weather I imagine that this spot is pretty good for hitch hiking!
Gasstations are a good hitchhiking spot because you can ask the people directly. There are several options on the Hansastr. and the Bramscher Str.

Going North (A1). Better make a sign. 
Buses 41 and 81/82
This is a text book hitchhiking spot. It's right in front of the traffic lights and a four ways crossroad. Also there is plenty of space for rides to stop in a side-stop.
Difficult for going to NÃ¼rnberg. But I don't know another spot...
waited for more than anhour, nobody going towards nÃ¼rnberg (A3)
Most cars go to Cologne directly. I needed 1 1/2 hours for a lift onto A1 direction north.
I found a lift to Raststaette Lichtendorf on the A1 (next to Dortmund) immediately.
It's a gas station with quite a bit of traffic. Reach it with bus 152, stop "Eil Heumarer" from Steinstr. S-Bahn
I got immediate ride to the parking spot on A4 in direction of Dresden.
This Time I was really lucky and could go of in just 15 minutes
Super Spot um auf die A4 zu kommen. Auf beiden Seiten sind hier Ampeln und direkt auf der rechten Seite ist eine kleine Einbuchtung, also auch ideal zum schnellen Einsteigen.

Many locals, but also some cars going to osnabrÃ¼ck and also direction netherlands. The spot near the traffic lights worked good for me. I was very lucky, got a lift direct to the border germany/netherland (A33-A30).
shit ramp, pull-over space between ramp and traffic light. gas station should work for both directions, very busy.

Here you find a gas station and traffic lights. Just before the lights is some space to stand on and stopping cars. Another option is to ask people at the pump.Might be easy to get rides towards Bielefeld and Versmold, but difficult to get rides toward the highway, very small ramp, fast traffic, much trucks.

Thought it would be easy but still I had to wait quite a long time just to get to Dresden (Prague was the original idea). There was virtually nobody to ask, not even truck drivers and the fuel station was empty as hell...So I was glad to catch a ride to Dresden after 30min
its dont seems that bad that spot, but i waited on a saturday more then 3 hours for a lift behind dresden....
It's perfect spot to go to Dresden. Easy. If you want to go to Prague, it's also possible.
Didn't get a ride for an hour, went to the traffic light close to the trainstation and got a ride after 5 mins!
waited 30 minutes, so its an upper average

Either stay here where people turn right from the EschholzstraÃƒÅ¸e, or you go to the middle of the bridge, there is a traffic light to turn left.
Possibilities to come to highway A5 in direction north and south
Waited for 1:30, then chose a different spot. There are much better spots in Bremen for any other direction.
We waited more than 2 hours with sign "Hamburg". Nobody stoped.
we waited 90min for Hambourg
There are two options for asking: Petrol station or MC Donalds. I got a lift after 10 minutes direction Berlin.
Low traffic. With luck you can get on highway in an hour or two.

Direction: Berlin
Not a very good place, not many cars going to Berlin - for best effects stand just by the lane, lots of cars move just through B98
I waited 55 min for a lift onto the A48 direction to Trier.

Got just before dusk. Was very very hard to get a ride. Had to wait 2 hours to get a truck driver take me to Koblenz Hbf. The store with restrooms and a BurgerKing is opened 24/7 so waiting wasnt that much of a problem.

Much traffic to south.
Don't use this place when heading to Trier (A48).
Tried it again and within 15min I was gone (single traveller)
I guess I just had a lucky day with less than 5 min right on the way to the highway.

No space to pull over. There is a traffic light so it is still worth a go. About 3km back towards Leinefelde right in front of the supermarket is a traffic light, too. Plenty of space to pull over there.
Mixed opinions I guess, but we also had a horrible experience here, waiting 3 hours for a lift towards Munich.

at least it seems like a great spot but I was waiting for a horrible 3 hours to get to Munich, another hitchhiker wanted to get to NÃ¼rnberg after 3 hours as well he was taken just a few kilometres away. It was August and nearby any car was completely full (holidays)
about one and a half hour for a girl/guy at night
Indeed, this place looks perfect but a big deal of cars stay in the city. Just walk a few hundred meters along the Hansastrasse and wait near the McDonalds store.
waited here for about 40 mins and gave up, the bus stop is not regularly used by local transport, so the location is perfect, but cars just didn't stop
bus stop behind bahnhof neustadt, direction moritzburg, berlin, but you are seen late

Because of no cars got very fast a car to the first next tankstation from locals. I stood just after the traffic lights in the grass. Its a funny place where are bikers and old people in handicapped-cars on the middle of the road, and the owners of the cafe are dutch.
and no shade
only 6 cars in half an hour using this entrance going south, most going directly to Aachen, so its difficult to get to the next petrolstation on the A61
