Wanted to go on A61 direction Koblenz on a saturday in May. Good place for cars to stop but they didn't stop. In the end people who walked in the nature park and parked over there took me away a little bit further on the A61.
just possible to go south...for going north no possibility to stop safely...

Best place in town for hitching to north or south on the A61.
You can take the bus no. 013 or 023 to \"Vorster Stra
got spot to get north up into the ruhrgebiet, doing some hops and bounces on rest areas in between.

Going to the south (A3) you should ask the driver to take you to the service area "Siegburg" - It is about 20min. Around 14pm I usually waited 5-15min. Once I tried to start at 8am and waited 2 plenty hours.

Good to go north from KÃƒÂ¶ln. You just have to calculate your rides so you don't go off on MÃƒÂ¼lheim or Dusseldorf, for example. You can take little rides between rest areas along Highway 3 so you can get out the "An der Ruhr" area!
plenty of traffic on a sunday night. got a lift to cologne within 20 minutes but the station is a bit hidden behind a wide turn so maybe not as much traffic as on nearby petrol stations...
I came here from NÃ¼rnberg and by asking people at the gas station and the parking spaces, it took me 45 minutes to get a lift to KÃ¶ln. In my opinion not the best spot, maybe try Weisheim!
Wir warteten etwa 20 min an der Esso-Tankstelle bis uns der hierzu gehÃ¶rende Abschleppdienst mit zur RaststÃ¤tte bei der Autobahnauffahrt gebracht hat.
Same here, 5min maximum on a Saturday afternoon. Driver told me that from Ochtrup, people going east most likely use this on-ramp, not the one before (westwards)
Took me only 4min to get away.
To MÃƒÂ¼nster (Rheine). B54 Access lane/K73. Very little traffic. Stood here for 1h before walking to a nearby train station.
after 1,5 hour 1 guy finally pulled over and got us to Bremeh,
We couldn't get a ride here for Leer after waiting 30 mins.
Couldn't get a ride towards Berlin after 90 minutes of waiting.
mainly local cars!
yep 3h for south
good for direction Berlin, bad for the highway dir. south!

A guy and a girl on a Monday afternoon without a sign. There weren't many people at the gas station, so we hitchhiked at the intersection instead. Wasn't good : only one car stopped on an hour and it was local traffic, as were a lot of other cars passing by. We gave up and went a bit before the bus stop west of here; it was muche better there!
I got a sense that it wasn't the best spot, but I was extremely lucky to be picked up by a nice Spanish guy going to Hamburg Airport. For me, this spot worked better than the nearby Burger King.
Lot's of truck so maby better for single person but not for 2 people. After almost 3h We get lift to better spot behind Erfut. People didn't want take us even to Erfurt
Got a ride even at 10pm.
Got a ride to Stillhorn really quick after having a long distance ride from Trento with my new danish friends. Its good for going northwards on the A1/A7.

Avoid this rest area, talked with people, at some point also hitched but in 4 hours I managed to get noone, and it's not like there wasnt any cars, lots of danes here, but noone gave me a lift even to Hamburg, just try rest areas more south , didnt work out for me
I think i was crazy lucky i was with a friend and we didn't even have sign got a ride with a very german guy who couldnt speak english still nice!!!!
Most cars arent going south and small amount of space to stop. We were 2 people.
direct to dresden abort78

bad spot, cars there are going in multiple directions (A5-> Frankfurt, A7 north and south and A4 east), so its less propable to find someone driving in the right direction, especially if you're coming from Frankfurt.

I've been stuck in Frankfurt and after trying different hitchhiking spot in the city I would say it's the best one. I stand at the traffic light with a cardboard "A5 Kassel". There is also a gravel space after the traffic lights were you can go and people can see you. If you want to go North, you're best chance is to be drop at Getterau gas station.
I agree with another comment, doesn't feel like an ideal place to wait - not to much space for cars to pull over
Not an ideal spot, there's not much space for cars to stop and your in a turn. I think we got lucky to wait only 20 min
Mid afternoon. Waited for 2 hours beside road. Petrol station was too quiet to bother talking to people. Ended up getting bus elsewhere.
To GÃ¼tersloh

Probably a good spot if you stick with one plan. I constantly switched between asking cars that tanked and standing at the traffic light hoping someone would pick me up. We were trying to join the highway to go to Hamburg 
You can ask people to drive you to the next gas station and hitchike at the entrance of the highway
Leave the cars enough space to stop for you and it is a great place to put your thumb out.
I was there in August on a Saturday evening. Astonishingly difficult to catch a ride to berlin in my experience. I felt a weird vibe and the people werent that friedlyâ€¦

Great. Not many cars but everyone was friendly and open to talk. Got a lift to the frontier with cz in 5 min :)

Getting here from the ferry is a hassle. Most people are local or driving north, I got a ride to Rostock central after half an hour by asking people at the gas station. If you want to hitchhike by sign/thumb its also possible, but you're probably better off just asking here, as there isn't that much traffic, and pulling over can be stressful here imo.

That's no good spot to catch cars to Munich. You'd better look for a car heading to Memmingen Ost. And even it is not that easy. From Memmingen Ost, where I stood before the on-ramp to Munic, I caught a lift in less than 15 minutes.
Bad for going south east
Good in direktion to Rostock or Hamburg
Did not found any ride going north
found a ride to kassel after 20 min  late in the evening
Not much traffic, but still enough to hop to another station since everyone goes south from here.
don't end up here. my truck driver needed a break and dropped me of there. If u end up here, ask everybody if they can take you towards Bruchsal, the next gas-station. Not much traffic
got a lift to Memmingen after 10 min

For direction Friedrichshafen you can either try right after roundabout or walk a bit further to the straight road before it meets the highway. Was there on two occasions and both spots were successful after about 30 minutes. I'm thinking it's the best road spot to leave Meersburg. Maybe hitching right off the ferry could work too...
Im living in Mannheim and was hitchhiking to a friend living in Bayreuth. Since thereÂ´s no good spot close to the city centre I had to wait for almost 4h.
We got here on a monday afternoon, 2 hit chers of diffÃ©rent genders, noone stopped And waited un t'il it was dark out

Not so much space for cars to pull over in direction of Ulm. In direction north you probably have to stand at the traffic light, which is not such a good spot but many cars and trucks going there in the morning
lot of cars, mostly direction Ulm, in direction north i waited almost 1 hour.

We both waited for an hour and every ten minutes did stop someone,  but they all wanted to drive to Stuttgart Mitte or TÃ¼bingen. Apparently not a good spot if you want to go to the direction of Ulm/Munich.  We changed the spot to Stuttgart Airport with the local trains.

I (female) was standing there for two hours in a cold snowy winterafternoon and gave up, after my feet got nearly frozen. a really bad place if you wanna got onto A8. wihtin two hours only one guy wanted to pick me up, but unfortunately he was getting in the city, he also told me, that the A8 isnt used much on this entrance.
Waited for about an hour or so in the early morning to catch a ride directly to Frankfurt. Lots of local traffic tho...

The other place mentioned (300m NE) is useless, roads were heavily changed. Try it here at the Shell gas station to get a hitch to the A5. If people go north and you want to go south, nevertheless grap the ride and get out at the next gas station on the autobahn (Renchtal). There you can go over a bridge to the opposite station and get a ride there. at least thats what we did.
the only place to hitchhike in here seems to be the petrol station, as the other spots look quite dangerous
A rather big petrol station. Some cars are going to Aachen or anywhere else. Just read the license plates and ask drivers heading to your direction.
Depending on the time of the day, you might find lots or few going in your direction. Weekday early afternoon seems to be a bad day for going to Berlin. Rather try from Greifswald.

This sercice area "Demminer Land" opend in July 2016 and is the only gas station at the A20 between Rostock an Prenzlau. It is only located at the western lane but traffic going north can excess it via a bridge. There are not many reasons why you should end up here but if you do, you can choose between going to Berlin or Rostock.
For going to Greifswald find soneone going directly there or let them drop you either at exit 27 (GÃ¼tzkow) or exit 25 (Greifswald).
We were politely kicked out of the gas station after a while
Can ask for a lift to the center of Koln.
I would never stop here on purpose. Minimal traffic and none to Netherland. If you are stuck here, I would rather try to reach the Port of Groningen gas station 5 km away passing through Bunde town
Traffic isle, good spot for NL/Groningen (and probably Germany, opposite ramp). Not a lot of traffic, but people see you from far and have to slow down to make the turn.
There is a small spot to pull over just after the Autobahn sign. So technically you can stand here legally (before the Autobahn sign). Advantage: Only cars going north on the A96 pass by :)
No space to pull over so cars have to stop on the hard shoulder. But you are easily visible.

Stood here with a sign "Hamburg".
Some traffic enter the Autobahn heading north on the A7. But bad spot for cars to stop.
Still got a lucky lift after 20 min, that brought us (2 ppl) to the service area Allertal (30 km).

Got off the Autobahn here after coming from Hamburg.
I asked people that came from IKEA if they head to the city centre of Hannover. But most IKEA visitors are from around the area (e.g. Celle) and not directly from Hannover. (There is another bigger and more modern IKEA at Hannover-Messe where Hannover people would rather go to.)
After 30 min I found a lift to Langenhagen (north of Hannover) where the tram (line 1) got me to the city centre.

I stood here in the afternoon with a sign Frankfurt. After 45 minutes, some people picked me up.
This place is near to the fair (Messe Gruga).
A52 direction Dusseldorf and feeder for the A3 towards Frankfurt / Main. Driveway with second lane, so that cars can stop briefly to pick you up.

Not much traffic here but we waited only about 25 minutes for a ride to Konstanz.
You can stand directly besides the ramp.

Not much traffic here but we waited only about 25 minutes for a ride to Konstanz.
You can stand directly on besides the ramp.
Direction Kempenich / Mayen. Very visible spot but cars going often quite fast. Mostly local traffic but enough to get a lift closer to the motorway.
Direction NÃ¼rburg. Pros: very visible spot, enough place to stop. Cons: most cars going quite fast.
A small parking spot. Direction north-west. Mostly trucks stopping here, very few cars.
After the bridge there is a small stopping bay. Cars are rather fast, but it is all right.
There is a small parking, but the cars are relatively fast and coming off a curve. Better chances with the people from the parking.

Might be a decent starting point to get on the A7. This spot is close to the terminal stop "Anderten" of tram #5. To get to the southern gas station follow the narrow path coming from the bridge across the Mittelland Canal.
Not much traffic though. If it takes to long you can still walk to the WÃ¼lferode Service Area (A7) in the south, which might take another half an hour.
I got a lucky ride to Berlin (via A2) after waiting there 30 min.
Small amount of traffic.
Rather little traffic to Welver, okay to Hilbeck.
Good place, low speed, but we try stop a car 1 hour no one stopped :(
I wait single male and 20 ming I get ride

Not the best spot for cars to stop but in the morning it wasn't very busy so a car was able to stop on the ramp for me to jump in without disrupting the traffic. It took me about 20 minutes to get a lift eastwards to Magdeburg and Berlin.

The cars are passing by very fast on the street and it's curved, so no chance to get a lift from driving cars. But you can talk to the drivers who stop there or stand at the end of the parking place to catch them after parking. Still took me 45 minutes to get a lift to Bebra.
Not too much space for pulling over, but it is fine. Works best if there is not too much traffic.
Not a good spot to get to Trier or further. Easy to get on the A8 in both directions.
Nice-sized on-ramp. People can stopp. Problem is rather that there is a lot of local traffic.
Many cars, most of them slow
Good place to get to direction Aschaffenburg, just at the pedestrian traffic lights.
Not a great amount of traffic, but still okay to get away.
People can stop, but they are quite fast.
You might be lucky to find someone heading towards Stuttgart (North) or towards Freiburg (South). I talked directly to a driver who was fueling his car and was heading towards Stuttgart.
We were two girls on a Sunday around 3pm heading to Darmstadt. We got a ride very fast to Dreieich where we could continue easily
bus station, cars passed by in direction of Langen
A good spot to get to Trier, but a bad one to get on the motorway and further.
I was going to Kiel on a sunday afternoon and I waited about 20-30 minutes.

Direction Hamburg OR Kiel/Flensburg:
It is definitely not the best spot, because the cars are going quite fast but there is a lay-by where cars can stop easyly if they want to.
I think it is a quite good spot because there is a bus stop which gives the cars the possibility to stop.
Good spot in the direction of Hamburg. Most cars go to LÃ¼neburg, but some change here to the B4. Only 10 minutes of waiting next to the bus stop.
A lot of space to pull over, most cars are rather fast. People seem not to feel very secure pulling over.
Big on-ramp. Not a lot of traffic to Kassel though. Better spot would be further east.
A lot of space to pull over. A lot of traffic, mostly local though. Good way to get to Werl.
Hard place to pull over, and the local people aren't that bent on giving rides. Still by far not impossible.
Not a lot of stopping space and low traffic. People are friendly, though.
Not a lot of traffic. Space is all right, but far away from perfect.Better do not get off here.
Space is all right, but mostly local traffic.
Enough space for cars to pull over. Might be less easy when it is busy. We tried it on  a Sunday morning and it worked sufficiently.

On-ramp for the highway 33 in direction Paderborn, Kassel. It was very unbusy when we tried it on a thursday evening. but that made it possible for the cars to stop on the on-ramp. It is rather spacious, but I do not think that it will work in the morning, when a lot of people use it to get to work.
Mostly local traffic, if possible you should rather get out at a gas station directly on the highway
Autohof Koblenz
Not the best place for cars to stop but, well, why not?

A very simpathic woman took me to Ãœberlingen (Bondensee). She said that her daughter does hitchhiking in South America and she thought that she should help me =D
I was alone on a friday at 14:00, trying to go to Lindau

there is a place for cars to park under the bridge, not really the best place but it worked for me. Not so many cars, not so many friendly faces, cars are a bit too fast but they see you from a big distance. I was left here by another car.

Well i choose this new spot as i already went to the parking of mac donald and speak to everyone with no luck , so basicky anyone who is going to the petrol station or mac donald can see me , just buy the grass standing with a sign , 1h30 min of wait to go to poznan , so i guess not bad !
Theoretically enough space to pull over, but it seems that car driver do not realize that. traffic amount and pace are probably too high
Fairly good amount of traffic, enough space to pull over. Most people will not go far.
A lot of traffic, not too much space to pull over. People are not used to hitchhikers here.
Basically a great spot. A lot of space, a good amount of traffic ... but the cars do not seem to realize how to pull over there.
Directly in front of a bus stop. A lot of traffic, very busy. Maybe too busy.

well I think I were lucky, i got a lift in 5 min southwards!

this spot isn't so easy to reach as well. This parking place has no toilet. People won't stop there if it is urgent ;-)
its hard to go from here..
hard to park for cars, but a lot of them going north and south from here.
Bus stop ca. 50 meters before the official hitchhiking spot. A lot of people do not go to Hamburg I guess. Good spot though.

It's not very busy and sometimes cars park in a way on the sidewalk that drivers can't stop easily. That's why I decided after a short time to walk to the next spot (around two corners northwest), which I can recommend.
Good Spot to go to the North. There are many cars going to the Motorway and they are slow.
Big sign or thumb. Small signs lead to irritation, because deivers do not have much time to read.
Not too much space to pull over. Good amount of trafic.

Not legal. Police stopped me. Did not have too pay luckily. 
Enough space to pull over. People looked at me very confused. Should work out if Police does not interfere.

Don't expect to be able to get a ride easily from here. Although there's a traffic light where cars coming from Wittenberg are actually able to reduce their speed, there's no space for them to stop and pick you up.
Most of the cars are locals and won't bring you to the highway

Heading towards The Netherlands early August, Just stood with my Shield at the traffic lights, Then if i noticed an NL plate going for gas i approached him to talk. Got a ride all the way to NL fairly quick!
Base to go througth the north or the south to regensburg. There is a McDonalds Restaurant and a Gas station and you could talk to many drivers.

Somewhat nice but kinda dangerous stop that will get you from highway 7 to 6. I meant to go east, but 90% of cars actually go west. Cars are really fast here, and pretty much everyone totally ignored me, so I ended up standing with a HELP sign, that worked after 40 mins. I got a direct ride to Munich

There is lot of cars on this road.
But becarfull, in the evening, no cars will stop. We have to spend the night in the park on the other side.
But there is lot of space for the car to stop. And the next morning we found someone very quickly !

Morning : Very good
Evening : Bad
Lots of space for the cars to stop. Not a good solution though if you want to head to NL from here.
Bus stop at the B95. Pretty good towards Chemnitz. Takes a while still, but that's because it's Erzgebirge. People around here are quite... isolated :D
stand at the traffic light with a sign Citycenter ("Stadtmitte"or "Zentrum") Walk up to the cars while they wait.. Worked for me :) I'm lazy. You could just walk :D
Not so good for hitchhiking because of no place to stop the car. Risky.
Bus Stop direct after an intersection, average but probably the best option for getting out of Sonthofen.
try to stay at the Autobahn, it is was more quiet in this Autohof since people are resting here
Aral gas station/Autohof. More cars towards Hannover?!

Direction Kempenich.

Very few cars but a clear, visible spot. Locals are very helpful.

Direction Ramersbach/Kempenich.

Very few cars passing but it's the most visible spot with slow traffic.
Truck Stop, so maybe not the best on sunday.
True, almost no space. But the frequency of traffic was ok, after 5 minutes I got a lift to Krefeld.
Traffic too local, and not "that" much space to stop. Oh well.
GrÃ¼nstreifen ganz ok aber sehr Zeiten abhÃ¤nig die ganze Gegend

Bus stop in front of round-about. OK for getting on the A4 highway or into Zwickau if you've been dropped off at the highway exit. Having a sign with A4 and DD (east), EF (west), or Z (Zwickau) helps.
Room to stop because of the parking lot.

If you're heading towards Salzburg this spot is better than the petrol station because many locals use it. There isn't much room for cars to pull over but in the space of one hour two cars stopped and offered us a lift. (The second of which we took)

we found a car for 30 km to Netherlands.
there is a small place but cars see you from far away and have some place to stop.
A good spot for finding somebody going past the gas station Dammer Berge West. Cars have enough space to stop on the right side before entering the highway ramp.
God stuck in this place for 2h, to much local traffic.
While wandereing arround looking for non local number plates a guy just asked me from behind where I wanted to go. Well he took me all the way to Lindau.

I wanted to go to the autobahn direction Geisingen, but I gave up because there is no place for cars to stop and the traffic light is almost never red. I took a train to geisingen and got a ride from there
If you want to get East (B311) you need to wait at the traffic-lights. Most will just go into the city-centre of Tuttlingen but there are still cars going East.
Of course not the best place (drivers come through that curve, so they see you late...many go to Ingolstadt) - try to take the first one who brings you to a service area.
Not the best place direction North.
Nice and comfortable spot, but few people stop. Still the best spot I tried at HansastraÃŸe. I will try others, though.
Bus stop just behind a traffic light. 2 lanes, cars are going fast.

2 guys, Saturday at 20 o'clock, to Dresden

we tried it from different side of the bridge in front of Aldi supermarket, hitchhiked for 2 hours and didn't catch a ride, we had to sleep in place nearby in tent, we continued here in Sunday morning at 8 o'clock, after hour and half we moved to advised side of bridge and waited on traffic lights, there were less cars and we managed to catch a ride in 30 minutes directly to Prague (we had Dresden A13 sign), but I thing it was luck and we would wait th

In the wiki Grenzallee is mentioned but it seems really hard for the car to slow down and see you, so by walking through the highway (some part are kinda tricky) it's possible to reach this place. (if there are any other ways please add it). there is a red light on the bridge which is perfect place to hitch a ride!!
Cars drive too fast (90 km/h) to pullover. Lots of people are from DÃ¼sseldorf or Neuss. Very few cars from Belgium or the Netherlands

Bus stop on RheinkniebrÃ¼cke toward Viersen and Roermond/Venlo (NL) and A52 highway.

Lots of place to stop, didn't see any buses while we were waiting for a ride. Drivers can see you quite well.

We ended up in Roermond on a spot where we couldn't get a ride. Therefore, going north toward Arnhem might be a better bet.
You got to be very lucky to catch here, but sometimes it works!

there is a peterol station where i find someone to hitch directly in the direction to anklam but the position form the station looks more easy in the direction southside. 

p.s. the countryside is very nice to be with a longboard ;)
This spot is good to get a ride to the A4 and A14
I was here by a mistake from the guy who gave me a lift. But it just took about 30 minutes to find a new lift in the direction of Leipzig.

Trying to go to Poznan from Berlin, I was dropped there by a well-intentioned guy who was going north after.

Not a good spot, maybe one car every 5-10 min.

I was asking people, mostly showing my sign saying Frankfurt - Poznan, after 1 h 30 i found somebody that dropped me at a highway exit further.

Parking space with a toilet. If you are coming from Frankfurt (Oder) or Poland and want to go West, but your driver goes to Berlin via the SchÃ¶nefelderkreuz you should get off here. It is not so busy but sooner or later you will find somebody going further West.

After the roundabout exit towards Weyarn is  a gravelroad that allows cars to pull over. Not perfect, but works. If you're trying to get to the A8 it might be better to find a spot before the roundabout as it is hard to stop after.

Ok to get to the A8 at Irschenberg, or to Miesbach. 
There is a lane for cars turning right that allows pulling over, and drivers waiting at the light some way back can already see you.
Place is a bit tricky, cars have to stop where they're not allowed to. We still managed to catch a quick ride though, but more luck than skills ;)
To Szczecin / do szczecina.
On-ramp at Tegel airport. Not a good spot, but high up on the on-ramp is a hard shoulder and with all the traffic passing there must be someone stopping.
Slow cars after roundabout. good for Eschwege, Treffurt, Kassel, Goettingen
Bus Stop. Spot to go to the citycenter
For A3 direction WÃ¼rzburg/Frankurt. A little place to stop. A lot of people go on the A3. But few stop. Ask direct the driver who are waiting at the light.
A lot of local cars. Hard to know wich one take the A9 or not. Most of the people don't drive far, so don't use a sign.
Quite good spot to go in Direction of Uelzen, but we poorly failed in direction Soltau (Motorway). After 1h we took a lift to Uelzen.
petrol station ESSO. Lot of locals but still some people going to hamburg. I got away after 20 minutes.
B6 on-ramp Stapelburg, direction Goslar/Braunschweig. Not so much traffic at this on-ramp.
Found someone to take us to the netherlands in a reasonable time. Traffic was low on a wednesday morning. Close case whether average or good.

Cars coming down the B482 could stop here at the intersection to pick you up. The cars are driving quite fast (50 - 70 km/h). Cars can see you very early. I don't have any experience with this place myself, a guy who was going to the train station saw us, and then decided to go by car rather than train, to help us

Not too much traffic so people have time to stop. If the drivers know what they are doing it should not be a big problem to stop. 
Mostly local traffic.
Lot of cars passing here. Found one in 10 minutes who brought me via the national roads in Jena.
You have to walk quite a while to get here, but the cars have the option to stop and all the traffic to the north goes by
Turn-off lane seems to be the only place in Villingen, where cars on the B33 have the option of stopping. Not perfect, traffic is very fast, but at least cars can exit to pick you up.
after 45 min approx a guy stopped : he was going to Potsdam and drop us on gasstation for Leipzig.

at the red light: To go to Potsdam, Leipzig( A115) or A100 for exemple. 
you have to a bit quick because the light is not very long but , there is a lot of cars:
There aren't many cars stopping on the parking and I waited for almost two hours. When holding a shield 100m before the parking I got picked up within 10 min.
well, it worked. eventually.

This spot is very difficult to reach (we were dropped off here from the airport), it's quite loud because it's next to the highway and it might not be ideal for drivers to make a stop. There is not a lot of cars coming from NÃ¼rtingen, but a lot of them coming from the other lane. It's possible for drivers to stop because the place you will be standing on is a reserved area for cars to pull over marked with white paint, but the problem is that the busy lane will have a lot of cars driving quite f

Here's a good spot to talk to people to get out of the city, just ask people at the petrol station, most of them are going on the highway in any direction. If you're not succesful, just go a few meters west to one of the next spots.

Here's a petrol station near the road. Not many cars, so talk to any people you see, especially if you want to go east. Because of the speed limit of 70 here, it's also a good option to stand next to the road, but only if you want to go west.

I started here in the beginning of December around 7pm - so it was already dark. One guy stopped after 20 min but he went just to the next village. A woman stopped after one hour and took me to the "Rasthof" Porta Westfalica.

It felt like the best spot in the direction of Berlin.
The roundabout has quite some light, so hitching from here works even when it's already dark.
45 min, but it was dark already.

Okay if you want to go east along the lake (Ãœberlingen, Highway to Stuttgart etc.). 
Most people are locals, so having a sign and standing at the entrance to the station can help to get the attention of people going further.

OK for Radolfzell, if you need FN, Lindau, Munich it's not so good. Don't get stuck there at night/sunday morning, no cars! Seems like a very new rest stop with only a gas station (Tamoil? Never seen that one before).

gas station at A 81.
good to south: Swizerland or Itally.
not so good to east: Lake of Konstanz, Lindau, Munik, Austria
You have to go with thumb. Traffic is average. This place is a good option to get on the highway but not for getting a long distance ride.

going to the north/west was very easy from the side where the cars have to turn left. You can talk to the driver for a few secs and then have to get in fast as the traffic lights will be red just for about 60 seconds

Going in the south west direction (with the A1) I waited a couple of hours here... People can see you thanks to the stop light, but if you get a lift, you have to get inside the car really fast, so not easy to check how is the guy driving...
B4 towards Braunschweig/Goslar. No hard shoulder, but people will stop. Sign might be useful. Lots of local traffic to Goslar.
Towards Torfhaus/Braunlage. Hard shoulder.
Bus stop on B6. Seems like a decent spot in direction east (Bad Harzburg, Vienenburg, Wernigerode). Most traffic only goes to Goslar though.
we waited for about 3h, asked around the gasstation and had a sign saying prague but we couldnt get a ride. At least a woman took us back to dresden and we tried our luck a second time.
Good spot if you want to go to the north (e.g.Berlin). Wait in front of the gas station and stop people taking the B172 to Dresden. Entering the highway is difficult as there is no space to park.
Lot's of local traffic here as this gas station is not exactly on the highway. Still, found a ride to Lindau within 20 minutes.
Gas station and a Burger King. Spot for both directions - towards Munich and Lindau.

Many different options to try here, but not very quick (direction MÃ¼nster). You can try talking to people at the Aral service station, but many of them will be local traffic. Also, the Dutch cars all seemed pretty senseless, as the only reason for them to go there was for cheap gas, after which they would drive back to The Netherlands.

I eventually got a ride to MÃ¼nster after about 1,5 hours standing next to the B67 close to the traffic lights (not at the exit/onramp, but the crossing of Bochol

i would wait in front of the toilet cabin as everyone passes buy and germans sometimes need a second thought to take you with them, definately carry a sign, so you get there attention, but don't be invasive ;)

there are not as many parking lots at the A38. I waited about an hour, but then I got a right directly to Leipzig, and there are trucks pulling over, too. So if you go around and ask, I think it is definetly possible to get away.
Small gas station in eastern/outward direction (to Meersburg, Ãœberlingen etc.). Experienced waiting time to Freiburg: 10 min.

haven't seen or even searched for the place mentioned above. 
this place here really is not a good choice: cars can hardly stop or speeding up. wanted to go up north to hamburg, decliend to lifts to bochum and got lucky with the 3rd car that stopped. try to get on the A1 somehow, if you wanna go really north. cologne, i guess, is easy also from this spot.
Very good spot to hitchhike to Kranenburg or even further to Nijmegen (NL). Stand in the bus stop so people can pull over.
With a good visable sign I had no troubles getting away from there. Moreover, there is a gas-station about 50m south of this spot where you might ask people directly.
There is a nice Busstop right after a trafficlight.

As in description, a lot of people there for fuel or for the cigarettes and alcohol from the duty free shop going back to germany. was lucky and got a ride to prague though, since the highway was closed
Gas station next to the border. Many people fueling here and going back to Germoney.

If you ever get stucked in Mellendorf and you want to go west you better wait at this very spot and not at the nearby gas station. At the gas station there are mostly locals who commute between the city and their homes, at the given spot there are soldiers passing from the close military bases and some of them go with their private cars onto the a2

I hitchhiked to Brusendorf because the bus to Brusendorf is not working on the weekends. A very nice guy took me in about 5 minutes, even though it was not on his way, and actually took me very close to the gas station where I hitchhiked to Poland.
Possible spot for hitching towards Berchtesgaden. Cars have space to stop, but they come a bit fast and you'll miss cars coming from the other direction.

StaÅ‚am tam w piÄ…tek o godzinie 10-11. JechaÅ‚am do Åodzi. Po 10 minutach zatrzymaÅ‚ siÄ™ kierowca TIRa, ktÃ³ry jechaÅ‚ do domu osobÃ³wkÄ…. Da siÄ™ zÅ‚apaÄ‡ stopa. Jest miejsce na postÃ³j samochodu, jednak maÅ‚o samochodÃ³w tam przejeÅ¼dÅ¼a.
Was standing there for 45 mintutes, and after that got a direct lift to the Frankfurt on 260 km/h ;-)

iÂ´ve been waiting here for more than a half hour to get a lift to the highway but i couldnÂ´t find anybody. after a while a guy from the gas station came over and asked me to leave:/ i think the distance to the highway (7km) makes it difficult to get a ride there. but maybe i was just unlucky
Last shell gas station before you go to the autobahn. the nice guy that drove me to this spot said it was a very good place for hitch-hiking. But there were mostly people from nbg.

Speed limit of 50 here, but no one cares and only a small bay for cars to stop. But probably one of the best spots nearby, because before and after this spot cars are very fast and nearly no place to stop.

The place itself is perfect - there's more than enough space for pulling over, and as it's the exit of one of the parking lots the cars aren't going fast. In addition, there's a traffic light!
If only the airport-people were interested in picking up hitchhikers...
better have a sign...
Really good spot for heading southwards towards Frankfurt and Mannheim. A lot of students in cars pass by during daytime. Waiting time: 5-? min.
Never again on a motorway junction
Very close place to stand

3 lane street and only place to stop was a bus lane. Nevertheless, a lots of cars with PL, UK, NL, all-german plates. 
Got direct hitch to Drezden after 15min.
I choose this spot to get out of the city, direction of Basel. After 30 min I got a lift to the parking place near A5 FR/Sued an early saturday morning.

Bus stop right after the big intersection. I was hitchhiking several times from here just to the next village Schallstadt which is maybe 7 kilometres to go. Never waited any longer than 15 minutes so definitely faster than going to the central station waiting for the next train.
Not such a great spot direction Forchheim or Hochstadt. Better try and stay in the villages where traffic is slower.
Better to walk a bit more towards Munster/stay in the city if you want to hitch out. Cars can't stop here.
On-ramp at Burgsteinfurt, B54 towards Enschede. Very little traffic here...

Intersection before the B76 hitching in the direction of Flensburg. Pretty bad spot with no legal place to pull over, but very few options in the general area. Stood at the intersection with a sign. Someone pulled over illegally in the less used northern road in 20 mins. Just goes to prove, if someone wants to pick you up, they will make it happen!
Easy to get here but not so much traffic.
Quickly got a ride, 'cause a lot of the people turning left are driving on the A115!
You can ask the people turing left if they can give you a ride to the next gas station.

Right in front of the yellow city sign of "Himmelkron".
Cars go south and north on the A9.

(You can also ask people at the parking lots of the supermarkets but I made the experience that most of the people are locals and wonÂ´t use the highway.)
It was difficult to get southern on the A7 from here...
Seems the most logical option for direction east out of Porta Westfalica, but there's very very little traffic (5 cars in 20min for us, luckily the 5th one stopped).
I waited at the traffic light to get a ride to the next petrol station on the Autobahn direction south

eine groÃŸe Shell Tankstelle, an der paar Leute tanken , die von der Autobahn kurz abfahren. Problem ist nur, dass es in beide Richtungen erstmal keine RaststÃ¤tten gibt und man entweder einen weiten Lift bekommen muss oder sich nur bis zu einem Prakplatz bringen lÃ¤sst, was ich gemacht habe und was super funktioniert hat.
A good place to get into conversation with Polish drivers who will take you west

Was accidentally droppen off here instead of Auental Nord (my mistake), but still managed to get a ride here within 30 minutes to Hamm. It's just a smaller parking place, but enough traffic going by to get a ride further down the A2.

But if you can, go to Auental Nord, way more traffic over there.
Raststatte Ems-Vechte Ost, A31 towards Emden. Not so crowded as other ones on busier highways, but still fine for getting rides north or into NL.
only one guy stopped for me and he took me to innsbruck after 20 min on a summer sunny day
just a parking place with nothing else.

just before the roundabout, close to the Agip gas station, you can see a place for cars to stop direction B31 (munich, garmisch-partenkirche). Not so much space for cars to stop, they don't see you from a far distance, but very busy and the best place to hitchhike from Konstantz to that direction.
some people stopped for us when, after 20 min, a couple took us to a place very close to the A81.

There is asmall area for cars to park direction Horb am Neckar. There is basically nothing there, just a Casino on the other side of the road. Cars slow down at this part before the turn and they can see you from a far distance.
We tried to hitchhike from there to Konstantz. Impossible. A friend of us took us close to the A81. Much easier

Direction: Horb or Alpirsbach
Busstation with enough space to stop.
Crossing of L580 and L579 near Horstmar, direction SchÃ¶ppingen/Ahaus. Fast traffic here, but along the whole road is a hard shoulder where they can stop.
Even on the on-ramp it is quite fine to find a ride up North. The AllgÃ¤uer are nice people.

Lass dich - wenn du auf dem Weg nach Eisenach bist - von Westen auf der A4 her einfach an der Ausfahrt Eisenach West an diesem Kreisel rausschmeiÃŸen und warte (optional mit einem EA-Schild) an der Auffahrt zur alten Autobahn. Die Allermeisten fahren in die Stadt hinein und sollten bereit sein, dich mitzunehmen. Klare Richtung, aber schlecht anzuhalten. Viertelstunde und du solltest jemanden haben!

Take the bus C or D. 
At the spot there are traffic lights because of a zebra crossing. If you keep pressing the zebra button, the lights will be red, the cars will stop and they'll take you. Good luck!
I waited 40 min for a lift across the border to Luxembourg.
Service station Eifel, direction to Trier, Luxembourg (A64) and Saarbruecken (A1).
I waited 25 min for a lift direction to Koblenz, A61.
Service station Ville, ask here for Euskirchen (A1) or Koblenz (A61).

Close to the centre, very walkable distance.
There's a bus stop just behind the junction. Many cars are still going slow due to the traffic light, I manage to go to Nuremberg from here, should be even better for Munich / Hof

Traffic Ligth before the city ends.
Few people go on to the highway. But they are likely to bring you closer to Eberstadt. Maybe better to tramp from the inner city.
Got lucky with a ride to Hamburg in 10min. Spot is not that nice; traffic is a bit fast and doesn't have much space to stop.

Very bad if you want to go towards Bremen, probably quite good if you want to go up North. If you want to go to Bremen, instead walk towards the Eisinghausener Strasse (south, see map), walk along it with your thumb up, and catch a ride to the autobahn on ramp on the west of Lehr.
Cannot recommend this spot as cars are going 70 km/h there and don't really have an option to stop. The roundabout farther down the road might me a better place to start.
Good for direction Bingen, Koblenz. Using a sign might be helpful.
I wanted to go to Freiburg via Heilbronn from there, but not car whatsoever pulled over. A neat spot to be dropped of for Nuremburg though.

A spot to hitch towards Heilbronn, Stuttgart.
I hitched just next to the autobahn sign. There is not much space to pull over, but I got a ride within 5 minutes, who actually drove to Heidelberg, but decided to help me and brought me directly to Stuttgart.
On-ramp Lotte (13) on A30. Direction Osnabruck/A2. Spot is pretty ok, but people aren't so likely to stop.

this area is not as good as advertised. me and a few other hitchhikers spent about 3 hrs to find a ride in front of the shopping centre, at the gas stations and at the traaffic lights. VERY few cars to dresden. we didnt get a ride in the end

a perfect (!) spot to leave 'leipzig' to 'dresden' or other places in eastern saxony. the 'paunsdorf center' (the roofed area you see below the marker) is a large shopping mall with excellent public transportation opportunities (tram, bus, even late at night) to the leipzig city center. it took me 30 seconds (!!!) to find a driver taking me on autobahn 'A 14' in the direction of 'dresden'. it is not legal (!) or safe (no shoulder) to stand between here and the 'A 14' on the federal highway 'B 6'

If you want to go West on the A2, you need to go to the other side of Hannover. I stood at this spot for an hour with a Dutch guy who had been here for three hours already. He gave up and took the train back to Amsterdam. I moved to the Gas station at JÃ¤derkamp (I marked it on the map), and was also in Holland by midnight.

As I arrived I was quite hopeless and thought that I won't get a lift from there because there wasn't much traffic and people just drove to places nearby. But after an hour or something I got a direct lift to Leipzig. So it worked out quite well anyway. The petrol stations stuff was quite funny and helpful, thanks for that!
Good luck, God bless you!

Total Station, there is not too much traffic and a lot of people just drive to places nearby but there is still the possibility to get a lift north- and southward bound on the A10. It seemed to me that there were more people going to the north than to the south.
nah... waited 45mins for a lift to A4 west, even though I had a sign. Not a good place for cars to stop, except when traffic light is red ^^
It's easy to go on the A4 from here. You can reach this point by walking very easy. Driver can stop it is not the best place to stop, but it's also not to dangerus.
A3 direction: north

Going Northbound towards NÃ¼rnberg was impossible here because the on-ramp has no shoulder and the grass has poles that make it difficult for cars to pull into.  

Love,
The East Cackalacky Ascetic Marching Death Band
Direction Hof/A9. The right lane before the on-ramp is not perfect to stop, but ok.

Autohof Apen-Remels. Lots of locals.
There is a big truck parking and a restaurant.
In case you can't get away at all, there is also busses going towards Leer/Groningen and Oldenburg/Bremen who stop here.

A decent spot to hitchhike south towards Hannover if you get dropped off at the nearby autohof. There's a luxury amount of space to stop at the side (though it's a highway ramp so it's already illegal). The forest opposite the autohof is also a good place to spend a night if you have a sleeping bag - we found loads of blueberries for breakfast around there :-)
Preferred the exit over the petrol station for direction Munich, and got a quick ride to the next Raststatte. Not such a good spot though, cars dont have much place to stop.
We asked a driver at the red ligth to take us to Salzburg.

To Chemnitz or south on highway A72.
Stand in the "closed from traffic" area marked here facing the drivers that are preparing to turn onto this road. They have enough space to stop.
Thumbing is enough (most cars go in one direction) but alternatively you can use a sign with a letter "C".

The simplest option to go directly to Leipzig.
Stand with a sign a few meters before the bus stop.
The spot is excellent (cars go relatively slowly and have lots of space to stop) but few are going directly to Leipzig.
Be patient, we (boy+girl) waited 40 mins.

Before the traffic lights at the right side of the road. I used this spot to get to speedroad 59 to go north, to Amsterdam. It's logical to show your sign only when there is a red light, otherwise there is no place for car to stop. McDonald's with free toilette and wi-fi 150 meters away.
Lensahn, A1 direction Fehmarn. Nice on-ramp, might get you further towards Puttgarden.
going north in the evening is close to impossible. everyone seems to be just going to Krefeld.

This place can range from being a good spot to being a really bad spot, depending on which direction you want to go. Direction South, like France and Cologne is usually no Problem, once I waited only 5 min. to get a ride to Paris. Then again going direction north (I was going to Poland), it took me like an hour to get somebody to take me to a service station on the A2, only 60 km far.
Good luck!
There is a service station where cars can pull in or pull in for fueling up (ask people). Long straight raod so cars can see you from distance.
If you ever go from Eichstatt to Pollenfeld in your life this is your spot! Make your way to get there and use the last bus stop before the narrow road goes uphill. Splendid experience :)
Works fine when going to the north.
Very bad spot. No space for the cars to stop. we gave up after 2 hrs and took train northwards to a service station

Take the train to S Westend.

-Stand at the traffic lights. Lights are set so usually 5-6 cars stop at the red light, go through and then the next 5-6 cars have to stop. Plenty of time for them to decide if they want to give you a ride or not. Only thing here is that you have to pick one side so you miss a few cars.

OR

(Going South only)
-Stand behind the intersection right before the start of the highway. There's a spot where people can pull up. Thing here is that people are accelerating righ
Small service Area. Got fuel station and some restaurants.
Had better experience as the one above. But may take time... in my case, one hour.

A hopeless place for those, who want to catch a hike ACROSS Berlin. We were hitching from Poland towards Hannover and trying to pass Berlin, but everybody was just driving inside of it. We were forced to bypass the city from the north

We hitchhiked from here west to the airport Frankfurt Hahn. It was 10pm and so dark, and no cars slowed down or even looked interested for a good 45 minutes, thankfully we got picked up by the actual airport bus and given a lift all the way there, however i think we just got lucky, wouldnt recommend this spot for getting to frankfurt hahn.
drove through it once, looked pretty empty so I took the ride further to the airport instead.

Direction: east
A parkplatz on the highway.
I believe this is the smaller terminal. Try hitch hiking from Terminal 1.

I hitch hiked there(Terminal 2) wanting to go direction A5, North. I had a sign with it. Although there is a lot of traffic, the people either are anxious for a reason or not have so much time to think about getting you. 
Nevertheless, there was a man who drove me until the first Rasthof in A5 direction South(Darmstadt).

You could just as easily hitch hike from INSIDE the parking garage where it is warm and you can talk to people. Direction of travel may also be limited from this point so be sure it's right for you before you stand here for too long.

Not exactly sure what was intended to be marked here as I haven't used this spot myself. Looks like it is one of the exits from the parking garage. Directions of travel from this point could be limited. Please update this description with your experience.

Good Spot to get on the A6 in direction of Heilbronn. I guess it ist even good to go to MÃ¼nchen.

There are traffic lights which slow down the cars and a busstop behind the crossing.

haha, the first lift dropped me off some meters further at the bridge, unfortunately then police came and sent me back because of "BundesstraÃŸe" and not allowed to hitchhike there... so rather stand at the  traffic light marked here. although not best spot...
quite good to get on the A29
not so many cars and trucks (1 or 2 per minute) on a sunny day of February, thursday, at midday. I gave up o waiting at the gas station and waled to here
Liege / Verviers
Parking lot for commuters, easy to get a hike to Trier/Luxemburg, but only in the early morning.
Try not to get dropped here. You will be picked up eventually but there is not much traffic...I was picked up after 30 minutes...
Average spot to hitch southbound. Either ask drivers or stand next to the traffic light a little further

Sunday around 11:00,
direction SaarbrÃ¼cken,
1 Car / 5 Minutes
took around 30minutes to get a lift
This service station is most of the time nearly empty, this is why you can expect waiting times between 30 and 90 minutes.
nice spot i you wanna hitch to Kaltenkirchen (motorway) in order to get to Kiel or any other place in the north
Um auf die A7 zu kommen besser noch mal zurÃ¼ck fahren und von RaststÃ¤tte Steigerwald versuchen.

I was heading to Paderborn, and then further on. Got lucky and the second person I was asking (8AM on a weekday) was a business woman going to bavaria, who took me for more than 2 hours.
Despite that I gave this spot an 'average' cause it's only one experience and I might just have been lucky.

shell gas station.
take the train to Senne and then walk or take a bus to bus-stop 'airport' (Flugplatz)
I started there twice, and twice I had a short lift taking me directly to the JET gas station before the A8 starts. But from there you get sth within 5 minutes. Or just take the bus further.

you can reach this spot with tram 17 to AmalienburgerstraÃŸe, like 20 min from main station.
Good stopping opportunity, but not best light. But there is also a direct bus going further which stops directly before the A8 (Halt Blutenburg)

On-ramp HÃ¶rstel towards Amsterdam.

Normal traffic, mostly towards Rheine.
Junction towards Rheine-Mesum. Low traffic, but driving slow due to traffic lights.
Direction Trier / Luxembourg / Saarbrucken.
Not that much traffic at this place
parking place to dortmund/kÃƒÂ¶ln

A small parking for park+ride system, where people are leaving their cars and sharing a ride with others going the same direction. Even though it was already too late for that, we found a ride after 5 minutes to take us to the nearest gas station on the highway in the direction of the Netherlands.
I put my thumb up here to go on A3 heading south; I got a ride in about half an hour.

When I got there it took me half an hour to get a direct ride to Innsbruck. But I consider it was my luck as there was not that much traffic and what is more a road accident had happened nearby just before i got to the place.
A parking with an opportunity to hitchhike towards Innsbruck.
To Bitburg.
Waited here once 150 minutes for a 10 km ride, once 10 minutes for a lift to the A13... :P
To Luckau / A13.
Fast traffic
To Belgium, St Vith, Liege
To Wittlich. Fast traffic.
We waited for 30 minutes to get a small ride towards Stuttgart. If we were heading towards Munich it would have been faster, but it's almost impposible to get a direct ride to Stuttgart.
Big parking place from both sides of the road and also a traffic light. Many people to ask around if you are heading towards Stuttgard or Munich. Most of them go to Munich though.

It is hard to find the place, because you need to walk through a living area because on the direct street is no sidewalk. It works, but it is hard to disdinguish which car goes/comes from the motorway, and which comes from the town.

Service station close to a Burger King. It is not directly on the expressway (germ. Autobahn A9) but very close to it. Advantage: You can take a bus from the city centre or take a walk to the service station.
People who bought a ferry ticket in advance drive by here (a few meters behind the exit of the roundabout).

I started here to get onto the A8.
There is a bus stop and a traffic light here (so people can stop w/out disturbing the traffic). But there is quite little traffic, so I waited 1,5 hours.
a bus station a little bit after the junction and red light. but it took a lot time to get a lift.
Good for hiking to Rottenburg, Horb and the Autobahn A81 southwards.
you are almost middle of nowhere here. If you have good luck you will take a lift  soon. i hitched a car on 9th of August 2012

Here is the Klinikum bus station. I started hitch-hiking from this spot to go to Dresden on 9th of August 2012.

There is enough place to stop and traffic is not so high but local people are not willing to give us a lift. We were two boys.

Traffic lights. Not easy to stop. Most traffic goes up the coast (direction Kappeln).
100m down the street is a gas station which has very cheap prices, so there is a lot of traffic. We had better luck on this spot at the street.
Traffic light and a lot of space to stop. Busstop nearby. Rushhour works good, many people work in Schleswig.
Lot of space to stop. Mainly cars to Schleswig. If you want to go further, try to get to the motorway-onramp of A7 in Schleswig-Schuby to the west.
it is very much better to start from the city, this is a spot directly in the sun, and there are mostly locals, I waited 1 hour alone as a woman!

a good place to reach 'bitterfeld' from 'halle'. i tried to reach 'dresden' but only received offers to 'leipzig'. there is many cars passing this spot (safe conditions for cars to stop) but most of the traffic is commuting. at the gas station (or the mc. donald's restaurant) on the opposite side of the road it is not easier to find someone. mostly locals eat their cheeseburgers(or fill their cars) there. on my personal ranking "1" (very-very poor) to "10" (excellent) i will rate this spot a "5

Not so easy to get here, but after 1,5 hour waiting time a nice woman with a Jaguar stopped to me and took a ride up to the motorway. Cars are coming from 2 ways, but lot of people just go few kilometers.
Bus stop and a low side wall, on which you can stand to be more visible for passing drivers. A lot of inner city traffic, but also many people are heading west, like Magdeburg or Hannover

The on-ramp sign's scratchmarks tell a history of hitchhikers being stranded here on the way to Berlin. Maybe there is a time during the day where you can _easily_ get a lift here. We haven't found it so far (during the evening). Correct this entry if you know otherwise.
Esso Gas station, high frequented, most cars go to autobahn to south or north
NO WAY OUT TO PRAG! Spend maybe 5 hours and no result! road of dead! Only way - go back to Dresden and find somebody on a parking. Don't stay here

I hitched here with my friend and a guy took us to france from here. But the police came here and warned us becouse of what is said in the description. Better hitchhiked on a place after the A6 joins the A63.

This place is not so good. The signpost that mark the beginning of the highway is very close to the curve so you have to hitch after it which is illegal. Someone did however stopped and took us to Saarebrucken.
very easy to find from tramstop; auestadio. a bus stop just before the lights. You need a sign. not very good place but it worked for me,
Here a lot of cars leave TÃ¼bingen fÃ¼r the B27. They go in all kind of directions from there.
seemed quite useless to ask people at the petrol station
Not much space to pull over, but sometimes you can get a long-distance lift.
Not a good place to pull over, but a lot of people go to Southeast.
Small parking lot near the crossroads, direction CZ. Cars are going very fast and it can be very hard for them to stop.
Good spot if you want to get from Deggendorf direction Phillipsreuth.
Towards Gardelegen, Haldesleben, Magdeburg
Here is the part of Autobahn. Police came and warn us for that reason. And we had to left the Autobahn and went back to Stolpe Heide Petrol Station. That PS is perfect spot to go to Hamburg.
we stand here for a half a hour - then go to south gas station

petrol station on the B16 towards Regensburg, Kehlheim..tried it once. didnt work well. many local costumers.
anyway, the spot is situated quite well. if youre  lucky youu can catch a ride to the A9 as well. reachable by bus 44 and 11
We got a tide here to the border with the Netherlands. At 17h there isn't a lot of traffic heading to the Netherlands

We got a ride (direction Oldenburg) here  very quickly (5 minutes or so), but since it's a bit dangerous place to stop for drivers, and most drivers don't go directly to Bremen, be prepared to be dropped of at a bad point (we got stuck at a rastplatz for 2 hours)
Didn't get a lift there, but you can be lucky someday when people get there for refueling.
People get here to get cheaper gasoline than at the Autobahn A24. So possible to get a lift to Berlin or Hamburg. Nice chat with the service staff.
Lots of cars going to North, but possible to find also lifts to south. Good for trucks, too. Walkable from the airport.
fairly okay when you we're just dropped off from the autobahn and want to go north. be aware of the hausfrauenverkehr (after 19 pm you are stuck)
Good spot to the Highway or even further (BERLIN). Cars can stop there easily!
Gas Station near the Highway. we didnÂ´t had any luck here, though, because most of them were only locals.

direction NÃ¼rnberg
most of people are going to Munich
there is no place te stop a car
absolutly not a good place
maybe before just after ikea ?
cops control me, you can hichhicking but not on the Highway...

A ramp near ikea. It's in a walking distance from S-Bahn Eching, you can take a bus here as well.
Almost all of the cars are local (i.e. Freising). Might take long time to get a good ride.
If you want to go to the north you better walk then try to hitchhike. It is a nice place to get in touch with the Brandenburg Mafia, but not a single average car-driver will stop at this station
A small petrol station in the western ring of the A10. Not so much traffic but at least no Problem if you get to the west or to the south. I waited 17 min for a lift to Hannover.
About two dozen trucks stop over in the industrial area for the weekend break. If you're leaving early on monday finding a ride might be possible.

I was heading towards the east along the A94 waiting at the highway entrance. It took me hours from this place to get away, very few cars passing by, a lot less were stopping. Mostly local people just going a couple of kilometres. As soon as I was on the A94 things worked fantastic. So patiences necessary here!

Gasstation

Heading North on A7 you can catch a lift to "Rasthaus und Hotel Seligweiler" besides the A8 or directly towards Heidenheim on A7, where you pass the gasstation Lonetal.

I just waited 5 minutes on a Friday afternoon.

Me and my friend left the airport and walk a little till a parking lot (near some hotels and stuffs) and then took a ride from there till the burguer king (Is not THAT close to the airport). From the bk we went to the road in front of it - pay attention to the right side) and took a ride to Frankfurt. Not that easy but not bad;

Very little traffic, but chances are the drivers will either drive to Frankfurt or Trier... better chances than at the airport b/c single drivers. After standing at the airport for 1 1/2 hrs, got a ride here after 5 min...
bad point to get to the A14 diriction wismar. best expiriensces with taking the B106 (next exit A24 direction Hamburg) crossing schwerin.
To Hamburg
Average spot at the traffic lights (for those who drive towards Schweinfurt onto the A70).

I made the same experience. Most of the cars are heading towards Hannover. Very few going southwards to Leipzig/Hermsdorfer Kreuz. Had to change my route to Frankfurt tremendously. Was shitty weather though and noone was willing to stop or a give me a lift.
Most of the cars are going to Hannover or Hamburg. Leipzig/Stuttgart direction is difficult but doable. French cars preferable.

It was our first hiking trip and our driver brought us here, because we wanted to go south or west and he changed north at "Hermsdorfer Kreuz". Found somebody to Ingolstadt (A9) but we should have jumped out more in the north at RaststÃ¤tte "Osterfeld", where you can change to the southbound side. But many cars came here. Idea: If you're stuck here try to get a lift from a local along the "Rodaer StraÃŸe" and walk onto the Rasthof in the south of the Hermsdorfer Kreuz (or a lift to MÃ¶rsdorf if you
Few cars take you to the highway. We accepted a lift to the Kaufpark at least to continue from there.
Wait in the middle of the road for the red traffic light, then ask those who want to turn left for a lift to Kaufpark or Autobahn.

probably this spot was meant to be at the nearby parking which is on the other side of the motorway.It's called Kolberg and even so there's no service or gas station it is a good point to hitchhike. If you're coming from this area it's best to ask a friend to drive you there to start hitchhiking. A lot of people stop there due to traffic which is always high in this area.
It will not be a problem to find a direct lift to the ring of Berlin or even further to poland etc.
good to get south/north
Sensless towards Netherlands. Better cross the road  and go one station further towards Osnabruck. There will be right traffic going on to get to Holland.

at the beginning I thought this might be a good spot, as it leads rights out of the city centre, but mostly b/c I used to take carsharing offers which usually start at the west entrance of the Hbf yet I couldn't see where cars should stop along the street, b/c it is quite well frequented, so I didn't try; if you're heading to Trier, perhaps consider leaving from Wiesbaden instead

thought this might be a good spot...many students, and as it was a Friday I thought perhaps some of them would be leaving home...but forget it! this place is dead, as is the whole areal (when it comes to car traffic ofc). also, don't try to stand on the main road b/c it is huge!

I hitch-hiked here to go to Szczecin (Stettin). In general, I don't recommend to use the thumb on the Berliner Allee; to much traffic, few places to stop, nervous people, and you're still inside the town. Exactly in the spot I put there is a petrol station; it's on the other side of the street and people going to Poland usually wait to be there to refuel because it's cheaper, but anyway it's better than the thumb. So, few cars directed to Szczecin, but some of them anyway going out from Berlin i
very few cars, lots of full packed cars with families, pretty complicated to get a ride. waited over an hour and the finally someone gave me a ride...

A quiet autobahn service station, but you will get a ride south eventually.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Bickenbach
We just dropped out a car then i asked a girl, she was very kind, probably we were extremely lucky and take us to Rosenheim. By the way the place was very empty.
Waited for 7 hours through the night as a group of 2 people. Got many ride offers to everywhere in Germany... but none towards Vienna, which is what we wanted.
really really really bad if you get here late. restaurant closes at 9 pm...no gas station. better chose the Autohof some 60 km before.
asked people at the petrol station with no result, after 15 minutes the staff send me away. waited about an hour more with hamburg sign near the street and go a lift to stolpe a111 petrol station..
if you go to hamburg you can get a lift from there, it takes about 30 min to get a ride. theres a metro station just few meters from the spot U Scharnweberstr
a little bit dangerous!
Direction Singen/Stuttgart or Freiburg.... there is some space where cars can stop. Even if they often are very fast you'll never have to wait more than half an hour!

One can get to IKEA from Erlang by first taking tram 2 and then bus 80. Bus 80, however, comes once an hour or every 2 hours (depending on day/time ...) so make sure to get the right one!

Otherwise, it was easy to find people to get us on A71. However, I have to warn you that A71 has only *1* gas station and it might take a while to find someone to go that far!
good stop to get to Wolfsburg over the country road L290. Behind the traffic circle is a pocket, where people who are leaving it in the direction of Wolfsburg can stop.

There's am Autohof just off the Autobahn with an Aral gas station and a McDonalds. Tried to get a ride south on A39 but it was rather pointless. If your going south try to get a ride at Helmstedt Nord, it's the gas station prior to that if your comming from east.
If you cant get a ride at the Autohof just walk towards the Autobahn and position yourself a the roundabout, got a ride within 10min.

To Bad DÃ¼rkheim or Neustadt (WeinstraÃŸe) this seems to be an agreable spot. Place yourself on empty parking lots. Better accept only longer rides to neustadt or bad dÃ¼rkheim because there is a bypass road and if you get stuck in one of the villages it gets hard (but most of them have a trainstation)
Rebuilding of the ramp resulted in even worse possibility for cars to stop, but they do nevertheless. Good for Rheine and further.

Traffic island to stand on if you want to hitch at this ramp towards Rheine, OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck, A31. Cars can stop some meters behind you, but might be dangerous with quite a lot of traffic. Nevertheless a good spot, waiting time around 10 minutes

mickymaus: what do you mean?

I can mark to be removed at some point.
sorry, i added this spot in mistake :-(
I got a lift direct to Berlin

Bus Stop just after a red light, easy for the cars to stop.
East to Bayreuth, West to Wurzburg.
Quite a good place to find a lift on the countryside highway to Vechta. You can ask the cars stopping at the traffic light or just stand next to the road with a sign or your thumb.
Gas station "Irxleben", good to get lifts Southeast to Halle/Saale, Leipzig or East to Berlin or Magdeburg

Direction A5 north and south.

It doesn't make sense to go here by tram from Freiburg centre, but if you're somewhere near it works pretty well. (There is a traffic light, so you can ask people who come from the Adelheid-Steinmann-StraÃƒÅ¸e).
Tram stop is \"Rieselfeld\".

Petrolstation just before Dresden on A4 (position on map not accurate). 
Very poor for Prague (expect hours to wait, especially in evening), very good for Poland, good for Berlin.
going to frankfurt it's ok
basic place to get to the highway (exit Piding / Bad Reichenhall)
Car dealer with place for hitchhiker's to stop cars. Take bus 21 from center to get here. (get out at OS-Nahne). Good for both directions along A30.
about 60 minutes to get a lift in direction berlin, to hannover seems to be more effective

petrol station with the possibilty to go into erlangen or find lift going north-west or south-east on the A3. If you dont find anyone just walk up to the entrance of the A3 theres traffic lights and cars are going rather slowly

took me a while to get north on the a3 because most are locals/ heading to the airport

Indeed not recommended for going north on the A3. Lots of local rides and some to Wiesbaden, Stuttgart, MÃ¼nchen etc.

Day one we waited for 4 hours, noone, so we went to the city, qhere sime nice people let us stay at their place, they even fed us dinner <33 Other day we waited 3 hours, weather was terrible and we were desperate, so we went to the front behaind guarding and picked up a guy going to Landau in 10-20 minutes

Many people going south to Strasbourg and Switzerland but no one continuing on the A8 towards Stuttgart or Pforzheim.
for going to A8 to Pforzheim and Stuttgart its difficult to find somebody there and it is not many traffic here, waiting time between half an hour and four houres.

Just stand at the traffic light. I got lucky pretty quick.
There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something
There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something
at the traffic lights, many people stop on the right lane to turn right onto the A9

They changed the bording rules. So people who booked early now have a time slot. So you can talk to them while the wait. A polish guy said he will get me on the ferry but he has to wait two hours before he can enter. I tried two hours to get a direct ride to Copenhagen but failed. So I crossed with him. Would have gotten another opportunity with a guy who had to wait but this would have been even later

June 2018: 
Direction Hamburg/wherever that's not Denmark:
Try to get a ride before you enter the ferry from RÃ¸dby. It's a rush of cars each time the ferry arrives, but absolutely no opportunity for them to stop except the last cars,unless it's a nearly empty ferry.

It was also 3 other hitchhikers stuck with us. At least the weather was nice.

Puttgarden also don

I experienced that the closer you get to the ferry exit, the less speed the cars have (and thus the easier they can read your sign). This is much more to your advantage IMO than standing further, trying to catch traffic from the K49.

Try to talk to everybody in the ferry, because after getting land, cars just won't stop !!! The drivers who took me in Copenhagen told me it was better to stop there as they were going to Oldenburg. I guess if it's possible, don't get drop after the ferry because there are some rush and then nothing and most cars won't stop again. Plus, I was there in the evening, I tried for one hour. Then I decided I'll spend the night in the trainstation. It isn't the worst place for an overnight : it's cover
When you got the opportunity take a ride to the drive-up in Burg. There I had much more luck than at this busy spot.

We wanted to go to Poland on a Friday but after 1 and a half hours of waiting we decided to change the spot. There were only local cars going to Berlin or nearby areas. Only a few polish cars but they didnâ€™t stop. Also the place to stop for cars isnâ€™t perfect.

"Dresden" card and one guy which was going to Budapest stopped ;). Best of that 3 spots here, becouse people stay on red light at 'L752 and B 96a' crossing and can see u from there + very safely place.
Waiting with "Dresden" on paper, but we catch a car going to town Cottbus on the half of the way.

Spot for the direction of Dresden or Cottbus.

Rather good place to stop for cars.
Terribly little traffic in either direction and mostly local, ended up taking local on-ramps to hop exits to the nearest highway rest areas
Terribly little traffic in either direction and mostly local, ended up taking local on-ramps to hop exits to the nearest highway rest areas

Little traffic, but immediately found a lift to next service area Longeville.

Definitely the better choice than the other petrol station. Less people than the other station, but at least it's not just the desperate shopping housewifes who also need to fuel their car. If you pass by this area, I'd recommend you that petrol statin, maybe even mixed with an handwritten panel.

Works really fine here, visited this Spot probably around 10 Times in the last year, never waited longer than 15 Minutes.

Direction Munich.

Saturday afternoon in fall

horrible place! the autohof is really small!

go to the mcdonald's restaurant and ask the people. if you wanna go south, this is the best you can do. on ramp didn't work really well and they shut down the street lightning at some point so drivers can't see you

OUTDATED - the stop doesnt exist anymore - i saw it on GMaps but upon arriving(and it wasnt a pleasant journey either) couldnt find a suitable place. Got stopped by cops after sometime and had to pay a fine ( 5â‚¬ ðŸ™ƒ )

Small highway stop, not many cars stopping - but good to catch a ride down South in direction Passau. Starting at try this spot in the darkness is senseless. Its reachable the spot from the IKEA Bus stop.

Soo much cars and nice people but no one took me- everyone just smiled. I was sure Iâ€™m standing good- but in fact no one goes to the high way. After nice conversations with people on the street and one hour waiting I got frustrated. Took in the end the train:/

maybe you'd try a boat hike? :)

Ramp 28; south: Horrible ramp with very little place to safely stop, but so much traffic that the statistics start working in your favour. Stood here for 40 minutes in direction OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck.

Mostly locals and very little traffic. With a bit of luck you find somebody going to Hamburg. perfect to go north,

really not much sense hitchhiking to netherlands from this spot, it's much better to try to catch someone coming from Bremen (a1) above osnabrÃ¼ck. got stuck here for quite some time.
