the autohof is a bad place to get a ride. almost every car is local. not enough traffic. we waited for 3 hours.

Don't use the fuel station at the Kirchheimer Kreuz if you're going west towards GieÃŸen or Cologne. It is not indicated in the signs if you arrive from the A4 from east, so nobody will stop from there.
on A7, A5, and A4. at the intersection by burger king is good for any direction.  people stop for food and gas, and will pick you up.

after missing the allstedt fuel stop we ended up here. it's the absolutely wrong spot for going from east to west on the A38, because it's the wrong side of the autobahn (even though it's accessible from both sides). only old and young locals were passing there. the only chance is to find a mercy mitfahrgelegenheit-car-driver picking you up. usually they stop at the parking area in front of the macdonalds, that's a spot for them.

I was ear friday before easter and it was horrible. Only younng east german kids were enjoying their time at Mc Donalds. I waited a lot of time and then accepted a ride to the train station. A 38 is really difficult

Hint: this is not a usual highway fuel station but an "Autohof" which means people have to leave the highway to refuel here and there is a lot of local traffic. Use the new highway fuel stop "Allstedt" 5km east if you can.
McDonald's restaurant and petrol station. Quite a few Polish cars if you wanna head to Poland or East in general.
Got dropped off here to go to Salzburg, there were a lot of people but we were hitchhiking for 1,5 day before we got a ride.
end july 2011, on the onramp to the motorway headed to Austria ; worked well, with rain and it looked like nothing...

got dropped at the petrol station also and wanted to go to salzburg(with a sign!!). thought i was stuck here. but on the side of the roundabout where the traffic from rosenburg comes from i finally got a ride. might have been lucky though. was a friday afternoon, maybe then getting onto the autobahn again works better(?)

we got dropped at a petrol station here and tried to hitch to innsbruck for a few hours, with no luck. If you plan to go south from here you are much better to get a ride up to the next station, about 15kms, which gets all the traffic from germany going south.. from there it was easy.
This spot is somewhat better, more traffic going eastwards to Rheine or IbbenbÃƒÂ¼ren. Hitched this direction 2 times, both waiting time around 5 minutes
Not much traffic, waited here twice. (About 20min waiting.) Got rides towards IbenbÃƒÂ¼ren and OsnabrÃƒÂ¼ck.

I would not say it is a good spot. There is a red light but cars dont really have space to stop, you must be mega fast. Got lucky here as one lady signaled to run to her car throw the things in just before the green light appeared. It was a bit streesful.
I tried it but I didn't feel comfortable. Finally I changed to the other petrol station, where less people went longer distances.

Lots of shopping tourists that come just from the big Globus marked opposit the street. Most of the cars going home after shopping, not far away. I tried it but I didn't feel comfortable. Finally I changed to the other petrol station, where less people went longer distances.

Not a good spot indeed, people here donâ€™t seem to care about hitchhikers. Few people stopped to try to help out but they werenâ€™t going on the highway. Eventually got picked up by a guy who brought me to a rest stop

Horrible spot. Not much traffic. Unless stopped by the traffic light, cars go quite fast and don't have a good place to pull over. Cars going North, East, and South from here. You probably want to take the first ride that can get you to next HH spot on your route, makig signs of questionable value here.
I agree, not a good spot
many traffic but no place where cars can stop. the only way is to ask at the traffic light...
no service station, restaurant closes at 9pm - you don't want to get here late.
arrived when the restaurant closed for the night. no chance to get a car until the morning - there's simply none. and even then: it took us another two ours from the time the diner opened.
border crossing. few private cars but heaps of trucks. got a lift on a tour bus full of Russians in the end
Agree! Impossible to get a hike from here!

I got a ride from here on a winter day with blowing snow in about 20 minutes, but I would not choose this spot again; instead, to go south the best is to walk on the other side of the bridge for about 1 km until the guardrail ends and there there will be plenty of space for the cars to stop.

This place is no good for hitchhiking; there is a crosslight here but no space at all for the cars to stop because of the guardrail. I got a ride from here on a winter day with blowing snow in about 20 minutes, but I would not choose this spot again; instead, to go south the best is to walk on the other side of the bridge for about 1 km until the guardrail ends and there there will be plenty of space for the cars to stop.
sorrry this commentar was for the spot above :(
Is a place where people meet to have sex, had a strange experience with a guy who wanted my number after giving me a lift
Not much traffic, mostly locals, I waited 2,5 hours without getting a ride. Friends of mine waited 1,5h before getting a ride.
Bad. And yet, it worked for me within 15 minutes. Would NOT recommend it, though!

The truck stop Rosenhof which used to be there is closed (and has been closed for years, judging by the vegetation overgrowing the former parking lot), therefore most cars passing aren't going on the Autobahn..

Not a good place to get to the motorway.
Better try to get to Regensburg by the road, and start from there.
A small gas station with low frequency of cars, but much better than Schoenefeld. You can got there by foot from the willage, going along the highway through the forrest. It takes about 45 mins.
A bad place to hitchhike, because the petrol station is really low frequented

AVOID this place! Other information regarding this petrol station are obsolete. Because of the new highway A113(finished in 2008) very close hardly any car goes here. I was waiting at this petrol station for a LONG time, never seen such uncrowded place. So beware. Any village gas station has higher frequency!
It took quite some time to find somebody driving westwards on the A70

This was not a very good spot to hitchhike. I often looked into frightened faces of the locals who may have thought I was a rapist/robber/other evil creature. I was mocked be young locals and some people lied to me about giving me a ride  ("I'll be back in 10 minutes.") To sum it up, hiking here made me feel really uncomfortable. After 2:30 hours (9 pm) a found a cool young guy who took me to Hannover.
This is a spot to get from the A70 to the A7 if you are driving with someone who doesn't want to drive on the A7.
I got stuck there heading to A5. Not a good idea. After a goood long time someone was soo gentle to make a 30k detour for leaving me on the A5.
really small gas station on the highway. if you get dropped there, you will meet mostly locals (if any). avoid being dropped there if you wanna continue on the a5...
Highway service station "Frankfurt a. M." on the A66 towards Frankfurt centre and GieÃŸen.
There are often traffic-jams at this place. So if you start at the rush-hour you probably have better changes to start here.
Thumbed here two hours or so until giving up as it got dark.
Based on one experience not a good spot to get to Rasthof Frechen.
Had luck with a truck, just before I wanted to walk to the Ausfart (exit), but rest, only local!
Awful experience! Waited for over two hours to get a lift heading North towards Kassel without success! Only locals or people going North West towards Korbach... Got a train instead.

Gas station; direction north
It's possible to get to A49/Kassel from here, but there's also a lot of local traffic (I guess especially mid-week). It might take a while if you're unlucky.

Horrible place. It looks like the place where you'd want to hitch from though. Avoid it like the plague. Here there are only trucks who don't even look at you. You might want to go back to the Toll where there is a huge rest area. Truckers have to stop there to fill in some forms, so remember that they're not chilling out. I eventually went back to the town (Padborg) and hitched the other way towards Flensburg, where I got a ride fairly soon. Beware, people are passing the border to go shopping,

Alright place to start hitchhiking south on the A7. Recommend it as a starting or ending spot for your trip as your able to get to there from the road nearby (though you might need to jump a fence). The parking spot isn't super busy, so if you need to switch rides I'd recommend other bigger autobahn parking spaces to the south or the north.
for some reason people who come there all have cars packed with things with no free space
Not one car stopped in 2.5 hours
Not the best spot. You can ask people who are resting there.
Horrible spot, people were really unfriendly
Waited long time and didnt get a ride
this place looks a little creepy but it worked for me quite well twice. use a sign.
On a monday afternoon with warm and sunny weather it took me about 15min to hitch a ride.
I tried hitching here for three hours with no luck whatsoever. When it started to rain, I got on a bus.
Try nearby petrol station.

One of the better spots to hitchike North or South via A9 from Halle (I couldn't find a good spot....). Lots of cars in this spot, but it's not a good place to stop for cars and pick you up - you will have to wait for a driver who doesn't care that he basically blocks the freeway entrance ramp if he/she picks you up :) Anyways, it has always worked out!
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place
I've spend 2 hours here, without any success. However, I've seen a lot of plates from UK, NL and eastern germany.

me and my friend waited more than one hour but no one stoped for us so we went to Gostritz and we putted our tentes to spend the night then in the morning we went to AM NOTHNITZGRUND 
HOW TO REACH THIS PLACE : from gostritz you can walk direction to Rosentitz and when you cross the highway there is a door who goes inside the A17 the door it's always open. Sometimes you can find Police in that station but don't worry they are not going to say anything even if you talk with the drivers. Good Luck

Dresden can become a real challenge for those of us who are trying to get to Berlin from  Prague or vice versa. You need to be really lucky and positive to get a ride from here. There is a bus stop just after the Technical University, so you can stand there with a sign. Fortunately we got a ride after 10 minutes even though it was rainy and there were three of us. Stay strong, guys! And good luck!
yep try along rostocker chaussee to get to rostock
Avoid it!
Not at all senseless! We waited for about 30min on a rainy winter day (New Year's Eve 2017) and made it all the way to the Dutch boarder. Very recommendable - cars CAN hold (if they want to).
Junction. Just in front of Autobahn sign. Senseless.
Only a few cars, and a long waiting time to go to Stuttgart
Rather few eastgoing cars frequent this place, but it's possible to hitch a ride.

We tried to go direction Munich from here. Did not work out and we changed our spot for the bus stop in Beethovenstr. after a while. 
There it was way better!

We thought this might be a good spot, as it is a big Autohof with McDonalds and stuff. But we were very mistaken; horrible place with only local traffic...Better go to Elwanger hÃ¶he, ca. 3km north...
As on the other side not a lot of space, but we managed to get away. Caused a small traffic jam though. Better not get off here.
Not a lot of space to pull over - would not recommend this spot.
It is easy to get into Essen or other Ruhrgebiet-Cities, but everything further than that is pretty tough. Traffic is okay, but no great.
Stucked heading Netherlands
I was lucky and one of the cars that was on the parking could give me a ride on the A4 directly
Very small parking and most of the people will continue on the A71.

Saturday 19:00 (football night) almost no cars going to CZ. dont waste time here and walk straight to the rest place on the highway, it's only 2 km. there we hitchhike the first car passing by and went straight to Prague.
There is a small space for cars to pull over before the on-ramp. But there are not too many cars entering the higway.
Hardly any stopping space and lots of traffic. A sign is a very good idea, maybe in Polish :-)
not a great spot to stop, got a lucky ride to Berlin after about three minutes
just local traffic, bad spot
Not enough space to pull over. A lot of traffic.
On ramp to A40 for people heading east, north or west. Lots of local traffic, but just ask your driver to drop you at the next gas station, for example Beverbach on the way to Dortmund.

January 2016: Although the B2 starts right next to Wittenberg's Old Town, it's nearly impossible to get a ride from there, as the driving speed starts already at 100km/h. There are not any crossings, roundabouts or bus stops where the drivers could possibly reduce the speed to pick you up. The first actual place where you could stand with your thumb up would be Eutzch, a little village 9km south from Wittenberg. You can walk there (it's a long walk and there's a sidewalk only in the first 5km) o
Almost no car stops here because this isn't a gas station it's just a parking place.
Ok, I confess that I gave up after 30 mins, but there were absolutely no cars hitting the highway on a Thursday morning. Like a car every 5 mins or so, and no one stopped.
Don't let yourself be dropped off at this highway exit. Cars turning left onto the A4 might be easier than hose turning right.
Not a lot of people park here, and the traffic on the motorway is going too fast. Your best bet is to find somebody who will bring you to the highway entries towards Hamburg or OsnabrÃ¼ck
Saturday morning destination Netherlands. Few cars avaible when it is red and no space to stop when it is green. And many cars stay in Cologne.
Shitty place.
A3 direction WÃ¼rzburg / Frankfurt. Few cars. Mostly locals. Ask the drivers waiting at the red light to drop you off at the next rest area on the hightway.
Impossible to get a ride to the west, so a nice local took as to the petrol station at the west end of Eisenach . There it was easier

Ein wirklich guter Spot um aus der Stadt herauszutrampen, viele Leute fahren auf die Autobahn und dann weiter Richtung Gotha/Erfurt, einmal auf der Piste kommst du dann eh gut voran. Du kannst an der Tankstelle herumfragen oder genauso gut am Rand stehen und mit dem Daumen winken. Es ist nicht viel Platz zum Anhalten, aber klappt trotzdem.
Naja
Worked for me, but I wouldn't recommend it, at least not at night.
Roundabout, forests and fields. No lights at night!

By the side of the road on the on-ramp to the B2R / bridge. Not a very good place for cars to stop! 
It still worked for me, even in the dark - but that's not recommended.
A gas station with friendly employees, VERY few cars stopping and not useful at all to get onto the highway.

there is an ESSO petrol-station along A659 (eastward direction). you can reach A5 (via A659) within minutes. drivers at this place can take you to weinheim as well as heidelberg (south) or darmstadt (north) on A5. you can also ask just to get taken to another relais (petrol station) on A5. this station here is rather small. it is difficult to reach it from nearby 'rhein-neckar-zentrum'. take tram number 5 from the city center of mannheim to RHEIN-NECKAR-ZENTRUM (a shopping mall), walk on 'heidel

Better don't use this place. I waited 3h on Sunday afternoon for a lift just to next service area in Eisenberg, which is just 30 km away. Mostly locals are there and some people going north onto A61. Almost nobody continuing west on A6.

Parking Rennschlag (no WC): direction north/west (Koblenz, Kaiserslautern, SaarbrÃ¼cken, Mannheim, Ludwigshafen)
This is a meeting place for gay men. Cars are there, but mostly locals. Note that most cars coming from east on A6 going north onto A61 or west onto A6 don't use this part of A6 and use the A61 between Hockenheim and Frankenthal, instead. They save approx. 2 km by that.
wait 3 hours there, but no car stoped!
The cars slow down on the traffic lights, but do not have time to stop. And mosst of the cars going north do not go on the A111, but after 500m they turn right to Hermsdorfer Damm.
(Illegal).
Ramp with no sidespace to A10 motorway.
Too much traffic, driving too fast, not enough room to stop.
lots of local people. senseless to stand there with a sign. you have to ask people. we tried to get onto a7 and it took us about 1,5h.

tried to get away from there for about 1,5 hours one day, had to sleep in lÃ¼neburg and tried again on the next day. took us 2h to find somebody. you need a sign. around the corner is a shell gas station, where only local people hang around.
A lot of cars past by, but most of them are not going on the Autobahn

Direction East.
Tramp-station is directly next to the tram-station Wiesenau of line 1. The place for the cars to stop is the old, unused and closed entrance of the military barracks. tram-ticket from hanover center costs 2,10Ã¢â€šÂ¬.
Good place to stop, but very few cars.
Ochtrup-west direction Muenster. Shit in this direction, almost no traffic. Also not the easiest area to hitchhike anyway.
slow driving, good place to stop, a lot of cars, !!but!! bad chance during week. (better friday and sunday)
Go directly to the entrance of the motorway (direction Munich)...
Not very good to get to the West (B311), but there aren't any good spots to hitchhike West. So just walk there (not through the tunnel) and try your luck.
Nobody stopped to Hombourg
It was my first day in Germany, and I was lost a little bit. I waited here for 1 hour.
in case someone else ends up here, don't walk to rieselfeld, walk to paduaallee, it's shorter and better to walk. just follow the road crossing the river.
Hitchhikers hell. I was dropped of here at night, no traffic at all, pitch dark, had to walk 30 minutes to the tram-station in rieselfeld.
Terribly dangerous for cars to stop and probably illegal, but I didn't have another choice because I only got until here with the ride before. Thankfully somebody took me after only a few minutes.
I once made the mistake of standing here for direction east. Traffic is already too fast and the spot is illegal. Just stand inside the city and you'll do much better.
What does this have to do with hitchhiking?

If u want to go to a very nice swimming place in Berlin u should take the S-train to heerstrasse station and start walking the road called teufelsseechaussee and while u walk just keep your thumb up and probably someone will take u there. (If not, u can still walk there it's not too far away =)

Last traffic light before the highway.

Impossible to get a ride north, I only got offered rides to MÃ¼hlheim (MH license Plate). You would want to have someone with a RE, BOT or HER or something further north License Plate to get on the A2.

It might be an OK spot to get a ride to DÃ¼sseldorf or Cologne.
On-ramp 25 Lingen, A31 towards Emden. Less traffic than expected, no hard shoulder. People not so friendly here, so hard to get away! The raststatte is a 6km walk along the L45 and then K33!
Agree...
No fucking way out of this shithole... bad place to stop, little traffic.
On-ramp 31 Heek on the A31 towards Emden. Not much traffic, no hard shoulder and fucked up people, great combination!
2 guys took me and my friend up to Freudenstadt. They just finished their job at Baden-Baden and they would come back to Freudenstadt. We had to ask to get a ride.
small gas station. not good for people to see you but it's ok to ask them when they stop to fill the tank. there is a water-fall close to it and a small store to buy some food
Stood there for like half an hour on friday afternoon, just two cars passed by, but the second one took me to the next station
low traffic, nearly no cars driving to the highway
Heading South to Eisenach/A4 just start walking from the big junction in direction Eisenach. There are a lot of cars going this way, especially in the morning.

Ich wurde auf dem Weg auf der A73 Richtung Norden hier herausgeschmissen und es war der ungÃ¼nstigste Ort dafÃ¼r - lieber eine Auffahrt frÃ¼her oder eher. Wer hier strandet, sollte versuchen Ã¼ber Coburg - Bad Rodach auf der LandstraÃŸe weiterzukommen. So hab ich es am Ende nach Hildburghausen geschafft.
Ein blÃ¶der Punkt, maximal um nach Coburg hineinzutrampen. Hoffe nicht zu viel auf einen Ride auf die A73. Oder habe viel Geduld. Hier ist nicht viel Verkehr.

Richtung Ilmenau/Meiningen sehr gut, Richtung SÃ¶mmerda/Erfurt ausreichend, Richtung Ost oder West auf der A4 sehr schlecht.

No shoulder for on-ramp!  Too dangerous.  There is a petrol station down the street and maybe you'll have better luck there...

I was lucky, because one car picked me up after some 30 minutes. But there was almost no traffic

Parking place Moseltal. Not a lot of traffic, the cars are stopping mostly because of the view. Plus there are parking places for trucks as well. But in general there is not a lot of traffic, if possible, get out of the car on another spot.
Autohof. It is really bad. A lot of local people but just a few going on the motorway A9.
Little traffic but there's a decent space to stop at the ramp so the spot is usable if you get stuck around here.
On-ramp at Raunheim, A3. Seems like a good spot towards Koln, but it's only local traffic here and spot is 'half-legal'. Police sent us away after 30min.

Here is just enough space for car to stop, but i had no much luck here. You can try to use this spot to get to speedroad 59 to go north, to Amsterdam, for example. Unfortunately, car drivers don't have enough time to thihk about you, so i changed my position to one, before traffic lights and found a ride in 30 minutes. Probably it's also illegal for car drivers to stop here.
Better directly at the on-ramp :)
Because it seemed too difficult to get a ride at the habour, we went here. In generell roundabouts are very effectiv, but not so here!
On-ramp for the B402 near SchÃ¶ninghsdorf. Completely deserted, don't get dropped off here!
Ok - to hitchhike, no margin though, but still possible to stop - good told twice by police to not hitchhike there in about 20 minutes...

I was heading towards Ingolstadt from here which was quite a bit difficult. I first tried to stand at the road where is very little space for drivers to pull over but still it works. There is also a gas station at the opposite side so try both. To Augsburg would have been easier. It took me more than one hour in the bitter cold German March time until someone gave me a ride to Ingolstadt.
really no good place to hitchhike!!
Small commuters parking next to the motorway's on-ramp. Easy for people waiting at the light to see you. Not much room to stop, though, just the on ramp itself.
Just look or number plates other than SFA, HK and CE and you will be fine. :)
This Autohof is a bad place to get away: mostly regional cars. But maybe you're lucky asking the truckers.

Got dropped off here by a local who said it would be a good place to hitchhike from. Stood here for a while trying to get onto the E40 heading to Cologne, and it wasn't a great spot. Not much traffic, and though a few people offered us lifts, most of them were only going very small distances. Eventually got a lift quite a bit of the way to Cologne though, but it took patience.
jep. we did it to hamburg after waiting 45 minutes in the sun :D

you can go to this point by tram Pankow heinersdorf, some meters away is also a petrol station, at this point is also a good possibility to stop for the cars who dont stop at the station. need perhaps a paper with the destination.

Its hard to hitch-hike because it's not direct at the motorway so the cars must leave it.

cars are very fast and the road is wide, but the shoulder permits plenty of space.

Maybe some of you wont find this info so bad but this is where the police told us to catch a ride and we found one after an our and he took us to Augsberg. We felt like we could we wait for a lot more though...
Towards Augsburg and Suttgart and also Munich. Very few cars go here and many of them refuse with a nice smile.
Spend maybe 2 hours to find a car to Prag. Result: zero :(

parking spot with toilet "goldene aue": going west this place seemed to be totally deserted. very few cars passed. to go away from here we had to convince a local driver that we are lost if he wouldn't give us a ride. he took us to the next parkplatz which was similar. 200 m west is a bridge over the autobahn and a hiking trail to the village berga, train station "berga-kelbra" (3 km), lake kelbra (3,5 km) and the kyhaeuser forest (5 km). from the train station you can go to kassel in 2 hours, h

shit, even though i placed the spot in the hitchwiki very carefully it's now at the wrong place. it must be placed directly at the A38 between berga 13 and rossla 14 at the "silberberg 221". you can see the parking spot driveway in the hitchwiki map.

parking spot with toilet "goldene aue": going west this place seemed to be totally deserted. very few cars passed. to go away from here we had to convince a local driver that we are lost if he wouldn't give us a ride. he took us to the next parkplatz which was similar. 200 m west is a bridge over the autobahn and a hiking trail to the small village thÃ¼rungen, the village berga, train station "berga-kelbra" and lake kelbra. from the train station you can go to kassel in 2 hours, halle in 50 min,
bad place, we wanted to go towards Chemnitz, Nurnberg but we just wasted time and had to find another place- a petrol station to the south
its an ok spot, there is a truck stop close to this onroad, more then enough place to stop, and if it rains you can stand underneath the bridge
Very bad place, not much traffic and mostly local.

Mostly local traffic going to the city only

At 19h30 we couldnt get a ride into the Netherlands. There's very little traffic going by in the direction of the Netherlands.
There's enough room for cars to stop here. The police would'n let us stand closer to the highwat, so you'll have to stand by the Neuschanzer Strasse.

One can only access the highway by taking the stairs at the viaduct which runs over the Dietrichsweg. You have to enter the highway, and stand behind the rail. We got a ride to Leer from here - but my opinion: It's too dangerous, besides, you don't want to get problems with the police.
Good spot if you just want to go on the other side of the Rhein, but very hard to get in the direction of Cologne.
DidnÂ´t have any luck here - very few cars, and most of those went to the north or were locals...
not the best spot, but still, there are people heading to LÃƒÂ¼beck and Hamburg, most of them try to avoid city-traffic, for me it was twice a good alternative to the IKEA spot further down!
Cars are going too fast here, and they divide between north, south, heaven and hell.  No place to stop unless there are now parked cars (and they are always there).

Easy for cars to see you, hard and dangerous for them to stop. Further north is not much better either, since cars going to B1/A44/A1 will switch to left lane early. Asking people at the airport/catching people coming from Airport parking may work better (but check arrival times, no flights at some hours!)
Take bus no 58 from Ulm ZOB to get here.

IMO there's too little space for cars to stop here. Better option would be to walk back the road B19 300m towards Ulm to bus stop at the small crossroads. Most cars going towards MÃ¼nchen come from Ulm anyway.
We waited more than one hour to get to Aschaffenburg, but no one gave us a lift. Fortunately, the station is nearby.
not much traffic at that on-ramp, had a lot luck only waited 30min to get a lift to GieÃŸen (a5). if u come frome the north it might be better to get off one gasstation earlier, called "Hasselberg"

Bus stop, direction A81(north)/Unterjesingen.
I tried it once and in (my) theory this was the perfect spot, but it took me 3 h to get to the near service area "SchÃ¶nbuch" at the motorway. A local told me that many people rather take the other routes via B464 to BÃ¶blingen and B27 to Stuttgart.
it is good to go to the next gas station on the highway. there is a traffic light and you have better chances by the afternoon when the people are done with working
Cars going to Dresden use the left lane and don't stop...

I tried to hitchhike from here to Szczecin (Stettin), but it didn't work. There is a petrol station, but few cars stop here to refuel and it is on the other side of the street. I suggest you to walk a bit and go to the cross between B2 and Berliner Ring, it's much better.

If somebody tells you to go from Memmingen direction Lindau this way - don't believe them. It's a rather bad spot. I waited around 1-1,5 hours to get to the next rest area, which is on the wrong side of the highway and wasn't very cool either.

In principle it's legal, and in principle there's loads of traffic and a lot of place for cars to stop. In practice bored cops will send you away.
But if you're fast...
It might be wise to either walk to the A14 or take bus number 6 or 6A and get off at Raben-Steinfeld and walk the rest.
I think this bus stop was is the best place to hitch for the 14 autobahn south to the A24, although it took 5 hours so there may be better...
Sufficient hard shoulder to stand on, but extremely low traffic on this on-ramp.
only very few traffic here.

> A9

either bad luck or bad point, I got stuck there with a friend, following directions we found on a website. Definitely change hitching place!
no one stops for leipzig
direction magdeburg, may work but dangerous place for drivers to stop; under construction may get better
Almost no traffic here.

Tryed to get on the A8 here today and as there is no good place to stop I wouldn't reccoment to try it. Besides no good place to stop there are two major things to consider - first a plus; manny cars go by; second - there are plenty directions where they could go, most likely not yours -.-
Bus stop direction Rheine. Good to lift out of this village to Rheine or the A30 ramp.Bus only 2x a day to Rheine!
Reconstructed traffic intersection

Bad hitchhiking spot near Meerane, although if you find yourself stuck in the area it seems to be the best place to hitchhike from. However you really should consider taking a train to Zwickau or Chemnitz, and trying from one of those places instead. As you can see on the satellite image there is very little traffic on this road, but like anywhere you will get rides if you look desperate enough. I got a car to stop by doing an 'emergency' signal on the side of the road and holding out a sign wit
No real space to stop cars, busy traffic light but hard to stop cars there. Better get to OS-Nahne, most traffic into the city.
Ramp "Lotte", not much traffic and also not the best place for cars to stop. Most will only to towards Laggenbeck or IbbenbÃƒÂ¼ren. Prepare yourself for a long waiting time :)
Nearly no traffic, you need to have luck to hitch here. Well space for cars to stop, but not for trucks. Better try the ramp or go back. Empty area!
Traffic is to fast to stop. most cars will not go to the highway but go straight ahead. i hh here twice. Once i get a lift after 40min. next time i waited over 100min and finally gave up!
there was much traffic on the road on tuesday evening but really nobody was willing to give me a lift

For Berlin itÃ‚Â´s much better to start from Fackenburger Allee/LohmÃƒÂ¼hle and go via Hamburg!
In St. Hubertus wait up to 2 hours.

good place to hh
direction of Liege, Namur, Bruxeles. Hh  times and stops only womens :)

on a friday morning (even on a day when holidays in bavaria were started) it took me over 2 hours to get away with my "salzburg" sign and also only to munich city. there is only low traffic on this station
Few traffic that goes to the highway.
it is not easy to get a lift from here. the drivers will see you late because of the curve and the bridge in front of you, also there is not to many traffic. it might require luck to get away
it might be better on weekdays, but there is nearly no traffic on weekends
Pretty bad spot to hitch onto the A31 or B54, fast traffic and no spots for cars to stop.Do not get out here!
I stood here for over 3 hours. I tried both the entrance and the exit, and nothing!

Direction North.
200-250 Cars per Hour pass by. Only ~15% of them will enter the highway. Go there by bus (line 692 -> Mellendorf. Stop: Autobahn). That busstop is where the cars can stop for you. Busticket: 2,70Ã¢â€šÂ¬ from Hanover center. That place to start is in nature, so it's nice :) If noone picks you up, you will find a place to sleep at a construction site (there are many) in the village Weiherfeld.
People can stop, but drive fast yet, there are different lines but mainly people are going to A6 the south.

Directions : both
No place for the cars to stop on the B20 (and they go really fast). Very few cars come from Falkenberg if you wait at the Stop sign. However, I was lucky, after 1 hour, to be taken by one.

some strange guys let me there with my friend on the road to Prague, at midnight, in the forest... bad plan. If it happens to you, cross the bridge and walk 30minutes to WÃƒÂ¶rth, There is a metro station to Karlshrue
good to go to radolfzell, not many people there
looks like a good spot, cuz all the traffic which leaves the island has to pass this (perfect)spot. but somehow in almost 2 hours just a lady stopt.

This is the last rest stop on this highway before the ferries from Rostock, and it also contains a ticket booth where one can purchase ferry tickets. So you'd think that it would be a good place to scout out a ride on the ferries to Denmark, but no, not so much. I waited several hours. Perhaps I need to brush up on my German, or maybe it was just a bad day.

You could think: nice place under the bridge in direction of Freiburg, at the entrance of the highway. There's enough space for drivers to stop, and not so many cars. But for some strange reason, no one stopped in three hours.
Small petrol station with lots of local traffic, but got a lift to a good station on A3 heading north after 45 minutes
if you wanna go north, go somewhere else, cars can't stop here, standing on this street makes no sense.
not very good to hitchhike towards Tuttlingen
We tried it 2,5 hour but there was'nt any person going to the south. Only Berliners.
bad place for getting to A5 over the Ring; at least mid-week before noon and it's not very good to stop 'cause it's the left lane in front of the traffic light
Very bad place. Mainly trucks but not enough.
Tried to get to the A3 going south from here. Took ages.
There is a little chance to go out of this city. The is enough place to stop the car, but not many cars go there. Direction to Oldenburg.

Place to go in direction A1, trier, witlich...
cars driving too fast, but place form them to stop.

Was hitching from here some months ago,it took me quite some time till I found a ride.
I was asking people directly at the gas station.
This spot is quite easy to reach from Worms train station, you can take a bus and then walk for a bit.
Cars are driving quit fast and there is just a small area to stop. Anyway, many cars in direction of Waldshut, even on a Sunday.

Just trying yo get to the gas station five kilometers down the road. Germans at their grumpiest! There is a theoretical space to pull over, but nobody cared. The Serb-Croat duo who eventually stopped just stopped in the middle of the on-ramp. Traffic is moderate (Monday around 1pm).
Better than it looks at first glance. However, wouldn't recommend it as a first choice due to a bit of chaotic traffic. (1 M, 1 F)
Ramp to the highway. There is a little but of grass to stop, but not much traffic joining the highway. Got a ride to the next gas station south.
Wanted to go east to Karlsruhe and waited for 2 hours without luck. Once we changed our sign homburg we got a ride in less than 10 minutes.
Had a Munich sign, but changed that to Lindau B31, not many people entering the highway in direction Munich
if you want to go to ulm or south it's an okay spot, not a lot of cars and traffic tho. we wanted to follow the A8 but decided to change plans after 2h because we couldnâ€™t find a car going there.
cars are quite fast, lots of local traffic. not easy to get a ride.
I thought the Spot was really good to get to the A5 but we waited quite a long time and mist people went to a different direction
Waited as a couple over 2h on a friday, there was a traffic jam down the road and most cars were packed with familys
Riding as a couple

Not much place to stop, but its possible, yet I wouldnt recommend this spot since many people change directions so its hard to find a car heading to your direction, there is also not much traffic, a car pulled over and took us to an exit few kilometers away, where it was better to hitchhike

No one took us, but that may be because we wanted to go towards NÃ¼rnberg which is relatively far and it was Monday late morning. The street leads straight to the highway and one is well seen and there is a good place for the cars to stop, though.
Not many people stop

In and of itself probably a good spot for hitchhikers, seeing as many people going far on the highway stop here. However, be aware that there are very few other stops along the A38; if you end up at Querfurt and donâ€™t find a ride to wherever youâ€™re going, youâ€™re going to be stranded. There is nothing within walking distance. I would also avoid going there at night. We were dropped off at 11 in the evening and didnâ€™t end up catching a ride until early morning.
Hard to reach (bus 4euro, no path from field, fence). People come here to pee on trees, you can talk to them.
Bad spot because cars canâ€™t really slow down, but got picked up fast by pure luck.

Donâ€™t do this spot unless you absolutely have too, itâ€™s dangerous, especially if cars donâ€™t merge on time. I got picked up by a guy who did a U-turn to get me since itâ€™s was so bad, he dropped me off 10 minutes later at a gas station where I got a ride close to stuttgart.
There are no nice spots in the area for cars to stop, donâ€™t go to Erlangen Nord
Terrible place, do not get a ride here. I was lucky and got a ride to next exit, i.e. Wittlich, try to hitchhike from there as it sees much more traffic.
Do not recommend getting stuck here late, very few cars but finally someone stopped going to Mayen and dropped me off at Eltzal Sud Rastplatz.
not much volume of traffic

Perhaps the only viable spot on this road since Wolgast, but even then it is very uncomfortable for cars to stop, from here onwards all the roadside is full of trees basically next to the road with no space and there are silly bollards due to that all along the road, your best chance is the first bus stop in Zinnowitz but even that is a very iffy, I'd try to avoid getting stuck between the middle of these villages, wait times of 120+ minutes for sure

Almost noone uses this exit to go east direction, most cars go towards west, wait times of over 100+ minutes expected, no street lights, people didnt seem nice, I'd probably ask to get out to the road towards Tessin and try to go that direction to highway

Easy if you're going direction MÃ¼nchen or to Rosenheim. Not many cars going to Salzburg. We waited for quite a long time, finally some german youngsters took us when it was getting dark. Wouldn't recommend, even if there's a lot of traffic not much for direction Salzburg.

A fairly long wait despite afternoon rush hour traffic, also not much space for drivers to stop. I wouldn't recommend this spot, we were trying to get to Frankfurt and I think the on ramp to the A3 a little further down the road is better.
A random guy saw me walking at 9 pm and decided to help me out by helping me get to the Netherlands. Not a good spot in general tho Iâ€™d say
Completely stupid you are standing more or less on the highway, but got off here and had no choice

Someone pulled over after I was standing there for about an hour and asked if I am OK and if I need help, (I was actually looking pretty normal) so people aren't used to hitchhiking there I guess, not a good place, not many cars

Iâ€™ve got really mixed experiences about this spot. I have found a car in less than 30 minutes sometimes, and other times it has taken over an hour until I found a car taking me in my direction (this spot might be better if youâ€™re only looking to stay on the 27, in my case I had to get on the highway 1, both directions are tricky)

this parking spot is bit shitty. There is not so much trafic going through and many of the people who stop there make just a break before picking up somebody from airport. We waited 3 hours to find a lift on A5 beyond Frankfurt.
Very few cars and sleeping people in trucks. You could get stuck.
The gas station is full of locals, cars here are also locals, besides insults didn't get  ride within a hour so just walked away, try to avoid
No any good spots towards Friedrichsdorf, only locals and not that much traffic, just decided to walk after 20 or so minutes
Very difficult spot for going north, also the lights are quite poor there, waited about a 40 minutes before got lucky, but I advise trying to hitch somewhere else (had a sing for Niedernhausen)

Tried both this and the Jet petrol station south but neither had any cars going any distance north, the road is pretty unhitchable at least during the day towards north here, lots of traffic, but hopeless, just kept on walking for a hope for a better spot

the only Gas station directly on the highway between Rostock and Greifswald.
It serves both directions but there were more people for direction east. I was ther on a work day noon in winter. There was not super much trafic but some cars would still come. Most people were going to Poland or Stralsund. One person would be driving towards schwerin, one person to magdeburg. Few people were going to Rostock and on a ferry to Denmark. Only few people were going west. It took me 4 hours until a person

There were also few people going to Czech. But yeah it was generaly very little cars to ask. In the end i gave up on the spot and hitched on a regional road to A9.
Not easy to get to Praha
Not very good since people cant really stop but we ended up getting a ride to baden baden

I appeared at this spot accidentally because my previous driver accidentally made a mistake and took other way to Leverkusen than he planned before. I think there is much local traffic there, going to Dusseldorf, Duisburg and Leve
Not recomanable spot. I was on the way to Hannover. Better get out on the parking place before. The controller of the workers gave me a ride, so until the new petrolstation is builded get out before!

Don't get stuck here, better ask someone to drop you off somewhere else. Not much traffic and directions of cars are very unpredictable

Long waiting time and no place to sleep in the night. Don't get tricked by the green dot's in Germany! It's very hard to get a ride here... Only people from abroad help you. Germans are very proud of themselves and are afraid of thieves. Asking for a ride is like: no we don't take hitchhikers, ahh we're going the other way sorry, (nothing he act like he can't see you)
It was better than previous spots I've been to but still very difficult to get a ride in direction of Stuttgart. It's good that there's a burger King on the station

Very hard to catch anything! The station is very big but Germans are very hard people for hitchhikers... It was hard to get a ride to A6 from here. Everyone is going to Munich. Very good spot to sleep tho! Just go on the hill next to the station and walk to the north till you see a depression in the dirt. There's a nice forest to put a tent. It was very cozy but there's a lot of human "waste" on the way. For me the best option

If you wanna go north, it's a quite bad spot cause most of the cars go towards A96/Mindelheim.  If you come from Kempten, ask around at the rest stop 'AllgÃ¤uer Tor' till you get a ride across motor way chunction 'Memmingen'

First we (me and husband) stood there with a sight to Landshut for 40minutes and nobody would take us, then we figured that it was a bad spot to go to the south as the resting-station is very near the city and also going to the wrong direction for us. When we decided to try and get just a lift to some random better stop we signaled just with our thumbs and within 5 minutes someone took us a few kilometers south to a better spot (to â€œPendlerparkplatz Bad Abbachâ€)

Before we write a sign to Kassel, one old man stopped us, but it was more luck then advantage of the spot. And he took us only to some weirdly big gas station out of the city, where we stucked for cca 3 hours. But maybe, i think it is good spot, traffic is strong there to A70 and A7. But big problem is Schweinfurt at all, because locals do not stop, it is a deaf place. Hitchhikers in Wurzburg told us the same. So it is better to run away from Schweinfurt.
Von Ankum ins Fiz!

a big parking but difficult to get there by walking.
even though it is a car park but there is no people at all, you could only hitchhike the cars that are stopped by the traffic lights.
this is the only good spot we found to hitchhike out of Offenburg to continue south, not a great spot but someone can take you to highway
Locla traffic, but you can ask that they bring you to the next gas station
Attente de 2h. TrÃ¨s peu de voiture privÃ©, que ces travailleurs de la ville

got a ride to Munich after 20 min of waiting on a Saturday around noon.
not very good place to stop for drivers but its absolutely possible.

Not a good lift point!
I waite 45min until i had ride.

Actually it seems to be a good spot. Many cars are passing, mainly coming from the parking spaces and going to the Highways. But I waited there 1 1/2 hours and nobody stopped. Finally I went to the gas station near the "briefzentrum" busstop by bus 365 and got a lift after 10min...
A lot of the cars seem to stay in Hamburg. Too much trafic during the rush hours.

To go north, either you'd have to get the left-turners, they stop at some traffic-lights, next to their line is a slim, but secure area where you can stand. The right-turners can stop at a bus-stop. We gave up.

It's a bad place if you want to go direction west to highway A81, Konstanz or what so ever.
Well it maybe a good spot if you wanna go south because people leave the high way here to avoid toll in Bregenz. I then got a lift to station and took the train back home since it was my last 100 km :)
bad for hitchhiking to Berlin

Never ever go there, I don't know who marked that spot, but I'am quite sure he or she has never been there because you just can't get on the motorway there wether it is the A8 to Munich/Stuttgart or the B10. There's no on ramp on the motorway its just a crossing for the A8 and the B10 without a possibilty to get on or off the motorway.

If you arrive here, walk directly until another exit or to the trainstation, because I wait 4 hours with different signs (North, DK, german cities and also without signs) and except insults nobody answer me (Hi hitchhike since 10 000km, worst spot of my trip).
No cars going to Hamburg, other directions ok
Its a good place, a lot of cars, but there are possible a short lift to suburb or gas station on A2, the best in Hanover on direction to Berlin.
Tried this place before I knew about hitchwiki on my first hitchhiking trip to Berlin. This place is terrible, after a long try we just gave up and went to another place..
I spent here amost 2 hours, but i couldn't hitch any car to Berlin or Magdeburg. waiting here is senseless

Reached this station at midnight on a Friday to continue towards Germany. Probably not the best idea but we were stuck here all throughout the night (it was horrible). Lots of trucks but very few cars. Even in the morning we couldn't find anyone. We ended up getting on the other side of the highway (there's a small underground passage) and hitchhike back to "Aire de Longeville" and getting a ride to Strasbourg. Best decision ever
nothing going on here. Didn't get a ride. really few cards.
We were trying to reach Stuttgart from this spot bus it was the worse. In more than 1h30 just a few cars stop to take gas but werenâ€™t going to the highway. I donâ€™t recommend at all

Gut aus SaarbrÃ¼cken heraus zu erreichen aber wenig Verkehr hÃ¤lt an dieser Tanke (nur noch Tanke, Imbiss ist geschlossen). 
Hatte GlÃ¼ck und hab Leute aus meiner Heimat getroffen nach ca, 45 Minuten Richtung Heidelberg.

Good to reach from SaarbrÃ¼cken but not many traffic. There ist just a petrol station (no more Bistro).
I had luck and meet people from my home area after round 45 minutes in Direction Heidelberg.

Terrible spot if you want to get on the highway. Either local traffic or truckers who just sleep there. Go to THIS spot instead http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?place=22635. Worked like a charm. You'll need a sign there so on your way there check the dumpsters for some cardboard.

Don't be here after 12:00 noon. Everyone in the afternoon goes to Coburg itself or to Sonnefeld if you're lucky - waited here and asked around for 2.5 hours and had to ask someone on the street to crash at their couch. Arrived the day after, got a ride almost to the town over north bc I was so desperate to get out. Huge nope

We got out of the previous car here at the OMV, we tried to hitch for like 5 mins and saw that its a very bad place. So we tried to walk around in Coburg looking for a better place but we didnt really find one, so after a couple hours we came back. We waited there from 11pm to 2.30 am at the night in time of the Samba Festival in Coburg. It was cold and dark, all people went to the festival. It was a very bad place, because there is almost no traffic in the A73 motorway. Do NOT hitchhike to Cobu
Dont know what to say about this spot .Hitchhikimg there to Amsterdam really difficult. Everybody is full and lots of them are going the opposite way.
Really bad spot, after 2h of waiting we approached a dutch guy who took us over the border
this is a station for locals not people heading to the autobahn. Try not to stop here.
Autohof next to the autobahn.

Two guys hitchhiking south via the A7 or to Frankfurt. Although it seems like a spot which could get traffic both north and south, this was sadly not the case. After 6 hours we gave up and hiked to an on-ramp 5 km further north. A lot of lokal traffic as well. Do not use for going south.
This location made me realize that German motorists are not necessarily that familiar with license plate abbreviations.
Very bad spot if you want to go to the north. Almost all cars are going south or to the surrounding villages. After 3 hours without getting a ride north of Hamburg, we gave up and took a bus.
Traffic lights hold the traffic, but cars driving fast no place to pull aside.

direction: Gorlitz (Zgorzelec), Poland
Neither good nor bad place - there are traffic lights, holding cars for such a long time, and comfortable lawn to hitch just by the lane - but in fact it can be a problem to hitch if there is more than one person.
waited for more than 2 hours. 1000 cars  in hour and no one stoped to take me to the south. After changing my strategy couple of times, finally i changed my place :D
Description: Getting on A5 direction South (Darmstadt, Karlsruhe, Basel) standing on Schwanheimer Ufer using your thumb. You can get here from S-Bahn station "Griesheim"

I suggest you try this spot http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?place=22635 nearby. Worked really well.

really bad place! only local traffic, except some shopping-tourism going back to france. nearly hopeless to go in directing of e.g. karlsruhe (march 12)

yes and don't even think about getting on the highway to the north, these locals never go there

a great place for hitchiking masochists. if you get to this hellish gas stations somehow, just kill yourself. or start walking in any direction away. (but if you still get stuck there like us, you can get a but from gross mackenstedt)
not possible to get away from this place!
very senseless!
No possibility to get a lift to the south!
useless to berlin : prefer go back to dresden and begin from there
The airport is the worst idea you can do. You have only one chance and that is to aproach people and ask them on the parking spot for rentalcars. Do not go there.

Don't accept a ride to the airport and get stuck here if you want to go somewhere else than Berlin. 

Full of taxis, Bolts, private taxis - none of them can take you.

This place was convinient to find someone to go to Berlin.

When we were at the Terminal 1 where people go to drop-off or pick-up people, we found some Polish cars though than went to Sczecin.

Scenic crossroad BUT basically useless for highway travelling - - - - A friendly driver from GÃ¶rlitz took a detour to get me on the A13 to Berlin - unfortunately just village traffic. Eventually a guy came to get me to the next toilet stop on the highway.
waited for 8 hours for a ride to Flensburg. Not a lot of cars pulling in and the truck drivers called the police on us when we tried to sleep there.
absolutely horrendous. would rather fight my way out of gulag than to be dropped off here ever again
if you are here you lost
Gas station, but people going only to local destinations. Little traffic. People confused. I nearly died there.
Rest station. JANUARY 2016 no way to get out of here.
Tried to get to the centre. But nobody just stopped.
At the junction. Fast traffic and no space. Terrible spot.

J'ai essaye de faire du stop ici avec un carton MUNICH, j'ai arrete au bout d'une heure force de constate que personne ne pourrait s'arreter la...

I tried to hich-hick here with a sign MUNCHEN. I understood quicly it's a bad place and go to other place.
looks like a good position, but cars drive fast here, so its difficult for them to stop

Senseless, if you are on the way from Prague to Berlin. A tiny reststation with not so many cars passing by, mostly local traffic. Have to hitch into Dresden and use public transport through the city anyway in case to reach better spot.

Worst place ever, if trying to get onto the 4/A 553. Have been waiting for about 3 hours before anyone got away from there.

Got offered a couple of local hikes though.
Very bad spot. It is just not possible to stop and give you a lift to the West (B311)

We spend almost whole day trying to get out of here. We tried every possible spot around Ikea and petrol station and parking lots. But the cars  were full with furniture and had no place for us or going different direction. The bus stop on Franktufter Strasse saved us.
traffic light at the street to a 643 twoards a66 (frankfurt). friend recommended it to me, but don't go there! there's no chance you finde someone to take you - no traffic, only locals...

Little parking place. Not many cars stopped there.
On-ramp near Bardowick. Useless to get around LÃ¼neburg towards Uelzen. Spot is bad and you'd need multiple rides to get around. Better to walk.

i got droped of at Autohof Altenwerder BÃ¤rbel Uliczka, crossed the train traks and walked under the bridges to this dangerous spot, but you can stand in between the two roads and ask people at the trafic light, just got a ride to the other side of the tunnel, and it is better to take the bus to the other side of the tunnel. A7 towards kiel/flensburg

I think this marker is obsolete as they have changed all the roads at the airport. A little further earlier on the road, right by the departure (upper level) or arrival (lower level) gates works fine.

Trying to get out of the airport, we were going south on A3. only for direction leipzig/berlin:
really bad place! mostly local traffic just to lobeda - locals going to leipzig seem to use b7 avoiding the hermsdorfer kreuz - try there!

Schwierig. Wenn du in den SÃ¼den fahren mÃ¶chtest Stell dich nahe der Auffahrt der A2 an der Detmolder Str.(Stieghorst/Sieker)  hin und fahr erst nach Hannover und dann auf die A7 Richtung Kassel etc.
try to avoid this ramp, theres hardly no chance to get a lift (if you get off there you should rather walk to aschendorf and take the train...)

Schlechte anhalte Punkte :-( 
Besser mit dem Bus zum Rastplatz in Urloffen.
Almost nobody stops here.
bad place to stop, and its not allowed to stop as well

Fuel station and fast food restaurants near the highway.
I got dropped off here, even after asking the driver to leave me at a resthof on the autobahn. Ick. This spot is NOT GOOD. There's no space for cars to stop, it's loud and chaotic, etc. Don't bother.

Not a good spot, far from motorway, few cars and many of them local. I ended up there because driver thought that it is the  BAB Frankenhole Nord station which in reality is some 20 km further and this place is not on the map (at least not on mine) so it is possible to take this for other one. Terrible hitchhiking spot at Meerane. Meerane is way too quiet, and there is no long distance traffic here whatsoever. If you get stuck here, your best bet is to take a train to Zwickau or Chemnitz, or try your luck on the A4/B93 junction. As I was on the way to Poland and my driver did a 50km detour to here (all the way from the A9) because he was sure that dropping me off at Meerane's McDonalds was a good idea. He shouldn't have bothered. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Meerane

no car can stop here...its a bypass road and there is almost no space for you to place yourself. also the cars are coming with over 100km/h and the road is curved...so they cannot see you. better go to fÃƒÂ¼rstenwalde west and try your luck there!
Nearly no traffic along this road, and even less going onto the highway towards the NL. Forget it!

not possible to go to the direction of Poland, nobody drives there and the only person who goes there is an impolite person typical for that region.
watting for 2 hour - no responce, bad traffic.

you can see which cars are going towards berlin and dresden, but staying here is quite dangerous, there's a police station nearby so you can get caught, and even if drivers want to help you, not many will stop since their speed is over 100km/h. if you end up here; you can always hope for a rescue from someone who feels sorry for you and is quick enough to stop before A13.

i you want to go Berlin don't stay at this spot, it's better to walk troughout the field to reach the next petrolstation located 5km on the bottom

was trying to get to Poland, no pick up, really tough spot and people were rude ://
